If you enjoy diving into a world of epic battles between Gods, good, and evil, then 'Kalki 2898 AD' offers quite a satisfying audio-visual experience, even though it may require some patience.
Kooki's journey urges viewers to understand that justice isn't always healing, and the fight for true safety continues.
The overall message of 'Sharmaajee Ki Beti' is not to provide happy endings or instantly break age-old notions but to remind viewers to love, respect, and treat women equally and deservedly. And this
‘Rautu Ka Raaz’ is a slow-moving murder mystery that sustains its suspenseful atmosphere, keeping viewers intrigued as the mystery unfolds.
'A Quiet Place: Day One' is a visually stunning and suspenseful thrill ride, but narrative inconsistencies and a shift in tone hold it back from reaching the heights of its predecessors.
‘Fancy Dance’ firmly shines a spotlight on the indigenous community of the United States, offering an unflinching portrayal of their lives.

Rohit Sharma won the T20 World Cup 2024 for India in West Indies. In 2023, under his captaincy India went to the finals of ODI World Cup but could not cross the line in the final match against Australia.
Image Source: ANI
Rohit Sharma announced his retirement from T20I after winning the 2024 T20 World Cup. He led his team from front and he was the second highest run scorer in the tournament.
Image Source: AFP
Rohit is the only Indian player to win two T20 World Cup trophies. He has played in every T20 World Cup since its inception in 2007.
Image Source: Agencies
MS Dhoni won the inaugural T20 World Cup in 2007. This victory is a landmark moment in Indian cricket history, marking the beginning of the 'Captain Cool' era.
Image Source: Agencies
MS Dhoni's team was young and bold with most of the senior players opting out of the tournament. Yuvraj Singh was the player of the tournament in 2007 World Cup.
Image Source: Agencies
MS Dhoni went on to become the most successful captain in India as he won T20 World Cup, ODI World Cup and Champions trophy.
Image Source: Agencies
Kapil Dev's Indian team defeated the mighty West Indies, who had won the last two World Cups since its inception, preventing them from achieving a hat-trick of World Cup victories.
Image Source: Agencies
In 1983, Kapil Dev became the first Indian captain to win a World Cup, putting Indian cricket on the global map.
Image Source: Agencies
Kapil Dev's Indian team was struggling at 4 wickets for 9 runs when he walked in to bat during the 1983 World Cup. He scored 175 runs in that match and led his team to a crucial victory.
Image Source: Agencies

Bharti Jain is senior editor with The Times of India, New Delhi. She has been writing on security matters since 1996. Having covered the Union home ministry, security agencies, Election Commission and the ‘prime’ political beat, the Congress, for The Economic Times all these years, she moved to TOI in August 2012. Her repertoire of news stories delves into the whole gamut of issues related to terrorism and internal strife, besides probing strategic affairs in India’s neighbourhood.Read More

Pakistan unable to accept more Afghan refugees

Pakistan's national security adviser said Wednesday that his country cannot host any more Afghan refugee for several reasons, including financial constraints. "Pakistan is in no condition right now to accept any more refugees,'' Moeed Yusuf told a news conference in the capital, Islamabad. He said Pakistan is already hosting more than 3 million Afghan refugees who had fled the war and violence in their country over the past decades. Yusuf said Pakistan will try to do whatever is possible to help Afghans, but that international efforts should step up to prevent a humanitarian crisis. He asked the world community not to repeat the past mistake of abandoning Afghanistan.
Taliban should be given incentives instead of being forced to do something: Imran Khan

Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan on Wednesday suggested that the Taliban should be given incentives to handle the current situation instead of being forced to do something and claimed it would be a "fallacy" to think that Afghanistan could be controlled from outside. The Pak PM, in an interview to CNN's Becky Anderson, asserted that the best way forward for peace and stability in the war-torn country is to engage with the Taliban, which seized Kabul last month. "So rather than sitting here and thinking that we can control them, we should incentivise them because this current government in Afghanistan clearly feels that without international aid and help they will not be able to stop this crisis. We should push them in the right direction,” he said. Read more

Afghanistan would either gain lasting peace or end up in chaos, says Pak PM Imran Khan
Joe Biden top aides discouraged abrupt Afghan pullout, book says

President Joe Biden's top cabinet members unsuccessfully tried to dissuade him from pulling all US troops from Afghanistan, hoping he would leverage the withdrawal to seek a political settlement, a new book says. Secretary of State Antony Blinken and Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin pushed for a slower drawdown to encourage negotiations between the Taliban and Afghan government, according to "Peril," a forthcoming book by famed investigative journalist Bob Woodward co-authored with his Washington Post colleague Robert Costa. Read more

President Joe Biden's top cabinet members unsuccessfully tried to dissuade him from pulling all US troops from Afghanistan, hoping he would leverage the withdrawal to seek a political settlement, a new book says. Secretary of State Antony Blinken and Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin pushed for a slower drawdown to encourage negotiations between the Taliban and Afghan government, according to "Peril," a forthcoming book by famed investigative journalist Bob Woodward co-authored with his Washington Post colleague Robert Costa.

According to reports from Washington, the US has frozen about $ 9.5 billion in assets belonging to Afghanistan's central bank and stopped shipments of cash to Kabul, in a bid to keep the Taliban government from accessing the money.

China on Wednesday supported the Taliban's demand that the US should unfreeze Afghanistan's assets and said that America has no legitimate reasons to do so as the Chinese envoy to Kabul called on acting Afghan Foreign Minister Amir Khan Muttaqi and congratulated the interim government.
Taliban army chief says those who defend democracy will be suppressed

The Chief of Army Staff of the Taliban, Fasihudin, has said that those who defend democracy in Afghanistan and oppose the Taliban will be suppressed. He added that they will suppress all those who defend the gains of the past two decades under the name of specific ethnic groups or resistance in Afghanistan, Khaama News reported.
Security blocs led by Russia, China meet on Afghanistan

Countries allied with Russia and China were preparing for a series of meetings on Afghanistan Wednesday held in the crisis-hit country's neighbour, Tajikistan. Moscow and Beijing have moved to assert themselves as key players in the region, after the United States' hasty retreat from Afghanistan and the Taliban's takeover of the country. Two regional security blocs led by Moscow and Beijing are holding summits in the capital of ex-Soviet Tajikistan, Dushanbe, this week along with other countries attending as observers and guests.
Taliban seize $12.4 million from former top Afghan officials

Afghanistan's Taliban-controlled central bank said it had seized nearly $12.4 million in cash and gold from former top government officials on Wednesday, including former vice president Amrullah Saleh. In a statement, the central bank said the money and gold had been kept in officials' houses, although it did not yet know for what purpose. Saleh's whereabouts are unknown. He has vowed to resist the Taliban, who stormed to power a month ago, and last week a family member said the Taliban had executed his brother Rohullah Azizi. Read more

Afghanistan's Taliban-controlled central bank said it had seized nearly $12.4 million in cash and gold from former top government officials on Wednesday, including former vice president Amrullah Saleh. In a statement, the central bank said the money and gold had been kept in officials' houses, although it did not yet know for what purpose. Saleh's whereabouts are unknown. He has vowed to resist the Taliban, who stormed to power a month ago, and last week a family member said the Taliban had executed his brother Rohullah Azizi.
Afghan origin Indian national allegedly kidnapped in Kabul, Afghanistan

An Afghan origin Indian national Bansri Lal Arendeh (about 50) who belongs to Hindu Khost community of Afghanistan was allegedly abducted at gunpoint from Kabul in the morning on Tuesday, September 14, told Puneet Singh Chandhok, President of Indian World Forum. As per the information, Arendeh whose family lives in Faridabad, Delhi NCR region is a businessman who deals in pharmaceutical products at Afghanistan for last two decades and he along with staff was going towards his shop in Kabul when the incident took place. Read more

China backs Taliban's demand to US to unfreeze Afghanistan's assets

China on Wednesday supported the Taliban's demand that the US should unfreeze Afghanistan's assets and said that America has no legitimate reasons to do so as the Chinese envoy to Kabul called on acting Afghan Foreign Minister Amir Khan Muttaqi and congratulated the interim government. According to reports from Washington, the US has frozen about $9.5 billion in assets belonging to Afghanistan's central bank and stopped shipments of cash to Kabul, in a bid to keep the Taliban government from accessing the money.
Panjshir resistance to declare parallel govt in Afghanistan

In response to the new cabinet announced by the Taliban for the Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan, the resistance front in Panjshir province led by Ahmad Massoud has said that they will declare a parallel government in the country after consultations. The front termed the Taliban's caretaker government as illegitimate and a vivid enmity with the people of Afghanistan, Khaama News reported. Read more

In response to the new cabinet announced by the Taliban for the Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan, the resistance front in Panjshir province led by Ahmad Massoud has said that they will declare a parallel government in the country after consultations. The front termed the Taliban's caretaker government as illegitimate and a vivid enmity with the people of Afghanistan, Khaama News reported.
Thousands protest in Afghanistan's Kandahar against evacuation order by Taliban

Thousands of people in Afghanistan's Kandahar held a protest on Wednesday after being ordered by the Taliban to vacate their houses. The provincial officers of the Taliban-led Afghanistan government told the families living in the division of the Afghanistan national army land to vacate their houses in three days, reported The Khaama News Press Agency. "We have been living in this place for 20 years, we agree that this is a government place, but we have built a house here. The Taliban have been saying for days that we should evacuate these houses," a protestor said, reported TOLOnews.
Iran's Alalam TV says flights between Iran and Afghanistan resumed
First passenger plane from Iran arrives in Afghanistan: Report

The first passenger flight from Iran landed in the Afghan capital on Wednesday since the Taliban's takeover, Sputnik reported citing a Kabul airport source. There were 14 people on board the aircraft from Iran, the source said. The Taliban on Monday said that while domestic flights had resumed in Afghanistan, "a little bit of work" was still required for international flights to resume, because of heavy damage to the Kabul airport. The Taliban last week announced its caretaker government in Kabul.
Pakistan's provincial govt backs recognition of Taliban rule in Afghanistan
Pakistan's provincial government in the Khyber Pakhtunkhwa region has extended full support for recognising the Taliban regime in Afghanistan, local media reported on Wednesday. (ANI)
According to Pakistan's information minister Fawad Chaudhry, the Afghan women soccer players entered in Pakistan though the northwestern Torkham border crossing holding valid travel documents.
It was unclear how many Afghan women players and their family members were allowed to enter in Pakistan.
Afghan female footballers evade Taliban, reach Pakistan

Thirty-two women football players from Afghanistan, who were facing threats from the Taliban, have reached Pakistan along with their families after the government issued emergency humanitarian visas to evacuate them, according to a media report on Wednesday.

Your skincare routine is always incomplete without a hydrating and moisturising face cream. Face creams are a compulsory thing in the beauty market today. Beauty influencers and doctors recommend people opt for a lightweight and hydrating face cream keeping away from acne and dry skin issues as it perfectly blends with your skin and should be a staple in your beauty regime. To get a hydrating and moisturising glow, the best face cream for you should be the mixture of aloe vera and kesar and should be applied every day.

You need to have fresh and natural saffron strands and infuse them in warm water to release their essence. Let them cool down, and now in a clean bowl, combine 2 tablespoons of aloe vera gel, 1 tablespoon of almond oil, and 2 vitamin E capsules. Now mix them well. Gradually add the saffron-infused water along with 1 tablespoon of rose water, and blend until you have achieved a smooth and creamy consistency. Now, transfer this mixture into an airtight container and start the application.
(Image Credits: Pinterest)

If you wish to achieve a naturally radiant complexion, then start applying this cream at night and let it seep into your skin. This also diminishes the appearance of fine lines and wrinkles, saying goodbye to pesky dark spots, and also combats visible signs of ageing for a youthful and revitalized look. Apply this cream on your face and neck before bedtime for a freshly cleansed face. Also, keep this in your fridge for up to two weeks complete the application within the given time lab, and start with another batch.
(Image Credits: Pinterest)

People also use the mixture in a format of get which also comes with other herbs and is a staple in many girl’s makeup vanity. It provides deep nourishment to the skin, improves complexion, reduces blemishes, regenerates it, and makes your skin petal soft and supple. It mainly depends on your preference if you wish to wear it as a cream or a face gel for better absorption.
(Image Credits: Pinterest)

Saffron may trigger mood swings in people dealing with bipolar disorder. Women who are pregnant or in the process of breastfeeding should not use saffron, as when used with supplements, saffrons may cause problems for people having blood pressure medicines or dealing with blood thinners as well. Saffron also may lower the oestrogen level in women, but these claims are not scientifically sound yet.
(Image Credits: Pinterest)

Tigers are handsome, majestic and also endangered. These grand creatures roam across select regions of the world but India is proud to be home to the largest population. Places like Ranthambore and Bandhavgarh are known for their population of tigers. Russia's Amur tigers thrive in the vast forests of the Far East while Indonesia shelters Sumatran tigers in its dense rainforests. Nepal too protects tigers in Chitwan and Bardia National Parks and Malaysia's Malayan tigers roam the Malay Peninsula. Bangladesh also hosts Royal Bengal tigers in its mangrove forests.On this note, let’s have a look at countries with the maximum tiger population.

India leads the world with an impressive 3,167 tigers according to the latest 2022 census. The country is renowned for its expansive national parks like Ranthambore, Jim Corbett, and Bandhavgarh, where tigers roam freely. India is also a global leader in wild tiger conservation efforts.

Russia's tiger population is estimated to be between 480 and 540, primarily comprising the majestic Amur tigers. These Siberian tigers thrive in the vast forests of the Russian Far East, known for their grace, beauty, and grandeur.

Indonesia is known for its population of Sumatran tigers. There are some 371 Sumatran tigers living in Indonesia. These critically endangered subspecies are confined to the island of Sumatra. Amidst the lush rainforests and protected reserves, these elusive cats are threatened by human encroachment.

Nepal too is celebrated for its tiger conservation initiatives. The country is home to 355 tigers within its national parks and sanctuaries, including Chitwan and Bardia. These efforts underscore Nepal's commitment to safeguarding its rich biodiversity.

Malaysia hosts 120 Malayan tigers. These are predominantly found in the southern and central regions of the Malay Peninsula. Despite habitat fragmentation and poaching threats, conservation efforts continue to sustain these rare felines.

Bangladesh remains an important stronghold for the Royal Bengal tigers. There are approximately 106 tigers living in its dense mangrove forests and protected reserves. Efforts to mitigate human-wildlife conflict and ensure habitat connectivity are crucial to their survival.

Thailand shelters between 148 to 149 Indochinese tigers. These symbolise Southeast Asia's rich biodiversity. The tigers living within protected areas like Huai Kha Khaeng Wildlife Sanctuary face threats from illegal wildlife trade and habitat loss.

Lord Hanuman, the one who is a devotee before being a God, is one of the most powerful, and full of wisdom. Lord Hanuman is known to be the epitome of devotion, courage, and selfless service, and it was all evident during the Ramayana where he went above and beyond to serve Lord Ram.Today, people from all over the world worship him for his attributes. Plus, it is also believed that Lord Hanuman is always listening to his bhakts, removing obstacles, granting strength, and providing protection from evil.

It is said and believed that to please Lord Hanuman is the easiest. He is happy and content with pure devotion to him and to Lord Ram. And so, to receive his blessings, his devotees do the most simple tasks. For example, reading the Hanuman Chalisa, maintaining celibacy as he was a Brahmachary, fasting on Tuesdays, doing Ram jap, and the likes.

The Hanuman Chalisa, written by Tulsidas ji, is a forty-verse hymn that talks about and praises the virtues and deeds of Lord Hanuman. It is one of the most powerful and sacred prayers dedicated to Lord Hanuman and the different verses are the different attributes of him. From his ability to fight off evil to his blessing of retrieving the Sanjivani for Lakshman, it is the Hanuman Chalisa that packs it all in one simple book.But often, when people are in a rush or they do not have a Guru to teach them how to pronounce it right, they tend to skip words, mispronounce them, or just not know the right meanings.Here are a few things that should be kept in mind when reciting the Hanuman Chalisa.

One of the first things to do is to begin by sitting in a comfortable and meditative posture. Sit with your legs crossed, your hands in front of you, your spine straight, and your mind having an image of Lord Hanuman.This posture and visualisiations will help you focus your mind so that distractions don't come in your way and the image of Lord Hanuman in your head will help channel the energy towards the prayer.

Before the starting of the chaupai, there is one Doha and then one at the end. The starting one says ‘Shri Guru Charan Saroj Raj..’ and the one at the conclusion says ‘Pawan Tanaya Sankat Haran..’, one should make sure that they never skip reciting the two dohas from the Chalisa. The two dohas invoke the power and blessings of Lord Hanuman and thus should never be skipped.

People prefer to chant the Hanuman Chalisa or any other shloka or mantra in their mind. And while the silent recitation is good when it comes to keeping the mind focused, Hanuman Chalisa should not be recited inwardly. As mentioned in the Chalisa, it is a ‘Paath’. And a paath should be read aloud while feeling the vibrations and the energy that it emits.So, whenever chanting the Hanuman chalisa, make sure to read it aloud or play it on your speaker or phone in a volume that you’ll be able to hear it loud and clear and the positivity will surround you.

In the daily hustle and grind, the time we give to God is very limited. And so, most people only chant the Chalisa once or twice. But, it is said that Hanuman Chalisa should be chanted more times. As the Chalisa says ‘Jo shat baar paath kare koi, chhuthi bandhi Mahasukh hoi’. Which means, the person who chants the Hanuman Chalisa 100 times will be rid of any bondages and problems and will receive immense happiness.

As we read, memorise, and keep reciting the same words and sentences over and over, we usually do not focus on the meanings. And so, Guru Rambhadracharya ji had given a very important point to keep in mind, some years ago. He had said that while reciting the Chalisa, the name of Tulsidas ji should be replaced with your own name. The chaupai that states ‘Tulsidas sada hari chera’, should be replaced with the chanter’s name.

Police personnel face challenges adapting to the new BNS system despite years of using IPC sections. The CID updated the online FIR registration with BNS, providing support through training and a helpline amid the transition.

Police face challenges interpreting and applying the new criminal laws BNS, BNSS, and BSA, replacing old codes. Maharashtra police conducted training, provided translations, and prepared personnel for the transition, aiming for a smooth implementation.

Parenting is a challenging task, and being a single parent adds a unique set of difficulties. They face numerous hurdles, but with resilience, support, and effective coping strategies, they can navigate these challenges and provide a nurturing environment for their children. Here are 10 of the biggest problems single parents face:
Canva
Managing finances on a single income is tough. Covering basic needs, childcare, education, and emergencies can be overwhelming.
Canva
Balancing work, household responsibilities, and quality time with children can lead to exhaustion. Single parents often feel stretched too thin.
Canva
Single parents may experience loneliness, guilt, and anxiety. The emotional burden of raising a child alone can be significant.
Canva
Without a partner to share responsibilities, single parents may lack a support system, making it harder to cope with daily challenges.
Canva
Finding reliable and affordable childcare is often a struggle. Single parents may face difficulties in managing their work schedules around their children's needs.
Canva
Maintaining a career while being the sole caregiver is challenging. Single parents may find it difficult to advance in their careers or pursue personal interests.
Canva
Enforcing rules and discipline can be harder without another parent to back them up, leading to inconsistencies.
Canva
Single parents might find it hard to socialize or maintain friendships due to time constraints and responsibilities.
Canva

Parenting is a journey filled with joy, challenges, and constant learning. While every mother strives to do her best, mistakes are inevitable. Here are ten common parenting mistakes that every mother should learn from to ensure the holistic development and well-being of her children.
Canva

Why It Matters: Overprotective parenting can hinder a child’s ability to develop independence and problem-solving skills.How to Avoid: Allow your child to experience and navigate challenges on their own. Offer guidance but let them make decisions and learn from their mistakes.
Canva

Why It Matters: Inconsistent discipline can confuse children and lead to behavioral issues.How to Avoid: Set clear rules and consequences. Be consistent in enforcing them and ensure that both parents are on the same page.
Canva

Why It Matters: Comparing your child to others can damage their self-esteem and create unnecessary pressure.How to Avoid: Focus on your child's individual strengths and progress. Celebrate their unique qualities and achievements.
Canva

Why It Matters: Mothers who neglect their own well-being can become stressed and less effective in their parenting role.How to Avoid: Make time for self-care activities, whether it’s exercising, reading, or spending time with friends. A happy, healthy mother is better equipped to care for her children.
Canva

Why It Matters: Failing to listen to your child can make them feel undervalued and ignored.How to Avoid: Practice active listening. Show genuine interest in their thoughts and feelings, and validate their emotions.
Canva

Why It Matters: Overindulging children can lead to entitlement and lack of gratitude.How to Avoid: Set limits on material possessions and privileges. Teach your child the value of hard work and earning rewards.
Canva

Why It Matters: Emotional neglect can affect a child’s mental health and relationships.How to Avoid: Be emotionally available. Provide a supportive environment where your child feels safe to express their feelings.
Canva

Why It Matters: Setting unrealistic expectations can cause stress and anxiety in children.How to Avoid: Set achievable goals based on your child’s abilities and interests. Encourage effort and progress rather than perfection.
Canva

Why It Matters: Not spending enough quality time can weaken the parent-child bond.How to Avoid: Dedicate regular, undistracted time to engage in activities your child enjoys. Build memories through shared experiences.
Canva

Why It Matters: Avoiding difficult topics can leave children unprepared for real-world challenges.How to Avoid: Have open, honest discussions about topics like sex, drugs, and mental health. Equip your child with the knowledge to make informed decisions.
Canva

​Discover the rich diversity of Indian rivers, home to many unique fish species. These waters support a vibrant ecosystem, showcasing the beauty and variety of aquatic life in India.​
Pexels
​Barramundi, also called Asian sea bass, is found in the brackish waters of Indian rivers. It’s highly prized for its flavour and is a popular choice in local cuisine.​
Pexels
​Indian butterfish, also known as Indian mackerel, migrates into rivers for breeding. This small, oily fish is important in coastal and riverine fisheries and is favoured for its taste.​
Pexels
​Goonch, the giant devil catfish, is a formidable predator in Indian rivers. This massive fish is known for its strength and occasionally alarming folklore.​
Pexels
​Hilsa, Bangladesh’s national fish, migrates from the Bay of Bengal into Indian rivers. It’s a delicacy enjoyed in Bengali cuisine, renowned for its flavour.​
Pexels
​Katla, a large carp, inhabits rivers across northern India. Valued for its rapid growth and tasty flesh, it’s a favourite in aquaculture and traditional recipes.​
Pexels
​The golden mahseer, revered in India, is a powerful freshwater fish in the Himalayan rivers. It’s famous among anglers for its strength and impressive size.​
Pexels
​Mrigal, another significant Indian carp, thrives in the rivers and reservoirs of India. It’s widely cultured for its economic value and is a staple in Indian fish markets.​
Pexels
​Pangasius, often basa, is a versatile freshwater fish in Indian rivers. Known for its mild taste and adaptability, it’s a popular choice in farming and cuisine.​
Pexels
​Rohu, a famous Indian carp, thrives in the Ganges and Brahmaputra rivers. Known for its mild taste and significant cultural importance, it’s a staple in many regional dishes.​
Pexels
Pexels

Kalki 2898 AD
Hats off to Nag Ashwin, for conceiving, creating the Kalki universe. A spectacular show, though first half is dragging but second half compensated it completely.

Casting.
After the disastrous Adi Purush, Prabhas back with bang.
Amithab no words to express his towering screen presence, mind blowing.
Deepika will never regret donning the role of Maa
Shobhna, Samuthrakani, Sawsata all have done terrific job. Anil George, Lala of Mirzapur and Anna Ben surprises.
Kamal has limited screen time but he never disappoints, ferociously covered his part.
And there are many characters, casting directors has put everything and pulled it off stunningly.

Bonus
Glimpses of Mahabharata, wow, goose bumps when Karna takes Arjun and assures Ashwatma that his friends can defend him.
I am 101% sure that if any industry that can bring out the Mahabharata on grand scale and without compromising our culture and tradition is Telugu Industry. I hope Rajamouli Garu and Nag Ashwin Garu should collaborate to bring this epic saga to screen.

Many more, but don’t want to spill out many things here, haan, don’t wait Kal ke Liye, watch this movie today!!!

The movie Kalki deserves Zero stars
for hurting sentiments with showing wrong facts (Fight scene of Krishna and Aswathama and Krishna taking forehead manni which was actually taken by Arjun and Bhim) keeps revolving much around meaningless drama, lovestory, silly street fights, All characters chanting Units ...units and Complex.... Complex forgetting the core of Mahabharata and useless flying scooters made a commedy.
It would have been nice if some more actual scene of Mahabharata with some Geeta Gyan and Sri Krishna shown as Virat roop rather mockery of actual scene with showing women as objects required only for serum and baby birth by some useless ganju baba named supreme...horrible
Actual content, about Kalki is just 25%...Only few Scenes from Mahabharata are truly nice, a few scene with Amitabh Bacchan as ashwathama are good which makes some sence. Otherwise sort of ruined the whole concept, and senseless comedy
Bakwas movie.. Overhyped with paid ratings and reviews..watching this one is nothing sort of a torcher

Varalaxmi, daughter of renowned actor Sarathkumar, is embarking on the next chapter of her life: marriage. The acclaimed actress got engaged to her dream partner, Nicholai Sachdev, in March 2024. Now, the couple is ready to begin their journey together, with their wedding set for July 2, 2024. Recently, intimate glimpses from their Mehendi ceremony have surfaced, adding to the excitement.

Rayane Mithun, daughter of Radhikaa Sarathkumar, shared a series of photos on her Instagram handle, showcasing the soon-to-be-married couple during their mehendi ceremony. Varalaxmi looked stunning in a light-green crepe lehenga set, complemented by a statement choker, a maang teeka, and her engagement ring. Her soft makeup and middle-parted open hair added a touch of elegance. Nicholai looked dapper in a deep green kurta, white pyjama, and a beige-toned doshala, with a statement neckpiece completing his look.

In another photo, Sarathkumar and his wife, Radikaa, posed together, radiating pride and joy. The proud father of the bride-to-be was seen applying mehendi on his hand, clearly delighted by the occasion. A video captured Sarathkumar dancing with joy, celebrating his daughter’s upcoming new phase of life.

Back in March 2024, Varalaxmi and Nicholai exchanged rings in a traditional ceremony, marking a significant step in their relationship. Varalaxmi looked exquisite in a white Kasavu saree paired with a red blouse adorned with silver work. She completed her look with a statement neckpiece and matching earrings. Nicholai complemented her in a white kurta and Kasavu dhoti. The couple looked deeply in love as they took this meaningful step together.

Nicholai Sachdev, previously married to Kavitha and father to a 15-year-old daughter, faced online criticism when details of his past surfaced. Varalaxmi, in an interview, defended her fiancé, stating that Nicholai is handsome in her eyes and dismissing negativity about their relationship. She highlighted that being married twice is not an issue, noting her father’s similar marital history. Varalaxmi also shared that she has a cordial relationship with Nicholai’s first wife and praised her amazing personality.

Varalaxmi revealed that she met Nicholai 14 years ago, but their love story blossomed much later. Their journey has been one of patience and growth, culminating in their upcoming wedding. With their wedding day here, fans eagerly await more glimpses of Varalaxmi and Nicholai’s celebration. The couple’s love story, marked by elegance, resilience, and joy, continues to inspire and captivate.

'Majority will become minority...': Allahabad HC on religious conversion

The Allahabad high court warned that unchecked unlawful conversion of religion could lead to today's majority becoming tomorrow's minority in India. Justice Rohit Ranjan Agarwal made this assertion while denying bail to Kailash, accused under UP's anti-conversion law. Kailash allegedly transported individuals from Hamirpur to Delhi for conversions, prompting the court's concern over citizens not returning home. The court urged an immediate halt to such religious gatherings where conversions occur, highlighting the risk of demographic shifts. It noted conversions targeting SC/ST and economically disadvantaged groups, stressing that while Article 25 guarantees religious freedom, it doesn't endorse forced conversions.

39 died, over 350 injured in Kenya’s anti-tax protests

At least 39 people were killed and 361 injured in Kenya's anti-government protests against a new tax hike, reported the Kenya National Commission on Human Rights. The violence occurred from June 18 to July 1, 2024, with many victims awaiting post-mortems. The Commission strongly condemned excessive force on protesters, medical staff, and journalists, and decried attacks on safe spaces and government infrastructure. President William Ruto faces mounting pressure following the unrest, sparked by controversial legislation. Activists plan further protests despite Ruto's pledge to investigate the deaths and his decision not to sign the tax bill into law.

The desk is also adept at writing comprehensive match reports and insightful post-match commentary, complemented by stats-based articles that provide an in-depth analysis of player performances and team dynamics. We track news wires for key stories, conduct exclusive player interviews in both text and video formats, and file content from print editions and reporters. Onitsuka is a made-in-Japan brand that started in 1977 and has redefined its luxury over the years. Every detail of their shoe collection is made from meticulous engineering for both function and form. They actively combine timeless designs with sincere traditional craftsmanship, coming with comfortable technology, and Japanese accuracy. However, this high-end shoe brand known for its distinctive designs is now available at every local store at cheap prices and quality tones. Let’s see how one can identify the fake Onitsuka Tiger shoes in the market.

The unique logo of the brand is instantly recognizable. If you wish to check the authenticity of the shoes, then take a look at the typography and colour scheme and run it thoroughly with the original logo which has a fine line finish with a crisp, clear, uniform, and well-defined end that is hard to match.
(Image Credits: Pinterest)

Authentic or original Onitsuka Tiger shoes are made from high-quality materials giving off a breath of fine craftsmanship and durability. One should ensure that the materials used in making these shoes stand up to the standards of Onitsuka Tiger. If you’re feeling any rough patches or fragile spots while wearing the shoes, then understand that the shoes are fake, as the brand is known for its high-end quality.
(Image Credits: Pinterest)

The real Onitsuka Tiger kicks won’t have a loose thread end ever, as it always comes with fine and tight stitching. Therefore, before purchasing check the neat and precise stitching across the whole shoe, which should be in a proper uniform size with a distance apart and neat finishing which is not unraveling from anywhere.
(Image Credits: Pinterest)

The original Onitsuka Tiger shoes come with high-quality packaging which precisely conveys the conciseness and value of the brand. Take a keen look at the packaging of the box, you should be able to read the name of the product, logo, and any other additional information about the sneakers printed all together in a detailed and neat format. You will also sense the high-end quality and durability of the brand.
(Image Credits: Pinterest)

If the price appears to be too good to be true, then genuinely it is. Always keep in mind that the price of the product is much lower than the MSRP. If it is then it may be a knockoff. As Onitsuka Tiger is a premium brand, the price tag will reflect the time taken to create the product, and the money required to produce each pair of sneakers will also be mentioned with the specific code of the shoes delivered.
(Image Credits: Pinterest)

A UN panel determined that former Pakistani Prime Minister Imran Khan's detention is arbitrary and violates international law, calling for his immediate release and compensation. The United Nations Working Group on Arbitrary Detention highlighted that Khan's imprisonment lacks legal basis and appears politically motivated to disqualify him from political office. Despite being cleared for release before Pakistan's general elections, Khan remains detained. His party, PTI, celebrated the ruling as proof of his innocence and unlawful imprisonment.

UPSC Civil Services 2024 to Fill 1,056 Central Government Vacancies, Including 40 Reserved for PWBD Candidates

The UPSC Civil Services Examination 2024 aims to fill a total of 1,056 vacancies across various central government services and departments. This includes prestigious positions in the Indian Administrative Service (IAS), Indian Police Service (IPS), and Indian Foreign Service (IFS). Among these, 40 vacancies are specifically reserved for candidates from the Persons with Benchmark Disability (PWBD) category, ensuring an inclusive approach in the recruitment process.
UPSC Pre Result 2024: Detailed Application Form-I (DAF-I) submission to begin shortly

In its UPSC CSE Prelims notice, the Commission stated, "All of these candidates (who have qualified) must reapply using the Detailed Application Form-I (DAF-I) for the Civil Services (Main) Examination, 2024. The Commission's website will be updated in due course with the dates and important instructions for filling out the DAF-I and submitting it."
UPSC Pre Result 2024: Prelims Attempt Counts Towards Total Attempts

Any participation in the Preliminary Examination for the Civil Services counts as one attempt towards the total number of permissible attempts for the Civil Services Examination. This rule applies to all candidates appearing for the Prelims, regardless of whether they qualify for the Main Examination.
UPSC Pre Result 2024: Attempts Allowed Based on Category Eligibility

Candidates eligible for the Civil Services Examination (CSE) are typically allowed six attempts to clear the exam. However, special provisions exist for candidates belonging to the SC/ST, OBC, and Persons with Benchmark Disability (PwBD) categories. SC/ST candidates have unlimited attempts, while OBC and PwBD candidates are allowed up to nine attempts, ensuring equitable opportunities across different categories.
UPSC Pre Result 2024: Exceptional Admission Circumstances

In exceptional cases, the Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) may consider candidates who lack the typical qualifications for the Civil Services Examination. If a candidate has passed an examination from another institution, and the Commission believes the standard of that examination justifies their admission, they may be allowed to sit for the exam.
UPSC Pre Result 2024: Proof of Qualifying Examination

To proceed to the UPSC Civil Services Main Examination, candidates declared qualified in the Preliminary Examination must furnish proof of passing the requisite qualifying examination. This proof, issued by the closing date of the Detailed Application Form-I for the Main Examination, is mandatory for admission.
UPSC Pre Result 2024: Previous years' overview

This year the UPSC Pre result 2024 has been declared today, on July 1, 2024. The UPSC Prelims Exam dates and their respective result dates over the past five years are as follows:In 2023, the exam was conducted on 28th May, with results announced on 12th June.In 2022, the exam took place on 5th June, and results were released on 22nd June.The 2021 exam was held on 10th October, with results declared on 29th October.In 2020, the exam occurred on 4th October, and results were out by 23rd October.Finally, in 2019, the exam was conducted on 2nd June, with results published on 12th July.

UPSC Pre Result 2024: Dates and Instructions for DAF Submission to be Announced

UPSC Pre Result 2024: Marks, Cut-Offs, and Answer Keys will be Released Post Final Results
The marks, cut-off marks, and answer keys for the Civil Services Prelims Examination, 2024 will be uploaded on the UPSC website after the declaration of the final results.
UPSC Pre Result 2024: Qualified Candidates Must Apply Again for Mains
The qualified candidates must apply again using the Detailed Application Form-I (DAF-I) for the Civil Services (Main) Exam, 2024.
UPSC Pre Result 2024: Prelims Results Declared
The Union Public Service Commission declared the Civil Services preliminary exam results on Monday, July 1, 2024.
UPSC Pre Result 2024: Passed Candidates Qualified for Mains
The candidates whose roll numbers are listed have qualified for admission to the Civil Services (Main) Examination, 2024.
UPSC CSE Prelims results 2024: UPSC prelims examination was held on June 16
UPSC conducts the prelims examinations 2024 on June 16
UPSC Civil Services Exam: Attempts Allowed Based on Category Eligibility

Candidates eligible for the Civil Services Examination (CSE) are typically allowed six attempts to clear the exam. However, special provisions exist for candidates belonging to the SC/ST, OBC, and Persons with Benchmark Disability (PwBD) categories. SC/ST candidates have unlimited attempts, while OBC and PwBD candidates are allowed up to nine attempts. This policy aims to provide equitable opportunities for all eligible candidates across different categories.
UPSC CSE Prelim results 2024: Those who passed are eligible to move on to the mains
The applicants included on the list with their roll numbers indicate that they are eligible to take the Civil Services (Main) Examination in 2024.
UPSC CSE Prelim results 2024
Those who passed are eligible to move on to the mainsThe applicants included on the list with their roll numbers indicate that they are eligible to take the Civil Services (Main) Examination in 2024.
UPSC Prelims Results 2024: UPSC Prelims Results are out
UPSC Prelims Results 2024 are out To check the UPSC Prelims Results 2024 online, Visit the official website upsc.gov.in.
UPSC Prelims Results 2024: Medical Graduates Who Have Not Finished Their Internship Are Allowed Provisional Admission

Applicants may still apply to the Civil Services Examination even if they have accomplished their internship but not their final professional M.B.B.S. or comparable medical examination. Along with their application for the Civil Services (Main) Examination, they must include a certificate from their university or other institution attesting to the successful completion of the final professional examination. Candidates must show their original degree or a certificate attesting to the fulfillment of all degree requirements, including completing the internship, at the interview stage.
UPSC Prelims Results 2024: Reservation Eligibility for Persons with Benchmark Disabilities

Eligibility for reservation for Persons with Benchmark Disabilities in the Civil Services Examination will follow the criteria outlined in the Rights of Persons with Disabilities Act, 2016. Candidates with Multiple Disabilities will only be eligible for reservation under the Multiple Disabilities category as specified in the Act.
UPSC CSE 2024: Rules for Continuing IPS Members in Opting for Service

Candidates who have been appointed to the Indian Police Service (IPS) based on the results of a previous examination and remain serving members of that service will not have the option to select the IPS based on the results of the Civil Services Examination (CSE)-2024.
UPSC CSE 2024: Ineligibility Rules for Current IAS and IFS Members

Candidates already serving in the Indian Administrative Service (IAS) or Indian Foreign Service (IFS) as a result of a previous examination are ineligible to participate in the Civil Services Examination-2024. Even if appointed to these services after the Preliminary Examination but before the Main Examination results are declared, they cannot proceed to the Main Examination for 2024.
UPSC Prelims Results 2024: UPSC Civil Services Exam: Prelims Attempt Counts Towards Total Attempts

Any participation in the Preliminary Examination for the Civil Services shall count as one attempt towards the total number of permissible attempts for the Civil Services Examination. This rule applies uniformly to all candidates appearing for the Prelims, regardless of whether they qualify for the Main Examination or not.
UPSC Civil Services Exam: Attempts Allowed Based on Category Eligibility

Candidates eligible for the Civil Services Examination (CSE) are typically allowed six attempts to clear the exam. However, special provisions exist for candidates belonging to the SC/ST, OBC, and Persons with Benchmark Disability (PwBD) categories. SC/ST candidates have unlimited attempts, while OBC and PwBD candidates are allowed up to nine attempts. This policy aims to provide equitable opportunities for all eligible candidates across different categories.
UPSC Prelims Results 2024: UPSC Allows Provisional Admission for Medical Graduates Yet to Complete Internship

Candidates who have completed their final professional M.B.B.S. or equivalent medical examination but have not finished their internship can still apply for the Civil Services Examination. They must submit a certificate from their university or institution confirming the completion of the final professional examination along with their application for the Civil Services (Main) Examination. During the interview stage, candidates must present their original degree or a certificate proving that all degree requirements, including internship completion, have been fulfilled.
UPSC Prelims Results 2024: UPSC Allows Candidates with Recognized Professional Qualifications for Civil Services Exam

Candidates who hold professional or technical qualifications recognized by the government as equivalent to a professional or technical degree are eligible to apply for the Civil Services Examination. This ensures that individuals with diverse educational backgrounds but equivalent qualifications are considered for the prestigious examination.
UPSC May Admit Exceptionally Qualified Candidates Without Standard Qualifications

In exceptional circumstances, the Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) may consider candidates who lack the typical qualifications for the Civil Services Examination. If a candidate has passed an examination from another institution, and the Commission believes the standard of that examination justifies their admission, they may be allowed to sit for the exam.
UPSC Prelims Exam and Result Dates: A Five-Year Overview

The UPSC Prelims Exam dates and their respective result dates over the past five years are as follows: In 2023, the exam was conducted on 28th May, with results announced on 12th June. In 2022, the exam took place on 5th June, and results were released on 22nd June. The 2021 exam was held on 10th October, with results declared on 29th October. In 2020, the exam occurred on 4th October, and results were out by 23rd October. Finally, in 2019, the exam was conducted on 2nd June, with results published on 12th July.
UPSC Prelims Results 2024: Proof of Qualifying Examination

To proceed to the UPSC Civil Services Main Examination, candidates declared qualified in the Preliminary Examination must furnish proof of passing the requisite qualifying examination. This proof, issued by the closing date of the Detailed Application Form-I for the Main Examination, is mandatory for admission.
UPSC Prelims Results 2024: Qualifying Examination Requirements

Candidates eligible to appear for the UPSC Civil Services Preliminary Examination include those who have appeared for a qualifying examination, the results of which would qualify them for the commission's exam, provided they haven't received their results yet. Candidates intending to appear for such examinations are also eligible.
UPSC Prelims Results 2024: Eligibility Criteria

To qualify for the UPSC CSE Prelims Results 2024, candidates must have a Graduate degree from a recognized university in India, as per the guidelines set by the UPSC. This includes universities established under Acts of the central or State Legislature, institutions declared deemed universities under the UGC Act, 1956, or those possessing equivalent qualifications.
UPSC Prelims Results 2024: Step-by-step guide to check the results

To check the UPSC Prelims Results 2024 online, follow these steps:1. Visit the Official Website: Go to the official UPSC website at upsc.gov.in.2. Navigate to Results Section: Look for the "Results" tab on the homepage.3. Click on UPSC Civil Services Preliminary Result 2024: Once you find the Results section, click on the link specifically labeled "UPSC Civil Services Preliminary Result 2024".4. Enter Required Details: A new page will open where you need to enter your details such as your UPSC CSE roll number or registration number, and date of birth.5. Submit Details: After entering the required information, click on the "Submit" button.6. View Results: The UPSC CSE Prelims Results 2024 will be displayed on the screen.7. Download and Print: For future reference, download the UPSC CSE Prelims Results 2024 and take a printout if necessary.Make sure to verify all details on your result carefully and keep a copy for your records.
UPSC Prelims Results 2024: How to Download UPSC CSE Prelims Results 2024

Access your UPSC CSE Prelims Results 2024 efficiently: Visit upsc.gov.in, locate the UPSC Civil Services Preliminary Result 2024 link, enter necessary details, and download or print for future reference.
UPSC Prelims Results 2024: Exam Structure and Passing Criteria
To pass the UPSC CSE Prelims, candidates must score a minimum of 33% in General Studies Paper 2 and meet the overall qualifying marks in General Studies Paper 1.
UPSC Prelims Results 2024: UPSC CSE Mains 2024 Tentatively Set for September
Upon the announcement of UPSC CSE Prelims results, successful candidates will advance to the Mains round, consisting of a written examination and a personality test.
UPSC Civil Services Prelims 2024: Exam Details

The UPSC Civil Services Examination 2024 featured two shifts covering General Studies Paper 1 and 2, totaling 400 marks. Candidates navigated objective-type questions, each offering four options, requiring precise selections.
UPSC Prelims Results 2024: UPSC CSE Prelims Result 2024 Expected Soon
Stay informed about the imminent release of UPSC CSE Prelims Result 2024, following the exam conducted on June 16. Learn where and how to check your scores at upsc.gov.in and upsconline.nic.in.
This anti-ageing Korean rice gel hydrates the skin, reduces fine lines, and promotes a youthful glow.
iStock

1 cup rice (preferably organic), 2 cups water, 1 tablespoon aloe vera gel, 1 teaspoon glycerin, 1 tablespoon honey, 1 teaspoon vitamin E oil, 1 teaspoon rose water, 2-3 drops of essential oil (optional).
iStock
Begin by thoroughly rinsing 1 cup of rice under cold water to remove any dirt and impurities. This step ensures that your rice gel is clean and free of any unwanted particles.
iStock
Place the rinsed rice in a bowl and cover it with 2 cups of water. Let it soak for about 30 minutes. This helps to soften the rice and release its beneficial nutrients.
iStock

Transfer the soaked rice and water to a pot and bring it to a boil. Once it reaches a boiling point, reduce the heat and let it simmer until the rice is fully cooked and soft, typically around 15-20 minutes.
iStock

Allow the cooked rice to cool slightly. Then, place the rice and the leftover water into a blender. Blend until you achieve a smooth, creamy consistency. If the mixture is too thick, you can add a little more water to help it blend more easily.
iStock
Use a fine mesh strainer or cheesecloth to strain the rice mixture into a bowl. This step helps to remove any remaining rice particles, leaving you with a smooth rice gel.
iStock
Mix in 1 tablespoon of aloe vera gel and 1 teaspoon of glycerin into the strained rice gel. Aloe vera is known for its soothing and hydrating properties, while glycerin helps to lock in moisture.
iStock

Add 1 tablespoon of honey and 1 teaspoon of vitamin E oil to the mixture. Honey is a natural humectant and antioxidant, which helps to keep the skin moisturized and youthful. Vitamin E oil promotes skin healing and provides additional anti-aging benefits.
iStock

Stir in 1 teaspoon of rose water and 2-3 drops of your favorite essential oil (optional) for fragrance and added skin benefits. Rose water helps to balance the skin's pH and has anti-inflammatory properties. Mix everything thoroughly until well combined.
iStock

Store the anti-aging Korean rice gel in a clean, airtight container and keep it refrigerated. Apply a small amount to your face and neck, gently massaging it into your skin in upward circular motions. Use it daily as part of your skincare routine to enjoy its nourishing and anti-aging benefits.
iStock
Thanks For Reading!

South Indian cuisine is renowned for its diverse flavours and nutritional benefits. Beyond the popular Dosas and Idlis, several lesser-known dishes offer exceptional health benefits. Here are 10 nutritious South Indian dishes you should explore. (Images courtesy: Canva & Instagram)
This simple spinach dish from Tamil Nadu is packed with iron and vitamins. Cooked with minimal spices, it retains the natural goodness of leafy greens, providing essential nutrients and fibre.
Kollu (horse gram) Rasam is a tangy soup known for its high protein and iron content. Traditionally consumed in Tamil Nadu, it aids digestion and is believed to help with weight management.
Hailing from Karnataka, Pathrode is made from colocasia leaves, rice, and spices. Rich in calcium, iron, and vitamins A and C, this dish is beneficial for bone health and boosting immunity.

This Kerala specialty features shallots cooked in a roasted coconut and tamarind sauce. Rich in antioxidants and vitamins, shallots are excellent for heart health. The tamarind adds a dose of vitamin C, aiding in iron absorption.

Kootu is a vegetable stew from Tamil Nadu, typically made with lentils and vegetables. It’s a balanced dish rich in protein and fibre. The combination of lentils and veggies provides essential nutrients and aids digestion.

A traditional Kerala stir-fry, Thoran can be made with various vegetables such as cabbage, beans, or carrots, mixed with grated coconut. It’s packed with vitamins, minerals, and fibre, supporting digestive health and enhancing immunity.

A staple in Karnataka, Ragi Mudde is made from finger millet flour. It's rich in calcium, iron, and essential amino acids. This dish is excellent for bone health, and it helps in controlling blood sugar levels, making it ideal for diabetics.

Navara Rice Kanji is a nutritious porridge made from Navara rice, a traditional medicinal variety native to Kerala. Rich in antioxidants and fiber, it is often consumed for its health benefits, including improved digestion and immunity. This soothing dish is typically prepared with coconut milk and spices, making it both delicious and nourishing.

Uppu Huli Dosa is a tangy and spicy rice crepe from Karnataka, made by fermenting rice and lentils with tamarind and spices. Known for its unique sour and savory flavour, it's often enjoyed with chutney or sambar. This Dosa offers a delightful twist to traditional South Indian breakfasts.

This is a traditional South Indian beverage made from pearl millet. It's a cooling, nutritious drink often enjoyed during hot weather. Rich in fiber, iron, and protein, this fermented porridge is refreshing and beneficial for digestion. Typically served with onions or pickles, it's a staple in rural households.

Is your parenting a little too tight? This Web Story explores 10 signs your child might be showing you're being too strict, from constant lying to struggles in school. Learn how to create a more balanced environment for your little one to thrive.
Image Source: Canva
Children who fear harsh punishments may resort to lying to avoid getting in trouble.
Image Source: Canva
A constant focus on rules and discipline leaves no room for spontaneous fun or laughter, making your child dread spending time at home.
Image Source: Canva
If your child feels unheard or judged, they'll stop confiding in you about important matters.
Image Source: Canva
Your child might constantly prefer being at friends' houses or involved in activities outside the home to escape the strict environment.
Image Source: Canva
Excessive rules can lead to rebellion as your child pushes back against the constant restrictions.
Image Source: Canva
Bottled-up frustration from feeling unheard or unfairly treated can manifest as angry outbursts.
Image Source: Canva
Constant criticism or negativity can damage your child's self-confidence and make them feel like they're never good enough.
Image Source: Canva
Overly-structured environments can hinder a child's ability to develop independent thinking and decision-making skills.
Image Source: Canva
Strict rules might make it difficult for your child to connect with friends and develop healthy social skills.
Image Source: Canva
The stress and anxiety of a strict environment can negatively impact your child's focus and performance in school.

When Kim Go Eun graces our screens, resistance is futile - we're hooked! Many of us first adored her as the beloved Goblin's wife, and soon, we witnessed her fiercer side in new roles. And guess what? Today's her birthday; she's turning 33! So, in honor of this shining star’s special day, here's your cue to update that watchlist with her must-see titles. Whether you're a longtime fan or new to her charm, these are the shows you won't want to miss. So, cancel your plans (or maybe just postpone them a bit), and get ready to enjoy the Kim Go Eun marathon you didn’t know you needed!

Kim Shin (Gong Yoo), once an indomitable general in Goryeo's military, met a tragic end and gained immortality. Weary after centuries of loneliness amid mortal lives, he seeks his destined bride who can release him from his eternal curse. Enter Ji Eun Tak (Kim Go Eun), a spirited high school student despite her rough past, who has the ability to see ghosts. She boldly declares herself as the Goblin's bride, tasked with ending his immortal existence. Yet, what begins as a seemingly straightforward mission evolves into a complex journey of love and destiny as they find themselves irresistibly drawn to each other.

In the gripping Korean thriller 'Exhuma', four strangers become entangled in a sinister secret. Shaman Hwa-rim (Kim Go-eun) and her protégé Bong-gil (Lee Do-hyun) unite to confront a curse haunting a wealthy family. In the journey, they relocate the family's tomb, where they unravel eerie revelations, unleashing uncontrollable forces. The film, which explored mysterious complexities of human behavior, was one of the highest grossing South Korean movies of 2024.

Hong Seol (Kim Go Eun), a diligent over-achiever returning to college after a year-long hiatus due to her family's financial struggles, unwittingly crosses paths with Yoo Jung (Park Hae Jin), a senior known for his athleticism, good looks, top grades, and seemingly benevolent personality, yet harboring a mysterious dark side. Soon, Hong Seol's life spirals downward, convinced that Yoo Jung is behind her misfortunes. But just as she settles into this belief, Yoo Jung's behavior takes an unexpected turn: he begins to display a surprising friendliness towards her, leaving Hong Seol puzzled and questioning his motives anew.

Lee Gon (Lee Min Ho), hailed as the exemplary third Korean emperor, conceals a deep scar beneath his facade of perfection. Witnessing his father's murder during a coup at the age of eight left an indelible mark on him. Now, eschewing his royal responsibilities, Lee Gon finds peace in attending university conferences outside the palace walls. It's during one such excursion that he stumbles into a parallel universe, where he crosses paths with Jeong Tae Eul (Kim Go Eun), a dedicated inspector. Together, they forge an unlikely alliance to combat criminals and unravel the mysteries binding their two worlds.

In a world where human existence is driven by a complex network of cells, Kim Yoo Mi (Kim Go Eun) appears as any other single working woman - unassuming, ordinary. Yet beneath this facade lies a remarkable tale. Recently scarred by a painful breakup, Yoo Mi's love cells languish in a deep slumber, while the rest of her being perseveres through mundane routines. Enter Goo Woong (Ahn Bo Hyun), a game developer with emotional barriers, whose chance encounter with Yoo Mi sparks an unexpected revival in both their love cells. As their hesitant romance blossoms, fueled by the fervor of their awakened cells, the duo finds themselves drawn closer together. And guess what? It comes with two seasons!

In a tale of three sisters bound by a deep bond forged in poverty, their lives take a rough turn when they become entangled in a high-stakes conflict with the nation's wealthiest family. Oh In Joo (Kim Go Eun), the eldest, yearns to shield her family from financial hardship. Her dream of escaping destitution is shattered when a life-altering incident disrupts her world. Meanwhile, Oh In Kyung (Nam Ji Hyun), the middle sister and a principled news reporter, confronts a resurfaced mystery from her past investigations, determined to uncover the truth despite the powerful forces at play. The youngest, Oh In Hye (Park Ji Hu), is cherished by her dedicated sisters who sacrificed for her education. Gifted with artistic talent yet constrained by their financial struggles, she enters an elite art school, poised to defy expectations and carve her own path.

Parenting is a journey full of joys, challenges, and countless teaching moments. Beyond academic knowledge and extracurricular achievements, imparting essential life skills is crucial in shaping well-rounded and capable individuals.
Canva

Communication goes beyond talking; it encompasses listening, understanding, and expressing thoughts and emotions clearly and respectfully. Encouraging children to articulate their feelings and thoughts helps them build strong interpersonal relationships.
Canva

Critical thinking enables children to analyse situations, consider different perspectives, and make informed decisions. Parents can nurture this skill by encouraging their children to ask questions, explore various solutions, and think independently.
Canva

Time management is an invaluable skill that sets the foundation for a productive and balanced life. Teaching children how to prioritise tasks, set goals, and manage their time effectively prepares them for academic responsibilities and future professional challenges.
Canva
Understanding the basics of money management is important for lifelong financial stability. Parents should introduce concepts like saving, budgeting, and responsible spending early on.
Canva

Cooking is not only a vital life skill but also an excellent way to promote healthy eating habits. Involving children in meal preparation and teaching them about nutritious food choices instills an appreciation for healthy eating.
Canva

Teaching children about personal hygiene and self-care promotes good health and boosts their self-esteem. Parents should emphasize the importance of regular handwashing, dental care, and grooming habits.
Canva

Empathy and emotional intelligence are crucial for building meaningful relationships and understanding others’ perspectives. Parents can nurture these qualities by modeling empathetic behavior and discussing feelings openly.
Canva

Life is full of unexpected challenges, and teaching children adaptability helps them deal with setbacks and bounce back from adversity. Helping children understand that failure is a part of learning and growth builds a sense of perseverance and adaptability.
Canva
Thanks For Reading!

Eagles are one of the most magnificent and powerful birds in the world. Their sharp claws, eyes, and regal wings are a sight to behold and the way they fly is absolutely regal. Here we list nine of the most powerful eagles from around the world.
Canva
The Harpy eagle is famous because of its incredible strength and speed. Its wings can reach upto 40 inches in length and its talons are as large and as sharp as those of a Grizzly bear.
Canva

The Philippine eagle is one of the largest and most powerful eagles in the world. Evident by the name, they are only found in the Philippines, and have long crown feathers, which give them a very regal look.
Canva

This eagle species is found mostly in Russia and Korea and is one of the heaviest eagles on Earth. The Steller sea eagle’s wings weigh about 7-8 kgs and its yellow beak and talons give it a unique look.
Canva
The African crowned eagle is one of the strongest eagles with the wingspan of about 6 feet. It has extremely powerful legs which can crush small mammals in about 2-3 kicks and blows.
Canva
The Golden eagle is one of the most well-known and commonly seen eagles around the world. It has exceptional eyesight and can even hunt small, baby deers.
Canva
The White-tailed eagle is mostly found near water bodies and seas and is known for its fishing skills. It can dive into water from great heights and will emerge back up with a fish in its mouth.
Canva
The Martial eagle is one of the largest and most powerful eagles in Africa. It has a strong, muscular body and sharp claws and talons that can take down an animal much bigger its own size.
Canva

The Bald eagle is the national bird of the United States, and is usually found near lakes and rivers. The Bald eagle has a white head and tail and is known to catch fish with their talons or scavenge it from others.
Canva

The Wedge-tailed eagle is Australia’s largest bird of prey and its wingspan can reach upto 45 inches in length. This eagle gets its name from its wedge-shaped tail and powerful build. The wedge-tailed eagle usually scavenges on carrion left by other animals.
Canva

Spending quality time alone and enjoying your own company is essential for happiness, health, self-assurance, and confidence. If you're looking to reconnect with yourself, here are 8 immensely fun solo date ideas! Read on to discover the details.
Canva

Pampering yourself is a great way to relax and reconnect. Treat yourself to a spa day at your favorite salon, followed by a glass of champagne or wine. Alternatively, enjoy a DIY spa day at home with face masks, a bath, soothing music, and candles.
Canva
Take a day tour of a nearby neighborhood you haven't visited before. Spend the day discovering new shops, beautiful cafes, and other fascinating spots and sights.
Canva
Gather all your favourite snacks and drinks, one or two good books, and some soothing music. Enjoy a relaxing afternoon in a beautiful garden, having the best time alone.
Canva

If you're a foodie seeking the perfect day alone, plan a food tasting tour visiting different cafes, bakeries, and restaurants to enjoy their specialty dishes and treats. Sampling a variety of flavors and cuisines will truly be a heavenly experience.
Canva

For the perfect creative day, visit a workshop offering pottery, painting, crafts, or photography. Many cafes and places offer single-session workshops where you can learn a new creative skill and enjoy a unique experience.
Canva

Here's a perfect solo date idea for all you creativity lovers: spend a day working on a unique DIY project that interests you, such as making jewellery, knitting, and more. Create something fabulous and enjoy the fun process!
Canva

If you love music or dance, search for a single-session class with a renowned choreographer or musician. Many great choreographers offer paid sessions that you can book for a fun and engaging experience.
Canva

A fun solo date idea for everyone: visit a nearby arcade to explore a variety of games, from fascinating video games to classic pinball. Collect tickets to win adorable prizes, then enjoy a nice meal followed by delicious dessert.
Canva

Rohit Sharma's emotions were on full display amidst the jubilant celebrations. The Indian skipper, overwhelmed by the moment, made his way to the pitch and crouched down. In a gesture that caught everyone's attention, Sharma reached out, collected a small piece of soil from the playing surface, and consumed it. This act, while unconventional, seemed to hold deep significance for the captain, who had just led his team to a momentous victory on the global stage

The Indian cricket team's triumphant moments after securing the T20 World Cup title were not limited to the jubilant celebrations witnessed by the cameras on the field. However, it wasn't until the BCCI released a video on social media platforms on Tuesday that fans got a glimpse of the euphoric scenes inside the Indian dressing room. The footage provided a window into the joyous reactions of the players and support staff as they basked in the glory of their remarkable achievement.
As we bring this interesting Numerology Predictions every month for you all so that you can check out your monthly predictions and let us know how did you find it..!!
This month, influenced by the Zodiac signs Cancer (2) and Leo (1), is highly favourable for you, number 1’s. Expect more opportunities than in previous months, but be sure to choose the best ones.

If you're considering marriage or a job change, keep your eyes wide open as this month brings more promising prospects than before. Finances are likely to improve, but the challenge will be to manage and retain your earnings.

This is your month, governed by Cancer (2) and Leo (1), both of which are favourable for you. This period can exceed some of your aspirations. The Moon, your ruler, enhances your creativity and dreams, making not just this month but the entire year 2024 lucky for you.

If you manage your moods, fame awaits you. Honors, awards, and recognition are within reach if you trust your intuition. Those dealing with health issues can expect recovery. Eligible singles, now is the time to mingle!

Remember, you've faced and overcome the toughest situations with bravery; Tough times don’t last, but tough people do! While you've set high standards for achievements, it's okay to rely on past laurels occasionally. Your hardworking and enterprising nature will see you through.
Focus on your loved ones and be there for them when they need you the most. Not being expressive in matters of love and affection won't work forever, so it's important to improve in this area.

This month is governed by the Cancer (2) and Leo (1) signs, both of which are linked with your ruler, Uranus (4). This planetary alignment suggests that you’ll enjoy a significant share of good fortune!

For those eager to prove their mettle, now is the time to invest and capitalize on all your resources towards achieving your ambitions. Seize the opportunities that come your way and make the most of them.
Students, this is also a period ripe with potential for you. It promises to be a learning and enriching experience, full of new insights and knowledge.

The second half of this month is ruled by the number 1 (Sun). Mercury (5, your number) melts with heat, and number 1 (Sun) is fiery. The key is to manage your impulses and aggression, and focus on the more meaningful tasks at hand. Next month, however, will be governed by your number, so you have much to look forward to.

Leverage your communication and convincing skills to your advantage, but remember that being a good listener is equally important. If you persist, you will succeed, even if progress is slower than you would like. Stay patient and remain in the game.

This month will gift you the privilege of ambition, allowing you to translate your goals into reality with your creative intellect. However, don't get discouraged if your efforts don't immediately bear fruit. Even if this month isn't perfect, remember that the entire year 2024 (a year governed by the number 6) is favourable for you.

Your charismatic nature can charm the best, so rely on this aspect of your personality. Although you tend to be a spendthrift, don't let this indulgent month get the best of your cravings. Focus on curbing your spending to cover only your necessities.
July is governed by numbers 2 and 1, both of which are your lucky numbers. This alignment makes for a promising period where you are likely to be more active than in the past few months.

You will find yourself comfortably balancing between spiritual and materialistic pursuits, with a foot in each realm. Your past efforts may finally bring you the recognition and rewards you've been working toward. Financial prospects look positive as well, offering stability and growth. This month also bodes well for alliances and partnerships, both personally and professionally.

Those looking to get hitched may find more opportunities coming their way this month. The dynamic between number 1 (Sun, ruling July) and your number, 8 (Saturn), is like that of father and son, encompassing both love and tension. Therefore, it's important not to push matters to the brink. Avoid procrastination and complete your targets in a timely manner, as time can be unpredictable.

In matters of relationships and romance, don’t let shyness make you miss out. If you can't be loud and bold, at least try to come out of your shell. It's a beautiful world out there, waiting for you to explore and enjoy!

A balcony filled with hanging pots and having beautiful flowers growing in them is a very pleasant sight. The many different colours and scents can amp up the look and feel of the garden. Here are 10 beautiful flowers to grow in hanging pots.
Canva
Petunias are one of the best flowers to grow in hanging pots. The beautiful trumpet shaped flowers come in many different colours, and the pink and purple shades can breathe life into any space.
Canva
Fuchsia too is known for its beautiful flowers and the fact that it can grow without regular sunlight. Fuchsias need moist soil and are best grown in hanging pots.
Canva
Geraniums are great when it comes to breathing life into a garden with colour. They are trailing flowers with beautiful shades and will look great in hanging pots.
Canva
Begonias are trailing vines that serve the right purpose when grown in hanging baskets. They have lush, green leaves and beautiful flowers in shades of red, pink, orange, and even creamish-white.
Canva
The Million bells flowers look just like small petunias and come in many different colours. They are bell-shaped, have a bright colour, and also attract butterflies to the garden.
Canva
Nasturtiums are easy-to-grow plants with bright flowers in shades of red, yellow, and orange. They frow well in hanging pots as they are trailing by nature.
Canva
Sweet alyssum blooms into small, fragrant clusters of white, pink, or purple flowers. The beat part about it is that it can bloom round the year if given the right humid-cool environment.
Canva
Another amazing flowering plant to grow in pots is the Verbena. It grows well in India because of its love for the sun and blooms into small, colourful flowers, usually in purple, red, or white.
Canva
Portulaca is another great flower to grow in hanging baskets and pots. Portulaca has beautiful rose-like flowers and comes in shades of pink, yellow, orange, and red.
Canva
Ivy geraniums have beautiful, wide blooming flowers and trailing stems. They bloom in clusters of different shades and grow well in a draining soil.
Canva

With the use of visual effects (VFX), stories are now portrayed in movies in a whole new way by bringing amazing and fantastical things to life. More than ever, the cinematic experience is spectacular, with VFX studios setting new standards.
Instagram
Here are six recently released films where the VFX is on par with Hollywood standards:
Instagram

‘Munjya’ features outstanding visual effects that blend in perfectly with the story of the movie. This film's visual effects enhance its narrative and create an immersive experience that stands up to Hollywood blockbusters.
Instagram

Another outstanding example of Indian cinema's great visual effects is ‘Kalki 2898 AD’. The film's climax scene, which Prime Focus Group meticulously created, improves its visual appeal and is on par with some of the greatest Hollywood productions.
Instagram

A groundbreaking film in Indian cinema, "Brahmastra" is renowned for its heavy use of visual effects. The VFX used in the film creates an amazing fantasy world, proving that Indian visual effects are just as creative and high-quality as those in Hollywood.
Instagram

‘RRR’ is a remarkable movie with amazing visual effects. The film's spectacular effects, which highlight the technical skill of Indian VFX artists and studios, greatly add to its epic scope and action scenes.
Instagram

Impressive visual effects are used in "Bhediya," especially in the metamorphosis and paranormal sequences. The visual effects in the movie were on par with those in Hollywood, which heightened the impact and magical aspects of the narrative.
Instagram
‘Jawan’, starring Shah Rukh Khan, is the second-highest-grossing Bollywood film globally, after ‘Dangal’. Red Chillies provided the visual effects for the movie, which took around six months.
Instagram
These movies demonstrate how visual effects in Indian cinema, in particular, have advanced significantly to a level of creativity and quality that stands shoulder-to-shoulder with Hollywood.
Instagram
