Precious Rongmei, TIMESOFINDIA.COM, TRAVEL TRENDS, WORLD
                                         Created : Jul 2, 2024, 10:00 IST

The Middle East, with its rich tapestry of history, culture, and natural beauty, offers a diverse and captivating experience for travelers. From ancient civilizations and architectural marvels to vibrant markets and exquisite cuisine, the region is a treasure trove of unique experiences. Visitors can explore vast deserts, lush oases, and stunning coastlines, each offering its own blend of adventure and tranquility. The Middle East's warm hospitality, combined with its modern amenities and deep-rooted traditions, makes it a fascinating destination for anyone seeking to immerse themselves in a blend of the old and the new.Here are five must-visit countries in the Middle East:

The UAE is a federation of seven emirates, with Dubai and Abu Dhabi being the most prominent. Dubai is famous for its futuristic skyline, luxury shopping, and attractions like the Burj Khalifa, the world's tallest building. Abu Dhabi offers cultural landmarks such as the Sheikh Zayed Grand Mosque and the Louvre Abu Dhabi. The UAE also features vast deserts perfect for safaris, beautiful beaches, and a mix of modernity and traditional Arabian culture.

Jordan is a land of historical treasures and natural wonders. Petra, the ancient Nabatean city carved into rose-red cliffs, is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and a must-see. The country also offers the unique experience of floating in the Dead Sea, the lowest point on earth, and exploring the stunning desert landscapes of Wadi Rum. Jordan's capital, Amman, provides a modern urban experience with historical sites like the Roman Theatre and the Citadel.

Qatar is a rapidly developing country that combines modern luxury with rich cultural heritage. The capital city, Doha, features the stunning skyline of West Bay, the cultural village of Katara, and the Museum of Islamic Art. Qatar's deserts offer unique experiences like dune bashing and camel riding, while the country's beautiful beaches and resorts provide relaxation and water sports opportunities. The traditional markets, or souqs, offer a glimpse into Qatari culture and a chance to purchase local handicrafts and spices.

Turkey straddles two continents and offers rich cultural experiences. Istanbul, the country's largest city, is renowned for its historic sites like the Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, and the Blue Mosque. Cappadocia's unique rock formations and hot air balloon rides provide an unforgettable experience. The ancient city of Ephesus offers a glimpse into the Roman past, while the Mediterranean coast boasts beautiful beaches and resorts. Turkish cuisine, with its diverse flavors, is also a highlight.

Oman is known for its stunning natural beauty and well-preserved cultural heritage. The capital city, Muscat, features the impressive Sultan Qaboos Grand Mosque and the historic Al Jalali and Al Mirani forts. The country's diverse landscapes include the dramatic dunes of the Wahiba Sands desert, the lush greenery of the Dhofar region, and the breathtaking fjords of Musandam. Nizwa, with its historic fort and vibrant souq, offers a glimpse into Oman's rich history and traditions. Oman's coastlines are also perfect for diving, snorkeling, and dolphin watching.

Joe Biden opting out of the race is not a possibility now after the Biden family get-together at Camp David Sunday. Biden family members were unanimous in supporting Joe Biden that he should keep fighting. Instead, the role of the advisers wh0 allowed Biden to face Trump in the debate knowing what they must have known is under scrutiny.

New York Times which also called Biden to opt out of the contest noted the stark differences between the two Bidens. Joe Biden Two, with the help of a teleprompter, is enthusiastic and forceful, clear and concise on his position on abortion, immigration, taxes and race. "Joe Biden Two was clear about Mr. Trump’s threat to democracy. Joe Biden One left viewers scratching their heads about the topic that the president has long said motivated his run in 2020," NYT observed.

President Joe Biden's age and health were the two major issues that emerged from the 90-minute long CNN debate, the first between Biden and Donald Trump ahead of the 2024 presidential election. Biden appeared lost and incoherent disappointing even Democrats while video emerged of him being led by Jill Biden off the stage after the debate concluded.

Nielsen data shows over 51 million TV viewers watched the US presidential debate between President Joe Biden and Donald Trump, marking a 30% drop from 2020's initial debate. The new format, including microphone muting and no audience, drew mixed reviews. Despite criticism for lack of real-time fact-checking, CNN defended its approach, emphasizing question facilitation over immediate fact verification.

Barack Obama called Joe Biden's debate disaster a bad night as he put out a supportive statement defending Joe Biden as the Democrats were tearing into the President. "Bad debate nights happen. Trust me, I know. But this election is still a choice between someone who has fought for ordinary forks his entire life and someone who only cares about himself," Barack Obama wrote. But this is posturing, in private Obama is telling people Biden can't win, former Fox News host Tucker Carlson posted on X.

​Jill Biden, popularly called as Dr Biden, is under a lot of heat now as Democrat donors are blaming Dr Biden for not asking him to step aside. Billionaire Bill Ackman squarely blamed Dr Biden for dragging Joe Biden into the race for her own interest of being treated like a queen. While the Camp David family meet was supposed to be a brainstorming session on whether Biden should step aside from the race, Jill Biden gave her message loud and clear: She won't give up.

The Biden campaign has emailed supporters advising them on how to counter criticisms of President Biden's debate performance. Despite widespread criticism, the email reaffirms Biden as the Democratic nominee and warns against calls for his replacement, arguing it would disrupt the party and benefit Trump. It stresses Biden's electoral mandate and financial preparedness for the general election.

Historian Allan Lichtman is credited to have predicted 9 out of 10 election results correctly. Amid clamors for replacing Joe Biden as the Democrat's presidential candidate, he said it could cost the Democrat the 2024 election. He said it will be a huge mistake as those who are asking Biden to bow out of the contest are not doctors and they do not know whether Biden is capable of continuing another term or not. "This is foolhardy nonsense," the American University historian said on CNN.

White House aides have now claimed that there are two forms of Joe Biden and the debate night saw the version prone to gaffes. Biden functions fine between 10 am to 4 pm and the debate night was a disaster because it started at 9 pm, they said as Democrats are now gathering all possible excuses to justify Biden's performance and stall the clamor for Biden opting out.

A CNN flash poll of debate watchers found 67 percent of those surveyed said Trump won the debate, compared to 33 percent who said Biden won. Vice President Harris defended Biden’s debate performance during a round of interviews on Thursday night, even as she conceded he had a “slow start.” “Yes, there was a slow start, but it was a strong finish,” she said on CNN. “And what became very clear through the course of the night is that Joe Biden is fighting on behalf of the American people.”

During a heated presidential debate, democratic nominee Joe Biden criticized republican challenger Donald Trump for criminal convictions, including fabricating business documents and accusations of sexual assault. Trump denied allegations and countered by mentioning Biden's son, Hunter. Both candidates traded personal attacks as they clashed over legal issues and military remarks.

US President Joe Biden, 81, and his Republican rival Donald Trump, 78, the oldest presidential candidates in America's political history, addressed concerns about their age in a Thursday faceoff ahead of the general election. Neither offered a clear answer on how they would handle the rigors of another four-year term if re-elected. Biden, who has faced scrutiny over his mental and physical acuity, briefly touched on the issue before changing the subject.

Joe Biden's gaffes are a new normal now as the election approaches. After his wandering off at G7 which was salvaged by Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni, he was found lost at a fundraiser where Barack Obama came to his rescue. Now another video shows him speaking on unemployment where he by mistake said US has the highest unemployment.

Indian-Americans are a major group who will be safeguarded from deportation fears in the new policy. Undocumented Indians are to benefit from the policy as their numbers have been steadily growing since 2011. Those who will qualify under this policy will get work authorization followed by their right to stay in the United States for up to three years. By the time, they can apply for the green card -- if married to a US citizen.

​“I’m appalled by the scenes outside of Adas Torah synagogue in Los Angeles,” Biden said in post on social media site X. “Intimidating Jewish congregants is dangerous, unconscionable, antisemitic, and un-American.” Fighting between pro-Palestinian demonstrators and counterprotesters erupted Sunday outside the Adas Torah synagogue in the heavily Jewish Pico-Robertson neighborhood and police were called in to break it up. In a statement, Los Angeles Mayor Karen Bass said the violence was “abhorrent” and that blocking access to a place of worship was unacceptable.

Joe Biden's campaign has dropped the first television ad for his presidential campaign. "This election is between a convicted criminal who is only out for himself and a president who is fighting for your family," the ad titled 'Character Matters' said. The ad comes just 10 days before Biden and Trump are scheduled for their first face off to be hosted by CNN on June 27.

​​Reports suggest that some Democrat politicians and operatives expressed their hopes that the 81-year-old Biden would step aside, with some even considering going to the White House to publicly voice their concerns about his candidacy.

President Joe Biden's family used a Sunday gathering at Camp David to urge him to stay in the race and keep fighting despite his dreadful debate performance, and some members criticized how his staff prepared him for the faceoff, according to four people familiar with the discussions. Biden spent the day sequestered with first lady Jill Biden, his children and grandchildren. It was a previously scheduled trip to the presidential retreat in Maryland for a photo shoot with Annie Leibovitz for the upcoming Democratic National Convention.

From the shocking news of Hina Khan's breast cancer diagnosis to the unexpected midweek eviction on Bigg Boss OTT 3, this week in television has been eventful. Karan Johar's much-awaited return with Koffee with Karan and Debina Bonnerjee bravely sharing her struggle with endometriosis pain have also made headlines, capturing attention and sparking discussions across the entertainment industry. Here’s a look at the top news from the telly industry.

The third installment of the digital version of the reality show premiered with much fanfare on June 21. Hosted by Anil Kapoor, 15 contestants made their way inside the house along with one contestant, who will play as ‘Janta Ka Agent’. However, within just one week into the show, Bigg Boss OTT 3 saw it’s first elimination. Boxer Neeraj Goyat became the first contestant to get eliminated from the house. The housemates were given the power to decide who would be evicted. Most of them chose Shivani Kumari, who broke down in tears. Out of 14 contestants, 9 named Shivani for eviction. However, Bigg Boss announced that the audience, not the housemates, would make the final decision. Although predictions initially suggested Shivani would be voted out, Neeraj Goyat was ultimately sent home instead.

Despite rumors of a breakup between the Bigg Boss 15 duo, Karan and Tejasswi's joyful smiles dispel them completely. The couple has been painting London red with dreamy pictures. Addressing the breakup rumors, Karan said, “This is imagination at its peak.”

Prince Narula and Yuvika Chaudhary joyfully announce their pregnancy, sharing the exciting news with their fans and followers as they eagerly anticipate the arrival of their first child. Prince took to social media to share pictures of a car along with a toy baby car. In a heartfelt note, he wrote, “Hi everyone, I don’t know how to express my feelings right now because we are very happy, but at the same time nervous and thankful to God and our parents. We are super excited.”

Yeh Rishta Kya Kehlata Hai actress Hina Khan recently confirmed her diagnosis of stage three breast cancer. The 36-year-old shared the news on Instagram, reassuring her fans that she has already begun treatment and is "doing well." In her post, Hina expressed her determination to overcome this challenge and asked her fans to keep her in their prayers.

Three new reality shows are all set to return. Shark Tank India, Kaun Banega Crorepati 16 and Koffee with Karan will return this year with new seasons. While registration for season 4 of Shark Tank India has begun, Kaun Banega Crorepati makers gave a peek into what’s in store for viewers in season 16 with promos featuring host Amitabh Bachchan. On the other hand, Karan Johar will return with season 9 in 2025 with a new twist.

In an exclusive interview with ETimes TV, Vivian Dsena reflected on fatherhood, and how his journey into parenthood has enriched his perspective, both personally and professionally. He shared, “I think I have become more patient. I have, earlier, there were some, you know, negative traits in me as a human being. I got rid of them because, you know, after that, the day you see your baby in your hand, I think the whole system changes. It's like an update of software. She resembles me. Everybody says, even my mother-in-law.”

Debina Bonnerjee recently revealed that her endometriosis has returned. The actress and mother of two daughters shared that she was first diagnosed with the condition before Lianna’s birth, and now it has resurfaced. In her vlog, she shared, “Endometriosis is something jo aapka peechha kabhi nahi chhodta. There’s a small operation that needs to be done. Post that operation you might feel better for sometime, but it comes back. I don’t take any medicine. I prefer not to take any painkillers. When my infertility treatments began, I found out I have Endometriosis and adenomyosis. It is an abnormal growth on the wall of the uterus and outside of the uterus. The doctor told me I have grade 4 Endometriosis and adenomyosis. That pain is back. I have been experiencing this since the past 2-3 months. The pain is so much, daant me daant daal ke bardasht kar rahi hu. It is terrible.”

Bigg Boss OTT 3 features a diverse group of contestants, including vlogger Armaan Malik, who made a controversial entry with his two wives. However, his love story hasn't resonated well with viewers. Celebrities like Devoleena Bhattacharjee and Karan Kundrra have voiced their concerns, while Uorfi Javed has supported Armaan and his wives. Devoleena has been particularly vocal in opposing their presence saying, “Do you think this is entertainment? This is not entertainment, it's filth. Don't make the mistake of taking this lightly because it's not just a reel, it's real. I mean, I can't even understand how anyone can call this shamelessness entertainment ? I feel disgusted just hearing about it. Gross. I mean, in just 6/7 days love happened, marriage happened, and then the same thing with the wife's best friend. This is beyond my imagination.”

Bachi Karkaria's Erratica and its cheeky sign-off character, Alec Smart, have had a growing league of followers since 1994 when the column began in the Metropolis on Saturday. It now appears on the Edit Page of the Times of India, every Thursday. It takes a sly dig at whatever has inflated political/celebrity egos, and got public knickers in a twist that week. It makes you chuckle, think and  marvel at  the elasticity of the English  language. It is a shooting-from-the-lip advice column to the lovelorn and otherwise torn, telling them to stop cribbing and start living  -- all in her her branded pithy, witty style.

A former associate editor with the Times of India, Jug Suraiya writes two regular columns for the print edition, Jugular Vein, which appears every Friday, and Second Opinion, which appears on Wednesdays. His blog takes a contrarian view of topical and timeless issues, political, social, economic and speculative.

Anand Prakash Tiwari convicted for the murder of Lucknow CMOs Dr. Vinod Arya and Dr. BP Singh, related to the NRHM scam, based on CBI investigation. The case also involved Dr. YS Sachan, Babu Singh Kushwaha, and Pradeep Shukla. The conviction was supported by forensic and phone call evidence.
Situated on the banks of Gomti, Lucknow, the capital of UP, is known for its multicultural aura. Famous for its history, heritage, cuisine and Chikan art, it's India's 14th-most populous city.
Lucknow city has many fascinating heritage sites that include beautiful Mughal-era monuments, palaces, parks, some of the oldest markets and British-era residencies.
Lucknow offers a wide array of dishes. Famous for its street foods, even tourists eat like a local here. Don't forget to taste Awadhi dishes & Bilai ki Gilori.
Lucknow's Malihabad, the land of Dussehri mangoes, is often called the 'mango capital' of India. These orchards have some of the oldest mango trees.

Many people habitually discard papaya seeds without realising their significant health benefits. These tiny, often overlooked seeds are packed with powerful enzymes like papain, which aid in digestion, and compounds with antibacterial, antiviral, and anti-inflammatory properties. They support liver detoxification, promote kidney health, and have shown potential in cancer prevention. Despite their slightly bitter taste, incorporating a small amount of papaya seeds into your diet can enhance overall well-being. By recognising and utilising the nutritional value of papaya seeds, we can make better use of this fruit's full health potential rather than wasting it. Here are some of the benefits of papaya seeds that can help you understand why these seeds should not be thrown away. (Images courtesy: Canva)

Papaya seeds contain powerful enzymes like papain, which aid in digestion by breaking down proteins and promoting a healthy gut environment. Consuming a teaspoon of these seeds daily can help alleviate digestive issues such as bloating, constipation, and indigestion. The seeds have anti-parasitic properties and have been traditionally used to expel intestinal worms and parasites.

The liver is crucial for detoxifying our bodies. Papaya seeds are rich in vital nutrients that support liver health. Studies have shown that these seeds can help cleanse the liver and protect it from toxin-induced damage, making them a natural remedy for conditions like liver cirrhosis.

Papaya seeds have potent antiparasitic properties. They contain an alkaloid called carpaine, which has been shown to eliminate intestinal parasites. Regular consumption of papaya seeds can help maintain a parasite-free digestive tract, promoting overall health and preventing infections.

Inflammation is the root cause of many chronic diseases. Papaya seeds are rich in polyphenols and flavonoids, which have strong anti-inflammatory effects. Including these seeds in your diet can help reduce inflammation, alleviate pain, and lower the risk of chronic illnesses like arthritis and heart disease.  Papaya seeds are high in antioxidants, which help neutralize free radicals and protect the body from oxidative stress and damage.

Papaya seeds exhibit impressive antibacterial and antiviral properties. Research has demonstrated their effectiveness against pathogens like E. coli, Salmonella, and Staphylococcus aureus. They can also combat viral infections, making them a valuable addition to your diet during cold and flu season.

Papaya seeds support kidney health by promoting detoxification and preventing the formation of kidney stones. Their antioxidant properties help protect the kidneys from oxidative stress, ensuring they function optimally.

Heart health is paramount, and papaya seeds can play a role in maintaining it. These seeds are known to reduce cholesterol levels and improve blood pressure regulation. The fibre content in papaya seeds also aids in lowering bad cholesterol, contributing to a healthier cardiovascular system.

For those looking to manage their weight, papaya seeds can be a helpful ally. They contain compounds that boost metabolism and aid in fat burning. Additionally, the fibre in the seeds helps you feel fuller for longer, reducing overall calorie intake.

Papaya seeds can contribute to glowing, healthy skin. Their antioxidant properties help combat free radicals, preventing premature aging and skin damage. Regular consumption can lead to clearer, more youthful skin by reducing acne and promoting skin cell regeneration. As per experts, antioxidants and nutrients in papaya seeds can promote healthy, youthful skin by reducing oxidative stress and inflammation.

Emerging research suggests that papaya seeds may have anticancer properties. The seeds contain compounds like isothiocyanates, which have been shown to inhibit the growth of cancer cells and reduce the risk of certain types of cancer. While more studies are needed, the potential cancer-fighting properties of papaya seeds are promising.

Incorporating papaya seeds into your diet is easy and beneficial. Start by drying and grinding the seeds into a powder, then use a teaspoon in smoothies for a nutrient boost. Sprinkle whole or crushed seeds over salads for added crunch, or mix them into yoghurt for a healthy snack. They can also be added to salad dressings for a unique flavor. For those who enjoy a bit of spice, use ground papaya seeds as a pepper substitute in various dishes. Gradually introduce them to your diet to allow your body to adjust to their strong taste and potent properties.

While papaya seeds offer numerous health benefits, it's important to consume them in moderation. Excessive intake can lead to digestive discomfort and potential toxicity. Pregnant women and individuals with certain medical conditions should consult a healthcare professional before adding papaya seeds to their diet.

Incorporating papaya seeds into your daily diet can provide a multitude of health benefits, from improved digestion to enhanced liver function and even cancer prevention. These tiny seeds are a powerhouse of nutrients and medicinal properties, making them a valuable addition to a healthy lifestyle. Remember to start small, enjoy them in various recipes, and consult your doctor if you have any concerns. Embrace the overlooked treasure of papaya seeds and experience their remarkable health benefits firsthand.

Papaya seed powder is increasingly recognized for its digestive benefits. Packed with enzymes like papain and chymopapain, it aids in breaking down proteins and supports digestive health by easing constipation and bloating. The powder's potent antibacterial properties also help in balancing gut flora, promoting a healthy digestive environment. Regular consumption of papaya seed powder can alleviate digestive discomforts and enhance nutrient absorption, making it a valuable addition to maintaining digestive wellness.

With monsoons arriving and the rains making everything feel damp and sticky, people start investing in high-end dehumidifiers. But, what if some plants could do just that job? Here are some indoor plants that can absorb the humidity.
Canva
Boston ferns are great at absorbing moisture through their leaves, making them natural dehumidifiers. And that is why people usually keep them in bathrooms and kitchens.
Canva
Spider plants are extremely easy to care for and are also great at absorbing moisture from the air. Not just that, they can also help purify indoor air, making the surroundings much cooler.
Canva
​Peace lilies are not just beautiful but also helpful in reducing humidity levels. Peace lilies absorb the dampness in the air through their leaves, leaving the room fresh.
Canva
​English ivy is a beautiful plant that can be grown in both pots or as hanging plants. This one too absorbs moisture from the air making it excellent for the monsoon.
Canva
Tillandsias are air plants, i.e., they do not need soil to grow. These plants are great at absorbing nutrients from the air, and can also absorb the humidity present inside the house.
Canva
Aloe vera is one of the most famous and low-maintenance succulents. It has thick, fleshy leaves that store water, which helps reduce humidity levels indoors.
Canva
Snake plants too absorb moisture and help purify the indoor air.
Canva
One of the very few flowering plants that can absorb moisture well is the Orchids. They are soft, and beautiful, and the leaves are excellent at reducing indoor humidity.
Canva

Based on the footage of North Korean leader kim jong un meeting Russian President Vladimir Putin Wednesday, former CIA North Korea analyst Sue Mi Terry said Kim does not look healthy. “My first reaction looking at kim jong un was, ‘Oof, he doesn’t look too great to me,’” Terry told CNN. “There was a time when he lost a little weight and he looked better. So my initial reaction was that he didn’t look, in terms of being healthy, because his health is something that we always track anyway," Terry said.

In a letter published by North Korean state media on Tuesday, Russian President Vladimir Putin vowed to establish trade and security systems with North Korea that are independent of Western influence. The letter, which appeared in the Workers' Party mouthpiece, Rodong Sinmun, came ahead of Putin's anticipated visit to the country. Putin emphasized the strong ties between Russia and North Korea, stating that over the past seven decades, the two nations have cultivated a relationship founded on "equality, mutual respect and trust."

Putin and Kim Jong-un showcased their alliance in a Russian-made Aurus limousine. Despite being a symbol of Russia's domestic capability, customs records reveal significant reliance on imported parts, notably from South Korea. Between 2018 and 2023, Russia imported $34 million worth of components for Aurus, highlighting ongoing dependence on Western technology amid efforts to avoid isolation.

A recent report by South Korea's unification ministry exposes North Korea's severe efforts to curb the influence of South Korean culture. The 2024 Report on North Korean Human Rights highlights a case where a 22-year-old man was publicly executed for consuming and distributing South Korean media, in violation of strict laws against "reactionary ideology." The crackdown extends to mundane practices reflecting a broader campaign initiated by North Korean leaders to shield citizens from perceived Western and South Korean influences, despite increasing cultural infiltration and dissent among the population.

North Korea claimed a successful multiwarhead missile test, aiming to enhance defense penetration capabilities, but South Korea and US analysis declared it a failure. Experts suggest ongoing challenges in missile technology development. Recent tensions include North Korean protests against US military presence and balloon diplomacy with South Korea, while a new pact with Russia raises concerns over regional stability and missile advancements.

North Korea test-fired what appeared to be a hypersonic missile on Wednesday, but the launch ended in a mid-air explosion, an official from Seoul's Joint Chiefs of Staff said. The JCS official said the test of what appeared to be a hypersonic missile ended in failure after a journey of some 250 kilometres (155 miles).

Balloons filled with trash were launched towards South Korea, escalating tensions. President Yoon condemned the action and criticized a Pyongyang-Moscow agreement. Kim Yo Jong warned of counteractions, while Park Won-gon highlighted escalating border tensions. The situation remains tense as both sides engage in propaganda campaigns, with Seoul ready to respond.

China's response to the new defence pact between Russia and North Korea remains uncertain, with concerns over power dynamics among the three authoritarian states. The pact mandates mutual defence assistance, leaving China in a challenging position.

Tensions are escalating along the Korean border after South Korea's army fired warning shots, forcing North Korean troops to retreat. This action was taken in response to a third border intrusion by Pyongyang forces this month. According to South Korea's Joint Chief of Staff, several North Korean troops crossed the military demarcation line on Thursday. They were engaged in unspecified construction work on the northern side of the border.

South Korean activists flew balloons carrying anti-North Korean leaflets and media into North Korea, escalating tensions. This prompted North Korea to retaliate with trash-filled balloons and increased military presence at the border. Meanwhile, South Korea resumed propaganda broadcasts, aggravating the situation. Recent developments include South Korea condemning kim jong un's defence pact with Russia and considering arms aid to Ukraine, opposed by Putin.

Russian President Putin signed agreements with Vietnamese President To Lam to strengthen ties in Asia and counter international isolation. Deals covered education, science, technology, and energy. They agreed on a nuclear center in Vietnam.

Concerns regarding the health of North Korean leader Kim Jong-Un have emerged following his latest public appearance alongside Russian President Vladimir Putin. Speculation about Kim's well-being intensified after a former CIA analyst remarked, "Oof, he doesn't look too great," referencing Kim's appearance during their recent meeting.

A new mutual-defense pact between Russia and North Korea pledges aid in case of attack, echoing Cold War-era agreements. Details are vague, prompting global concern. Similar pacts exist with China and the US in Asia-Pacific, highlighting regional tensions and strategic implications amid escalating conflicts.
Putin gifted Kim an Aurus Senat, his official presidential car, featuring a hybrid 4.4-litre twin-turbo V8 engine.

Amid international isolation due to the Ukraine conflict, Russian president Vladimir Putin visited Vietnam to bolster ties, emphasizing historical connections and cooperation in military and energy sectors. The visit underscores Russia's efforts to maintain influence in Asia despite global sanctions, while Vietnam navigates complex diplomatic dynamics with Russia and the West.

Shatrughan Sinha recently shared an update on his health status from the hospital where photographs captured him sitting in a chair. The actor-MP enthusiastically watched the India vs South Africa T20 World Cup finals, accompanied by his wife Poonam Sinha, family members, and friends. In a heartfelt note, Shatrughan expressed joy in the company of loved ones amidst the 'controversy & confusion' stirred by social media. He praised Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma for their decision to retire from T20 cricket on a high note, applauding their leadership and the team's victory. Shatrughan highlighted the thrilling match and credited both teams for their performances, concluding with patriotic sentiments and blessings.

Soumya is a technology editor with the TOI Most Searched Products, where she has been harnessing her interest in the latest gadgets and covering the tech industry since 2017. She has more than a decade of experience in creating stories and product reviewing from scratch, especially smartphones, smart devices, washing machines and other electronic gear. During her decade-plus career, she has garnered an expertise in reviewing phones, appliances and gadgets of all shapes and sizes, and mastered the understanding of everything from game consoles to air fryers. In the rare moments, when she is not exploring a new gadget, she can be found lost in her books or music, or pampering her tastebuds with different food.Read More

The TOI Sports Desk excels in a myriad of roles that capture the essence of live sporting events and deliver compelling content to readers worldwide. From running live blogs for India and non-India cricket matches to global spectacles featuring Indian talents, like the Chess World Cup final featuring Praggnanandhaa and the Badminton World Championships semifinal featuring HS Prannoy, our live coverage extends to all mega sporting events. We extensively cover events like the Olympics, Asian Games, Cricket World Cups, FIFA World Cups, and more. The desk is also adept at writing comprehensive match reports and insightful post-match commentary, complemented by stats-based articles that provide an in-depth analysis of player performances and team dynamics. We track news wires for key stories, conduct exclusive player interviews in both text and video formats, and file content from print editions and reporters. We keep track of all viral stories, trending topics and produce our own copies on the subjects. We deliver accurate, engaging, and up-to-the-minute sports content, round the clock.Read More

The Russian defence ministry announced that its forces had captured two more east Ukrainian villages. Russia’s defense ministry said it took the village of Novopokrovske in the eastern Donetsk region and the village of Stepova Novoselivka in the north-east Kharkiv region. The gains came after Russia claimed two other villages over the weekend. Watch for more details.

Hina Khan recently made a shocking revelation of being diagnosed with stage three Breast Cancer. The actress took to her Instagram handle to share the news, in a post, she mentioned, "Hello everyone, to address the recent rumour, I want to share some important news with all the Hinaholics and everyone who loves and cares for me. I have been diagnosed with stage three Breast Cancer. Despite this challenging diagnosis, I want to reassure everyone that I am doing well. I am strong, determined and fully committed to overcoming this disease. My treatment has already begun, and I am ready to do everything necessary to emerge from this even stronger." Reacting to the same, celebs Lata Sabharwal, Shehnaaz Gill, Shivangi Joshi and others sent healing messages to the actress.

Shehnaaz Gill commented on Hina's post, sending prayers, "You are very strong Hina! Take care.. you will come out of this like a fighter. Sending you strength and love." Jennifer commented, "I truly believe in your ability to overcome this challenge..stay strong and keep believing in your resilience Hina..sending lots of love."

Hina's onscreen kids in Yeh Rishta, Rohan Mehra and Ashnoor Kaur sent care, Rohan wrote, 'Oh no. Please take care Hina di. Coming to see you asap'. Ashnoor wrote, "Stay strong our Sher Khan, we know you’ll fight this battle too… Sending strength & love"

Mouni Roy penned a heartfelt note, "As unbelievable as this is, I know you ll fight it and come out stronger. You are one of the strongest person I know. Praying for your recovery earnestly. All my love." While Rajiv wrote, "You are so strong and so brave Hina! We all love you and are praying for you! Lots of love!"

Ankita wrote, "Hina you are stronger than this that's it, girl!! This shall too pass!! sending love and lots of strength to you right away. God bless you." Arti Singh added, "You are stronger than anything in this whole wide world All of us are praying. And your dad is with Allah to give u the best way to get u out of this … lot of prayers for you."

Kavita Kaushik penned, "Cancer should be very scared... it chose the wrong address, if anyone can kick its ass and emerge beautifully, it's you Hina. Sending you and the family strength in abundance." While Sambhavna wrote, " You are a Tigress. I know u will fight this Battle and come out Super Strong... All my love wishes and strength to you my love."

Shraddha Arya wrote, "We all Hope and Pray that you get out of this difficult phase soon… wishing to see a healthier, happier, stronger and more powerful you on the other side." Surbhi Jyoti wrote, "Hina, tu sher hai yaar. You'll be fine and you'll come out stronger. Sending you all the love and prayers." And Debina Bonnerjee penned, "Sherni hain tu. You are doing good. You are good. Believe and move ahead."

Parth Samthaan was Hina's co-star in Kasauti Zindagi Kay 2, he wrote, "You are the strongest women I know I know you will overcome this with the strength and belief you have bless you." Gauahar wrote, "All my duas . U are good . U will be good ! Ameen . Allahu khairur haafeezun."

Ayesha Singh commented, "You are in my thoughts and prayers, and I would love to extend any kind of support you and your family would need. There is no doubt you will bounce back stronger." While Niti Taylor wrote, "I want you to know that from today you are in my thoughts and prayers. Sending you all my love, support, positivity, and more and more power to keep fighting. You are stronger than you know! Wishing you lots of strength stay strong!"

"This FY 2023-24 tax calculator computes tax as per the old tax regime and the new tax regime, to give you a quick view of savings (if any), under the new tax regime.New tax regime: The Finance bill 2023, has made some changes to the new tax regime as mentioned below:Changes to the slab rates under new tax regime
Income up to ₹300,000        - Nil
₹3,00,001 to ₹6,00,000         - 5%
₹6,00,001 to ₹900,000          - 10%
₹9,00,001 to ₹12,00,000        - 15%
₹12,00,001 to ₹15,00,000     - 20%
Above ₹15,00,000                  - 30%The new tax regime is now the default tax regime, however, individuals will have an option to opt for the old tax regimeThe limit for rebate has been increased to INR 7,00,000 under the new tax regimeStandard deduction of INR 50,000 is now allowed under the new regime. However, other deductions and exemptions as specified below cannot be claimed under the new regime 
- House Rent Allowance, Leave Travel Concession etc.
- Deduction of professional tax
- Loss under the head ""House Property""
- Almost all of the deductions available under Chapter VI-A of the Act [excluding employer's contribution to National Pension System (‘NPS’), which will be allowed as a deduction even under the new regime]. List of such common deductions disallowed under the new regime are:
   - 80C (life insurance premium, employee's contribution to Provident Fund, investment in Public Provident Fund etc.) up to INR 150,000
   - 80CCD(1B) (your contribution to NPS) up to INR 50,000 
   - 80D (Medical insurance) up to maximum of INR 100,000 
   - 80E (interest on education loan)
   - 80EEA/ 80EEB (interest on specified loans) up to INR 150,000
   - 80G (donation) 
   - 80TTA/ 80TTB (deduction of specified interest income) up to INR 10,000/ INR 50,000The highest surcharge of 37% has been brought down to 25% under the new tax regime"

This tax calculator works under certain assumptions to calculate estimated tax liability; and may not provide accurate results in all circumstances. Thus, your actual tax liability may be different. Readers are advised to seek appropriate professional tax advice and compute their tax based on applicable provisions of the Income-tax Act, 1961 and Income-tax Rules, 1962.
(This calculator is for resident individuals and does not account for loss under the head "Capital Gains".)
Financial Year ("FY"): This means a period of 12 months (April to March) for which income is being taxed/ assessed.

1. How to use calculatorThe below steps have to be followed in order to calculate the total tax payable using the income-tax calculator:Select the Financial Year (FY) for which you wish to calculate the tax payableSelect your age bracket as this will determine the income-tax slab you fall inChoose the appropriate response – if you are a salaried employee or notIf you have selected Yes, enter your salary details such as basic salary, House Rent Allowance (HRA), other allowances and perquisitesEnter the amount of exemptions on salary income (other than HRA) which are not allowed under the new tax regime (e.g., Education allowance, Hostel allowance, Leave travel
allowance, etc.)Enter the amount of exemptions on salary income (other than HRA) which are allowed under the New Regime (e.g., Gratuity, Leave encashment etc.)For HRA exemption, where applicable, enter the amount of rent paid by you (if any) for the entire FY and select the option for the city you reside inEnter the amount of professional tax paid, if any, and click on ‘Next’Fill all the details in the ‘Income from House Property’ section (if applicable).Click on “+ ADD #2 PROPERTY DETAILS” to add details of the second property (if applicable)Click on ‘Next’ to proceed furtherEnter the details of savings/ time deposit interest received and of any other income in the ‘Income from Other Sources’ section and click on ‘Next’Enter the details in the ‘Deductions’ section under Section (u/s) 80C, 80CCD(1B),80CCD(2), 80D, 80E, 80EEA, 80EEB, 80TTA and 80TTB , wherever applicableClick on ‘Calculate Tax’ and your taxable income and tax payable shall be computed...

Sam Bankman-Fried, testifying in his own defense at his fraud trial on Friday, acknowledged that a "lot of people got hurt" when the FTX cryptocurrency exchange he founded collapsed, but said he did not defraud anyone or take customer funds. Shortly after taking the witness stand in Manhattan federal court, Bankman-Fried said he made "a number of small mistakes and a number of larger mistakes" while running the now-bankrupt exchange. The biggest mistake, he said, was not implementing a dedicated risk management team.

Indian Navy Agniveer Admit Card 2024: The Indian Navy has released the admit cards for the Agniveer Senior Secondary Recruit (SSR) 02/2024 written exam, scheduled from 9th to 11th July 2024 for SSR candidates and 12th to 15th July 2024 for MR candidates. The selection process includes shortlisting based on 12th marks, a written exam, physical tests, document verification, and a medical examination. Candidates must download their admit cards from the official website and follow the guidelines provided.

Australia has increased student visa fees for international students from USD 710 to USD 1,600, sparking concerns among Indian students and industry stakeholders about its impact on education and international relations.

The National Institute of Fashion Technology (NIFT) has released the Round 2 seat allotment results for 2024 admissions. Candidates can check their results and download provisional allotment letters from the NIFT admissions portal. Successful candidates must complete the online payment of the admission fee. Those not allotted seats in this round will automatically be considered for the next round. Correction windows for NRI sponsored seats and choice filling are available in early July.

The Maliks, Armaan, Payal and Kritika have been in the headlines for quite some time. Before entering the Bigg Boss OTT 3 house, the family was mired in serious controversies regarding their marriage, family, cases and more. Take a look at the times when Armaan Malik and his wives made headlines due to these major controversies.

In one of their family vlogs, Payal had opened up about her pregnancy and proving that she was pregnant and gave birth to the twins. While talking about that she even shared that Armaan had gotten married earlier, she said, 'Armaan ki shaadi hui thi jab woh 17 saal ke the par unka Jama nahi aur woh alag ho gaye.' It was even revealed that he also had two children with the former wife.

In the vlog, where Payal and Kritika opened up about Armaan's former wedding they shared that if they ever felt that things aren't working fine between them they would not shy away from seeking divorce from Armaan. Payal even mentioned, "Pehle ki baat alag thi, humne jo tha humare paas woh de diya divorce case mein aur woh clear ho gaya. Poori zindagi iss majboori ke rishtey mein koi nah rehta hai."

It was reported that Armaan had already been married before marrying Payal and Kritika. He supposedly has two children with his first wife, Sumitra, who is also from Haryana. Armaan had revealed that initially, he had married Payal in the temple and not legalised his wedding till she pressurised him to go for a court marriage and certify it.

Shortly after marrying Kritika Basera, Armaan was accused of assaulting their 16-year-old domestic assistant. As a result of this police case, he attempted suicide. In a viral video, he accused his wife Payal's relatives of filing a false complaint against him. He requested that the lawsuit be dropped or he would commit himself. Although the exact details are unknown, several web reports indicate that he was detained in the r*pe case.

Armaan made headlines in 2019 after he threatened to commit suicide from a six-story building in West Delhi's Hari Nagar neighbourhood. The alleged incident occurred shortly after he had a heated dispute with his second wife, Kritika Basera while checking into a hotel in the capital. Payal also arrived at the occasion, amidst the tremendous turmoil and family drama that had ensued. Armaan Malik climbed the hotel's terrace, threatening suicide. Police had to intervene, and the rescue mission lasted over 20 hours.

Armaan's sister Sapna had made shocking allegations against him and his wives. In a vlog, she mentioned that Armaan, his wife Payal, and Kritika have demanded money from her since she began making money from her vlogs. She even alleged that Payal treated her unfairly and that the suits she recently received as a present were of poor quality. Sapna further said that she had severed all relations with Armaan and his family and would never see them again in her life. She said "Meri kamai nahi lungi main? Pichle mahine maine koi kamayi nahi ki Youtube se? Jo mera naata hai na, kuch bhi bolu, aaj mera naata toot chuka hai sbse. Jo mere saath kar rahe bol bol ke, meri beti ko bol rahe mujhe bol rahe, aaj main bta deti hu ki main kabhi bhi apne mayke nahi jaungi".

Korean culture has garnered global admiration for its focus on health, well-being, and holistic living. From their meticulous skincare routines to their balanced diets, Koreans have cultivated habits that promote long-term health and happiness. Here are 10 healthy Korean habits that Indians should consider incorporating into their daily lives.
Canva

Fermented foods like kimchi and yogurt are staples in the Korean diet. These foods are rich in probiotics, which promote a healthy gut microbiome. Indians can benefit from adding more fermented foods such as homemade yogurt, pickles, and traditional fermented drinks to their diets.
Canva

Barley tea (bori cha) is a popular beverage in Korea, known for its hydrating and digestive benefits. Replacing sugary drinks with barley tea can help Indians stay hydrated, improve digestion, and enjoy a refreshing, caffeine-free alternative.
Canva

Koreans place a strong emphasis on regular exercise, including walking, hiking, and gym workouts. Indians can adopt this habit by incorporating more physical activities into their daily routines, such as morning walks, yoga sessions, or weekend hikes, to maintain fitness and reduce stress.
Canva

Korean cuisine emphasizes fresh vegetables, lean proteins, and fermented foods like kimchi. Incorporating more vegetables and fermented foods into the Indian diet can improve gut health, boost immunity, and provide essential nutrients for overall well-being.
Canva

Koreans practice mindful eating, paying attention to portion sizes and savoring each bite. Indians can benefit from this habit by slowing down during meals, focusing on the flavors and textures of their food, and avoiding overeating, which can lead to better digestion and weight management.
Canva

Sharing meals with family and friends is a cherished tradition in Korea. Indians can strengthen family bonds and enhance their social well-being by prioritizing regular family meals, encouraging open communication, and fostering a sense of togetherness.
Canva

Koreans never skip breakfast and often enjoy nutritious, balanced morning meals. Indians can improve their energy levels and overall health by incorporating a healthy breakfast into their daily routine, including whole grains, fruits, and proteins.
Canva

Koreans consume various herbal teas, such as ginseng tea and green tea, for their health benefits. Indians can explore and adopt similar herbal teas known for their antioxidant properties, digestive benefits, and calming effects.
Canva

Koreans are renowned for their elaborate skincare routines, which typically include multiple steps such as double cleansing, toning, moisturizing, and sun protection. Adopting a similar regimen can help Indians combat skin issues caused by pollution and harsh weather, ensuring a radiant and healthy complexion.
Canva

Koreans deeply respect their elders and prioritize mental well-being through practices like meditation and mindfulness. Indians can enhance their mental health by practicing gratitude, respecting family traditions, and incorporating mindfulness techniques into their daily lives.
Canva

TRAVEL TRENDS, WORLD
                                         Created : Jul 2, 2024, 00:00 IST

In an age where global tourism has skyrocketed, there remain a few hidden gems that receive a surprisingly low number of visitors each year. These are the least-visited countries in the world, but are no less as compared to their counterparts in offering unique experiences and boasting of untouched landscapes. These places also make for ideal destinations for travellers seeking tranquillity and adventure away from the crowded tourist trails. If you are also keen for such unique experiences, here are some of the world's least-visited countries.

Tuvalu, a tiny island nation in the Pacific Ocean, tops the list as the least-visited country in the world. With only 3,700 tourists per year, this remote paradise offers pristine beaches, crystal-clear waters, and a slow-paced way of life. Its isolation is both a blessing and a curse; while it deters mass tourism, it also preserves the natural beauty and cultural heritage of the islands. Visitors can enjoy traditional Polynesian hospitality, explore coral reefs teeming with marine life, and witness the impact of climate change on this vulnerable nation.

The Marshall Islands, another Pacific Ocean treasure, sees around 6,100 tourists annually. Known for its stunning atolls and vibrant marine biodiversity, it is a haven for divers and snorkelers. The remnants of World War II, including sunken ships and aircraft, add a historical dimension to underwater explorations. Despite its beauty, the Marshall Islands' remote location and limited infrastructure contribute to its low tourist numbers.

Niue, a small island country in the South Pacific, attracts about 10,200 visitors each year. This self-governing territory of New Zealand boasts rugged limestone cliffs, extensive cave systems, and crystal-clear waters perfect for snorkelling and diving. Niue’s small population and lack of commercialisation make it a perfect retreat for those looking to escape the hustle and bustle of more frequented destinations. The island’s commitment to eco-tourism ensures that its natural beauty remains unspoiled.

Kiribati, comprising 33 atolls and reef islands, welcomes around 12,000 tourists annually. This Central Pacific nation offers unique cultural experiences and breathtaking seascapes. The Gilbert Islands, Phoenix Islands, and Line Islands each have their own distinct attractions, from traditional village life to world-class fishing and bird watching. Kiribati’s low tourist numbers are due in part to its remote location and limited air connections, but for intrepid travellers, it offers an authentic and rewarding experience.

The Federated States of Micronesia, with about 18,000 annual visitors, is an archipelago of over 600 islands spread across the western Pacific Ocean. Known for its extraordinary diving sites, such as the famous Blue Hole and the Japanese shipwrecks in Chuuk Lagoon, Micronesia is a paradise for underwater enthusiasts. The islands’ diverse cultures, lush landscapes, and historical sites offer a rich and varied travel experience. Despite its appeal, Micronesia remains off the beaten path due to its geographical isolation.

Montserrat, a small Caribbean island, attracts roughly 19,300 tourists per year. This British Overseas Territory is known for its active volcano, Soufrière Hills, which dramatically reshaped the island in the 1990s. The volcanic activity has created a unique landscape, with lush greenery contrasting starkly with the ash-covered southern part of the island. Montserrat offers hiking, diving, and a chance to explore the ‘Pompeii of the Caribbean,’ the buried city of Plymouth. The island’s low tourist numbers can be attributed to its recovery from volcanic eruptions and limited accessibility.

The Solomon Islands, with around 29,000 visitors annually, is a tropical paradise in the South Pacific. Comprising nearly 1,000 islands, it boasts stunning coral reefs, WWII relics, and vibrant indigenous cultures. The islands’ remote location and underdeveloped tourism infrastructure contribute to its low visitation numbers, but those who do make the journey are rewarded with unspoiled natural beauty and rich cultural experiences. The Solomon Islands are ideal for eco-tourists and history buffs alike.

Russian literature is simply elite! It is sophisticated, deep, thought-provoking, and at times ‘Oh-so-scandalous’. But, Russian literature has not reached many people as yet in biblio-circuits. Here we mention 8 amazing books to read when starting out.
Canva-AI

This novel is about the lives of 3 brothers and their father - Fyodor Pavlovich, and three sons - Alyosha, Ivan, and Dmitri. The book talks about human nature and the eternal struggle between good and evil.
Penguin-Classics

Set against the Napoleonic Wars, this epic novel follows the lives of aristocratic families. It is an extremely heavy book and a complicated read that blends in itself personal stories, historical events, and a view of Russian society.
Penguin-Classics

‘Dead Souls’ follows the life of Pavel Ivanovich Chichikov, as he travels through the Russian countryside, buying the rights to deceased serfs from landowners. His scheme is to use these "dead souls" to acquire a large estate and make himself a ‘Gentleman’.
Penguin-Classics
‘Lolita’, a novel considered inappropriate and controversial even today, is about the life of Humbert, a literature professor who becomes obsessed with a twelve-year-old girl named Dolores.
Penguin-Classics

‘Uncle Vanya’ is famous as a play written by Chekhov who was an exemplary playwright. The story is about the frustrations and disappointments of the characters living on a rural estate. The arrival of Serebryakov and his young wife Yelena changes some lives.
Penguin-Classics

‘The Dream Life of Sukhanov’ is about Anatoly Sukhanov, an art critic who once dreamed of being a surrealist painter. But, now that he is old and the regime is about to change, his past comes back to him, and he re-thinks about several of his decisions and dreams.
Penguin-Classics
‘A Hero of Our Time’ is a series of interconnected stories about Pechorin, a Byronic hero whose actions reveal his cynical, manipulative nature.
Penguin-Classics

‘Fathers and Sons’ is about the life of Arkady, Bazarov, and the Kirsanov family. The novel shows the clash between the older generation of traditionalists and the younger generation of nihilists in 19th-century Russia.
Penguin-Classics

Throughout history, many cities have been lost to time, only to be rediscovered centuries later. These ancient cities, once thriving centers of civilization, offer a glimpse into the past and reveal the ingenuity and culture of their inhabitants. The rediscovery of these cities has often been the result of dedicated archaeological efforts, sometimes sparked by legends and historical texts. Here are seven such cities that have been brought back to light.Image: Canva

Pompeii was buried under volcanic ash and pumice after the catastrophic eruption of Mount Vesuvius in 79 AD. The city remained hidden until its rediscovery in 1748 by Spanish engineer Rocque Joaquin de Alcubierre. Excavations revealed well-preserved buildings, artifacts, and even casts of the victims, providing invaluable insights into Roman life. The sudden burial preserved Pompeii in a state of suspended animation, making it one of the most significant archaeological sites in the world.Image: Canva

Machu Picchu, the Incan citadel located high in the Andes Mountains, was brought to international attention by American historian Hiram Bingham in 1911. Although known to local indigenous people, it had been forgotten by the outside world. The site, believed to have been built in the 15th century, showcases the architectural prowess of the Incas with its terraced fields, temples, and intricate stone constructions. Machu Picchu is now a UNESCO World Heritage Site and a major tourist attraction.Image: Canva

The ancient city of Troy, immortalized in Homer’s epic poems, was long thought to be a myth. Its rediscovery in the 1870s by German archaeologist Heinrich Schliemann confirmed its existence. Located in modern-day Turkey, the site revealed multiple layers of settlements dating back to the Bronze Age. Schliemann’s excavations uncovered fortifications, houses, and artifacts, including what he claimed to be “Priam’s Treasure.” Troy’s rediscovery has provided a wealth of information about ancient civilizations in the region.Image: Canva

Angkor, the capital of the Khmer Empire, was rediscovered in the 19th century by French explorer Henri Mouhot. The city, which flourished between the 9th and 15th centuries, is home to the famous Angkor Wat temple complex. Angkor’s rediscovery revealed a vast urban landscape with sophisticated water management systems, temples, and palaces. The site is evidence of the architectural and engineering skills of the Khmer people and remains a significant cultural and historical landmark.Image: Canva

Petra, also known as the “Rose City,” was rediscovered by Swiss explorer Johann Ludwig Burckhardt in 1812. This ancient Nabatean city, carved into the red sandstone cliffs, was a major trading hub in the 4th century BC. Petra’s rediscovery unveiled its stunning rock-cut architecture, including the iconic Treasury and Monastery. The city’s strategic location and advanced water management systems highlight the ingenuity of the Nabateans. Petra is now a UNESCO World Heritage Site and a popular tourist destination.Image: Canva

Mohenjo-Daro, one of the principal cities of the Indus Valley Civilization, was rediscovered in the 1920s by Indian archaeologist R. D. Banerji. The city, dating back to around 2500 BCE, featured advanced urban planning with grid-like streets, drainage systems, and public baths. Excavations revealed a highly organized society with a rich cultural heritage. Mohenjo-Daro’s rediscovery has provided important insights into one of the world’s earliest urban civilizations.Image: Canva

The ancient city of Ebla was rediscovered in the 1960s by Italian archaeologist Paolo Matthiae. Located in modern-day Syria, Ebla was a major center of trade and culture in the 3rd millennium BCE. Excavations uncovered a vast archive of cuneiform tablets, revealing the city’s extensive diplomatic and commercial networks. The discovery of Ebla has significantly enhanced our understanding of early Semitic languages and the political landscape of the ancient Near East.Image: Canva

Virat Kohli proved his big-match credentials, with his 59-ball 76 in the final clash -- after he managed just 75 runs in seven innings during the competition until the finale and was named the man of the match. Lauding the Indian cricket star, former Pakistan cricketer Ahmad Shahzad said that India would have never won the T20 World Cup final without Virat Kohli's innings, adding that no one should compare Babar Azam or any other cricketer to the former Indian captain.

South Africa's David Miller was disappointed after losing to India in the ICC T20 World Cup final. India won by seven runs, ending their ICC trophy drought and securing their second ICC T20 World Cup title. India's effective death bowling, impressive batting from Virat Kohli and Axar Patel, and Miller's dismissal sealed the victory.

The last 10 years have been the most peaceful time for India after independence, says Dilip Mandal on Lok Sabha leader of opposition Rahul Gandhi's speech

On Lok Sabha LoP and Congress MP Rahul Gandhi's statement in the Parliament, Dilip Mandal, Journalist and prominent Dalit voice said, " During his address, Rahul Gandhi made an objectionable statement that a lot of atrocities are happening against Muslims and Christians in India. I believe that the numbers don't suggest this. The last 10 years have been the most peaceful time for India after independence if you see the numbers. During the Congress regime, so many riots used to happen...if you compare that in the last 10 years, only 2 major communal riot incidents have happened, Delhi and Manipur...So the scale has reduced...riots don't last long now...this is an attempt to scare the investors and it will affect India...Congress is against trying to appease Muslims...he is thinking of getting the Muslim votes, especially the Muslim votes of Bihar and UP, from SP and RJD"

Explore Om Birla's remarkable journey from grassroots politics to his re-election as Lok Sabha Speaker through this insightful web story. Delve into his early life, educational background, and impactful career in shaping India's parliamentary landscape.
Image Source: ANI
Om Birla was born in a Baniya Hindu family to Shrikrishna Birla and Shakuntala Devi. He grew up in Kota, Rajasthan, where he later began his political career.
Image Source: ANI
Birla completed his master's degree in commerce from Government Commerce College, Kota, and Maharshi Dayanand Saraswati University, Ajmer.
Image Source: PTI
He started his political journey as the district president of BJP’s youth wing in Kota in 1987, marking the beginning of his active involvement in politics.
Image Source: IANS
Om Birla won his first assembly election from Kota South in 2003, marking the start of his legislative career in Rajasthan.
Image Source: ANI
He successfully defended his assembly seat in 2008 and 2013 with significant margins, solidifying his position in Rajasthan politics.
Image Source: PTI
Birla was elected as the Member of Parliament from Kota constituency in 2014, representing BJP in the 16th Lok Sabha.
Image Source: PTI
During his tenure, Birla served on the Standing Committee on Energy and Consultative Committee for the Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment in the Lok Sabha.
Image Source: ANI
In 2019, Om Birla was elected as the Speaker of the 17th Lok Sabha, where he oversaw significant legislative sessions and parliamentary reforms.
Image Source: IANS
Birla made history by being re-elected as the Speaker of the 18th Lok Sabha in 2024, emphasizing his continued leadership and parliamentary acumen.
Image Source: PTI
Under Birla’s leadership, the Lok Sabha achieved milestones, including legislative efficiency during crises like the COVID-19 pandemic and significant procedural reforms.
Image Source: TNN
Thanks For Reading!

Keeping fish as pets at home can be a rewarding and calming experience. However, not many people have the space or finances to keep large fish tanks. So, here we list 10 fishes that can be kept in small home aquariums (1-2 feet long).
Canva

Betta fish are known for their vibrant colours and flowing fins. They are easy to care for and can thrive even in small tanks. However, do note that they are territorial so only one betta fish should be kept per tank with other peaceful fish species.
Canva
Neon Tetras are small, colourful fish schooling fish that should be kept in a group of eight or more. Their peaceful nature and bright colour is what makes them a popular choice for small aquariums.
Canva
Guppies are hardy, colourful, small fish that are perfect for beginners. They are easy to care for and can be kept in small tanks. They reproduce quickly.
Canva

Similar to Guppies, Endler's Livebearers are also small and colorful fishes that are peaceful. They are a great choice for small tanks. Do note that they also reproduce easily, so keep an eye on the population.
Canva
Dwarf gouramis are smaller than the usual gouramis. They have bright colours and are peaceful and curious.
Canva
Pygmy Corydoras are small, peaceful catfish that live in groups of eight or more. They are excellent tank cleaners and can be kept in small tanks (1 foot or longer).
Canva
Harlequin Rasboras are small, peaceful, grouping fish. They have striking black and orange markings and are easy to keep in small home aquariums.
Canva
Zebra Danios are small, hardy fish. They have distinctive black and white stripes and are quite active swimmers. They live in groups of eight or more.
Canva
White Cloud Mountain Minnows are small, peaceful fish that do well in cooler water. They are easy to care for and prefer living in groups. They are suitable for small tanks.
Canva
While not a fish, Cherry Shrimp are good additions to small aquariums. They are small, brightly colored, and help in cleaning leftover food in aquariums.
Canva
Thanks For Reading!
Read Next

From Betta fish to Gourami, here we list down 10 intelligent fish species that can be kept in home aquariums. These fishes are not only beautiful looking but also offer interactive experiences to their owners.
Canva
Betta Fish are known for their vibrant colours, beautiful fins, and territorial and interactive behaviour. They are intelligent, can recognise their owners and even perform simple tricks.
Canva
Oscars are highly trainable and they are intelligent enough to recognise their owners.
Canva
Angelfish are social and intelligent, and they often form strong bonds with their tank mates. They can recognise their owners and show excitement during feeding time.
Canva
Did you know that Goldfish have a longer memory span than commonly believed? They are intelligent fish species and can be trained to perform tricks.
Canva
Cichlids are known for their complex behaviours and social structures. They are intelligent and have the ability to interact with their environment and solve problems.
Canva
Gouramis are intelligent and curious in nature. They are territorial and often explore their surroundings. They are also quite social and can recognise their owners.
Canva

Zebra Danios are known for being highly active and social, and they thrive in a school of six or more fish. Due to their intelligence and adaptability, Zebra Danios are often used in scientific research.
Canva
Check out The Times of India's website.
Canva
Thanks For Reading!

The 2020 election is the 59th quadrennial presidential election. Incumbent President Donald Trump will be challenged by Democratic former vice president Joe Biden for the top post. While Biden selected Kamala Harris to be his running mate, Trump endorsed the name of incumbent vice president Mike Pence.

In the last election, held in 2016, Trump defeated Democrat and former secretary of state Hillary Clinton.This was the fifth presidential election in which the winning candidate lost the popular vote.

While Hillary won 2.87 million more votes than Trump did, the latter received the majority in the Electoral College. Trump received 304 electoral votes and Clinton 227.

The run-up to the 2016 elections was marred by allegations of Russian interference in the elections to "undermine public faith in the US democratic process and to denigrate presidential candidate Hillary Clinton". In January 2017, the US government's intelligence agencies found the involvement of the Russian government in the 2016 polls.

In this election, Trump administration's response to Coronavirus, protest against killings of African American, the appointment of Supreme Court Justice Amy Coney Barrett and the future of Affordable Care Act are some of the issues hogging the limelight in this election.

While Trump secured Republican nomination without much opposition, Biden was selected as the Democratic nomination over his closest rival, Senator Bernie Sanders. The Democratic primaries were termed as one of the most-competitive seen in the recent US election history. It saw one of the largest pool of presidential candidates for any political party.

If elected, Biden would become the oldest person to serve as president at 78 years old. This is the first presidential election in US history where both the presidential candidates are over 70. Seventy-four-year-old Trump is the oldest first-term US president.

The winner of the 2020 US presidential election will take oath as the 46th US president on January 20, 2021. The coronavirus pandemic meant that a record 90 million people — about 65% of the total turnout in 2016 — have voted three-day before the scheduled date of November 3.

A lot of people are also voting early to avoid long queues and crowds at a time when coronavirus has claimed the lives of 230k people in the country.

​Birds of prey are known for their hunting prowess, sharp talons, and keen eyesight. These ten formidable raptors showcase the diversity and power of predatory birds worldwide.​
Pexels

​Buzzards are versatile hunters, preying on small mammals, birds, and carrion. Their broad wings and soaring flight make them easily recognizable, and their adaptability allows them to thrive in diverse habitats.​
Pexels

​Majestic and powerful, eagles, with their impressive wingspans, soar high in the sky. Their sharp vision and strong talons make them apex predators, often seen as symbols of freedom and strength, leaving us in awe of their magnificence.​
Pexels

​Falcons, renowned for their incredible speed, are among the fastest creatures on earth. Their streamlined bodies and powerful wings allow them to dive at astonishing speeds, a feat that never fails to impress.​
Pexels
The harpy eagle is one of the largest and most powerful raptors. With massive talons and a striking appearance, it preys on monkeys and sloths in the dense rainforests of Central and South America.
Pexels
​Harriers are agile birds that hunt by flying low over open fields. They use their keen eyesight to spot prey and their strong wings to quickly swoop and precisely capture it.​
Pexels

​Agile and swift, hawks are expert hunters, adept at catching prey in mid-flight. Their sharp talons and keen eyesight make them formidable predators in various environments, from forests to open fields.​
Pexels
​Kites, with their graceful and effortless gliding in the sky, never fail to captivate. Their keen vision and sharp talons make them efficient hunters, snatching prey up in mid-flight.​
Pexels

​Ospreys are expert fishers, diving into the water to catch fish with their sharp talons. Their reversible outer toes and barbed pads help them grasp slippery prey securely, making them unique among raptors.​
Pexels

​Owls are nocturnal hunters known for their silent flight and exceptional hearing. Their large eyes provide excellent night vision, and their strong talons make them efficient at capturing prey in the dark.​
Pexels

​Vultures are scavengers with powerful beaks and strong stomach acids. They play a crucial role in ecosystems by consuming carrion, preventing the spread of disease, and maintaining environmental health.​
Pexels

This is the month of July and the luck is coming for few zodiac signs. They are likely to feel happy and see a change in their lives in terms of their career, finance, job, relationship and health. So if you too want to check about the most lucky people in July go ahead and check:

There is a push for Geminis to 'visit new places' in July. Now you are likely experiencing a hidden support from seniors. Now is a good time to execute all kinds of ambitious ideas with the first half of the month potentially seeing some financial gains. You will get benefits from property which you might have bought years ago..!!

Leos, this month is offering you a good news in terms of finances or you might get promoted to another level. The love or relationship you are looking for so long, might find someone who is just as you. Lord Shiva is blessing you with peace and calmness..!!

Virgos are going to see a good time in terms of finances and money. This month will be full of opportunities. Those who are trying to move in some other country for studies, they will find a way.  This month is offering you a partnership. You will meet new people who are really revolutionary for you..!!

Libras are going to enjoy this month with their partner. They will spend more quality time with their family and partner and this will make their relationship strong with them. You will feel relaxed this month as you might get a good opportunity which make you think of changing your job. Overall July month will be full of love and happiness for you..!!

Aquarians, you are entering a time of transformation and growth in your love life. You will find yourself in a strong and meaningful relationship. Those who are single are likely to find a soulmate. Career wise, this month will be favorable for you. You will see a good growth in your career and finances..!!

Anil Kapoor is all set to host Bigg Boss OTT Season 3. Here's a list of the 13 confirmed candidates for the controversial reality show. This season includes a variety of TV actors, influencers, newsmakers, musicians, and sports stars. The participants are gearing up to enter the house, and many more are expected during the season. Take a look at the confirmed contestants.

Chandrika, better known as the 'Vada Pav girl' from Delhi, rose to prominence thanks to viral videos from her stall. Her vibrant personality on social media has helped her gain a significant following. She was the first confirmed contestant of the show. Fans are liking her on the show.

Ranvir Shorey has been part of several popular and successful films that have showcased his versatility as an actor. His notable performances include roles in "Khosla Ka Ghosla!", "Bheja Fry" (2007), "Jism", "Traffic Signal", "Pyaar Ke Side Effects", "Bheja Fry 2", "Sonchiraiya", "Lakshya", "Angrezi Medium", EK Tha Tiger and Tiger Zinda Hai amongst many others.

On the personal front, Ranvir Shorey was married to actress Konkona Sen Sharma in 2010. The couple welcomed their son Haroon in 2011. Unfortunately, they announced their separation in 2015 and subsequently got divorced in 2021. Despite their separation, they continue to co-parent their son Haroon and maintain an amicable relationship for his well-being.
On the show, Ranvir revealed that he was struggling to find work. He further opened up about how his relationship with Konkona is only limited to their son and nothing beyond.

Sana Makbul Khan's modelling career began with the reality show 'Teen Diva' in 2009. She has since appeared in TV shows such as 'Kitni Mohabbat Hai', 'Iss Pyaar Ko Kya Naam Doon', and 'Arjun', and she competed in Miss India 2012. She just appeared in 'Khatron Ke Khiladi 11' and changed her name from Sana Khan to Sana Makbul Khan. Fans are enjoying her journey so far.

Love Kataria (Lovekesh) was born on September 28, 1998, in Gurugram, Haryana. He is a well-known YouTuber and social media influencer for his entertaining content and active social media presence. Fans refer to Love, a close friend of Bigg Boss OTT 2 winner Elvish Yadav, as 'Kataria'. In addition to establishing himself as a social media sensation, he has appeared in various music videos, including Matka Bhari (with Anjali Arora) and Vehem.

Bigg Boss OTT 3 is creating quite a buzz with the entry of the renowned Indian boxer, Neeraj Goyat, into the controversial reality show. Neeraj, hailing from Haryana, has not only made a name for himself in the boxing world but has also ventured into movies and music videos. His decision to join Bigg Boss OTT has surprised many fans who are eager to see a different side of the athlete outside the ring.

Mumbai-born Sana is from a Muslim family and began her career as a model and TikTok content creator before making appearances in several popular Punjabi music videos. Her unusual Urdu-speaking technique distinguishes her. She is the Janta Ki Agent of the show.

The dusky beauty from Kolkata started her modelling career with India's Next Top Model in 2016. She has since appeared in TV shows such as 'Suhani Si Ek Ladki', 'Dil Hi To Hai', and 'Karthik Poornima', as well as web series such as 'Paurushpur', 'Bakaaboo', and 'Hai Tauba'. She is known for her glamorous looks and adds elegance to the show. Fans are enjoying her journey.

Sai Ketan Rao, who was born in Lonavala, rose to prominence on the television show 'Mehendi Hai Rachne Waali'. He has also appeared on shows such as 'Chashni' and 'Imlie', as well as Telugu shows, web series, and music videos. His endearing appeal has helped him gain a sizable fan following.

Shivani Kumari, from Aryari village in Uttar Pradesh's Auraiya district, is a social media star known for documenting her country life with her mother and sisters. With over 4 million Instagram followers and a sizable YouTube following, she hopes to make an impression as Manisha Rani from Bihar did on Bigg Boss OTT 2.

Hindenburg Research has criticized the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) for not addressing alleged fraud in its report on the Adani Group. In June, Sebi sent a notice to Hindenburg, claiming the report contained misrepresentations and inaccuracies intended to mislead readers. Hindenburg's report, published in January 2023, accused the Adani Group of widespread corporate misconduct.

Steve Ballmer surpassed Bill Gates on Monday to become the sixth-richest person in the world, marking the first time the former Microsoft CEO has been wealthier than the company's co-founder. This shift occurred as Microsoft shares reached a new record high, contributing to a 21% gain this year, largely driven by the company's partnership with OpenAI and the AI market rally.

Shares of Kotak Mahindra Bank have faced additional pressure from these revelations, having only increased by 4% over the last three years, significantly underperforming the Sensex, Nifty, and most peers.
