India won the 2024 Men's T20 World Cup after a gripping final against South Africa at Kensington Oval. The victory ended an 11-year wait for a major trophy, sparking joyous celebrations across the nation. Key players like Rohit Sharma, Hardik Pandya, and Virat Kohli were visibly emotional as they celebrated this historic win.
Team India's T20 World Cup victory:  A reminder of how cricket & emotions are a great unifying force!

When Anrich Nortje’s heave off Arshdeep Singh on the last ball of South Africa’s innings went to the mid-wicket fielder for a single, Rohit Sharma fell flat, with his face towards the ground and punching the grass with his hand. Hardik Pandya went down on his knees and began to tear up once the inevitable -– of India winning the 2024 Men’s T20 World Cup -- was confirmed a little after 2 pm at the Kensington Oval.

Soon after, the entire Indian team, and support staff running in from the dugout began the jumping and hugging of lifting a major trophy after 11 years. A full 13 years after the magical night of April 2, 2011, at Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai to lift the ODI World Cup and 17 years since the unprecedented evening of winning the T20 World Cup in 2007, India got to experience that feeling all over again on June 29, 2024.

The skies, which were supposed to rain during the final amidst a hurricane warning, opened and made one feel as if the weather Gods were waiting for a billion dreams and prayers to be fulfilled. Cheeks welled down the eyes of adults like Rohit, Pandya, and Virat Kohli, who broke down, as years of heartbreaks when it mattered the most finally on previous occasions made way for ultimate glory.

The theme song of this T20 World Cup was all about experiencing a moment their souls had been waiting for. It was very fitting that India got to revel in the ‘out of this world’ feeling at the end of the competition. Back home, the party began on the streets of every city and town.

India Gate in New Delhi – the hometown of Virat Kohli and Rishabh Pant - was choc-a-bloc, with thousands of people coming out and unfurling flags as well as smoke guns -– some even stood atop the police van to dance and sing over the T20 World Cup coming home. The chants ranged from, ‘India, India, India’, to ‘Jeet Gaya bhai Jeet Gaya, India World Cup jeet gaya’, ‘Humara captain kaisa ho, Rohit bhai jaisa ho’, ‘Surya, Surya, Surya’.

There were some grateful people who thanked God by saying, ‘Zor se bolo jai mata di’. In Mumbai, the residences of Rohit, Pandya, and Suryakumar Yadav -- it was a sea of utter jubilation filled with fans coming out in large numbers to celebrate the triumph.

In Mumbai’s local trains, people glued to their mobiles clapped in unison, while a sangeeth ceremony turned into a World Cup win celebration party. Similar scenes of ecstatic frenzy came from the streets of Ahmedabad, Nadiad, and Hyderabad – hometowns of Jasprit Bumrah, Axar Patel, and Mohammed Siraj respectively.

“Everybody was elated and they just started jumping and shouting that 'at last, we have got the World Cup back. The celebrations from the 2007 World Cup triumph in Johannesburg after Joginder Sharma’s last over was done were just going on through my mind when Hardik Pandya bowled the final over,” says Lalchand Rajput, the manager in India’s 2007 T20 World Cup triumph, to IANS from Mumbai.

You couldn’t fault the Indian fans for getting that sinking feeling in their mind and heart when 30 runs were needed for South Africa to win off 30 deliveries. An on-song Heinrich Klaasen took 24 runs off the last over off Axar Patel. The win predictors gave India just a 3% chance to win the final, making a South African victory a foregone conclusion.

The Indian fans, mainly Gen Z fans, had their heart rate racing with the feeling that the trophy may be missed again. A tiny part of them had the belief of the side conjuring up a miracle outta nowhere – remember how on a shining afternoon in New York, they defended 119 against Pakistan on a tough pitch?

Once Pandya took out Heinrich Klaasen, Bumrah took out Marco Jansen and Suryakumar Yadav took a ‘hang-it-in-the-louvre’ catch for ages of David Miller, it began to hit home that a World Cup win for India wasn’t far after years and years of heartbreaks and that emotion of winning a big final is something they will carry for the rest of their lives.

Seeing adults –- highly-revered professional cricketers -- cry and roar in ecstasy on realising the pure joy of winning the World Cup and becoming champions, it was a pure feeling and emotion which had the entire country tear up and be happy in the happiness of their idols.

“Somewhere down the line, I had this feeling that ‘Yeah, it is ours’. So, I was very assured that India is going to win. I knew it. There was no tension. Firecrackers were burst, and people were going crazy, driving rickshaws around the colony, and blaring music. My aged father-in-law and my wife were discussing cricket till 4 a.m., and they didn't let me sleep,” recalled Biju George, the Delhi Capitals’ fielding coach, to IANS from Thiruvananthapuram.

For many years, despite the riches and vastness of domestic structure, a major trophy eluded Indian cricket, raising questions over its ability to cross the final hurdle. Off the field, toxic fan wars, and trolling of certain players based on their religion made things horrible.

It became worse when Pandya’s incessant trolling in Indian Premier League (IPL) 2024 didn’t have a full stop. On social media, when cricket, IPL, and T20 World Cup action dominated headlines in posts and reels, other issues related to the common man in India also grabbed headlines. But June 29, 2024, united the entire India with an electric and genuine feeling of nothing in the country bringing people together like cricket does.

“At least cricket is one unifying force in India where we are not divided. You don't say things like you are a Muslim or a Hindu or a Christian. We are cricketers basically, and at least that is one thing which politics has been kept away from,” adds George.

It's already two days since the triumph was achieved at Barbados and people in the country haven’t stopped talking about the win, the runs from Kohli, Axar, and Shivam Dube. They don’t feel tired of talking about how Bumrah, Pandya, and Arshdeep Singh kept their calm in the last five overs. They can’t get over how Suryakumar unleashed the Superman and Ballerina in him to take a catch for ages.

Every time they open social media, pictures captioned with ‘woke up as world champions’, and ‘this feels so good’ gladden their feed. Algorithms are buzzing with reels of Rohit doing Ric Flair strut to lift the title, players walking with trophy aloft, Virat and Arshdeep doing bhangra while sharing this special moment with their families in person or virtually come up, reminding fans of the feeling they forgot to cherish in these 13 years.
For the next few days, months, and years, the glory moment and on-field celebrations thereafter will be played on a loop on television sets in India and social media plus YouTube screens.

Whenever it pops up, everything else will be forgotten as fans get their minds, hearts, and souls drawn to that winning emotion, serving as a sweet reminder that cricket and emotions are a great unifying force in India, which anything else can’t ever come close to replicating it in this part of the world.
(Except for the headline, this story, from a syndicated feed, has not been edited by Odishatv.in staff)

The Central Council for Research in Ayurvedic Sciences (CCRAS) and the Commissionerate of Indian Medicine and Homoeopathy (CIM&H) signed an MoU to collaborate on testing, training, and research for standardising higher-order medicines. This partnership aims to enhance the quality and safety of Ayurvedic and Homoeopathic medicines.

Dengue cases have surged in states like Karnataka, Kerala, and Telangana following the monsoon. Doctors stress early detection to improve outcomes. Dengue is spread by mosquitoes thriving in humid environments. Symptoms include high fever and joint pain, with severe cases leading to hemorrhagic fever. Preventive measures include avoiding standing water and using repellents.

Surgeons at SGPGIMS have performed the world's first multiport transvesical robotic radical prostatectomy. This innovative approach, led by Dr Uday Pratap Singh, removes the prostate gland through the bladder using a multiport robot, offering faster recovery and reduced complications for prostate cancer patients.

A low-salt diet and reduced body fluids may stimulate kidney repair and regeneration, according to a US study showing promising results in mice. This approach targets macula densa cells, potentially leading to new therapies for kidney disease.

The government has introduced three initiatives to enhance healthcare quality: virtual NQAS assessments for Ayushman Arogya Mandirs, a compliance monitoring dashboard for IPHS, and instant food licence registration. Significant advancements include doubling medical colleges and AIIMS since 2014.

The campaign enhances the previous initiative with extended duration, ORS, and zinc distribution, supported by national health missions and cleanliness drives.

An 11-year-old child's death from Diphtheria in Koraput, Odisha has sparked fear across nearby villages. Health officials are investigating and have vaccinated 468 children with a booster dose while surveillance continues in the affected areas.

The University of Plymouth is conducting a clinical trial to test HIV medications, Ritonavir and Lopinavir, on patients with multiple brain tumours caused by Neurofibromatosis 2 (NF2). This groundbreaking study aims to explore new treatments for NF2-associated tumours.

With the onset of monsoon, there has been a two-fold increase in dengue cases in Odisha compared to last year. By Thursday, the total dengue positive cases in Odisha stood at 288 with 16 new cases being reported on the same day. Out of the total 288 cases, 80 dengue-positive cases have been reported from Khordha district alone. Sources said that maximum dengue cases are being reported from urban areas and hence special focus is being given in Cuttack and Bhubaneswar. As more rain is on the cards, the health officials have urged staff to create massive awareness among people. Public Health Director Nilakantha Mishra said there has been a rise in dengue-positive cases compared to last year. The cases have increased as testing has also been increased this year and there was early rain in the state as well. The health department has instructed all district headquarters hospitals to take all necessary steps in view of the current situation.

Here is the daily astrological prediction for Capricorn, the tenth astrological sign in the zodiac. Business is likely to progress, and relationships with your beloved will be good. Influential people will boost your enthusiasm. Learn what more you can expect.

You are likely to have friends visiting home. Your concentration at work is likely to remain intact. Colleagues at the office are likely to be impressed by your ideas. You may have opportunities to meet new people.
Your focus is likely to be more inclined towards spiritual matters. You are likely to prepare new plans for work. There will likely be progress in business.

Relationships with your beloved are likely to be good. Your enthusiasm is likely to double with the help of influential people. Pending tasks are likely to be completed. You are likely to achieve victory in court cases. You can start preparing for upcoming auspicious events.

People with this zodiac sign have deer-like eyes.  They have a shortcut physical appearance with a short body, and broad chest, and their face is attractive. They are usually physically fit. During their life span, people with this zodiac sign mostly develop dysentery, nervous weakness, headache, Vayu dosha, blood pressure, paralysis, strong disease, hair loss, dental disease, and obesity.

People with this zodiac sign cannot easily trust everyone. They measure the seriousness of every word. Even if they show good manners and are supportive in some cases, they are very skilled in doing what they want. Donating with sincerity seems to be very rare. They are very intelligent; they have great knowledge in literature, Sanskrit, Sanskrit, Purana, Vedas, Upanishads, astrology, mantra, jantra, tantra, rituals, etc. They lose their peace of mind when it comes to their position.

They are bound in friendship for the rest of their lives with whomever they accept as friends. They are ready to give up everything for their friends. Their hearts cry for their friends. When a friend is in trouble, they give their lives to help him.
They do not like to make enmity with anyone. Even enemies can do no harm to their polite behaviour. They uproot the people with a rival approach at the right time.

Working in any department related to finance is auspicious for people with Capricorn as their zodiac sign. They earn their living by working in Finance Corporations, Detective Departments, Advocacy, Astrology, religious works, religious discussion, Bank Jobs, Agriculture Departments, agencies in any company, etc.
They are more successful in business than in jobs. They achieve success in a Ferrous-based business, leather industry, shoe shop, factory, mining business, gemstone business, hospital, etc.

Before beginning married life, these people have illicit love affairs or regular affairs. Adolescence is often associated with romantic relationships. In the field of romance, the boyfriend/girlfriend is bound to cheat. As they cannot easily trust others and their emotions, they are very active and love pleasure both before and after marriage.
Persons with Capricorn can lead their married life happily with Taurus, Gemini, Virgo, Libra, Aquarius, and Pisces

Even if the initial phase of married life is full of disappointment, with time the status improves. Men or women of this zodiac sign are very sexually active and cannot tolerate the slightest exception. For this reason, the couple wishes to spend their life in a balanced way. Almost from the beginning of their married life, they feel cheated.

Due to their status and popularity, persons with this zodiac sign gain great happiness and reputation in society. They have many contributions to the family. They are very devoted to their mothers. They are quite clever to win the hearts of their family members. Even though they remain away from their home, they are loved by everyone in the family because they give respect to their elders and love to their younger ones. They captivate everyone with their influential interaction. The women of this zodiac sign try to mentor their family and reveal their glory to other people. They are judgmental and stubborn. They don't hurt anyone's heart but try to take advantage of others.

People with this zodiac sign own many land properties and vehicles. Apart from getting their father's property, they also get some property from in-laws. They experience no shortage in life. When they have wealth in their hands, they spend freely and also do some charity.

Being idealists and realists is the main goal in their life. They have deep-rooted beliefs in philosophical values. Betting on life, they observe great sanctity and make use of resources in the best way. They also aim to see the happiness of their family and themselves. They also aim to maintain honesty to ensure the happiness of others.

Jyotirvid Deepak Acharya (Bhabishya Jyoti) is a Jyotisha Sudhakara and has 15 plus years of experience. 
Deepak  Acharya is an engineer in electronics, networking and hardware. He is also former engineer at IBM. He has completed  Jyotishsri and Jyotish Sudhakar at Bhagyalipi Gurukul (Odisha) under the guidance of late  Jyotirbid Dr. Nirmai Chandra Banarjee.
He has been awarded by several astrological and vastu organisations both National  and at International level.
Deepak Archarya is an expert in  Kundali Analysis,  Scientifically reading of horoscope, vastu expert and also suggests remedies by  gemstone,  perfoming  chandi patha, mangala dosha khandana, kala sarpa santi and dasa maha bidya puja since the past 15 years and continuing.  And he is a life member of Indian astrological  research  institute  (Jharkhand).

Jyotirvid Deepak Acharya (Bhabishya Jyoti) is a Jyotisha Sudhakara and has 15 plus years of experience. 
Deepak  Acharya is an engineer in electronics, networking and hardware. He is also former engineer at IBM. He has completed  Jyotishsri and Jyotish Sudhakar at Bhagyalipi Gurukul (Odisha) under the guidance of late  Jyotirbid Dr. Nirmai Chandra Banarjee.
He has been awarded by several astrological and vastu organisations both National  and at International level.
Deepak Archarya is an expert in  Kundali Analysis,  Scientifically reading of horoscope, vastu expert and also suggests remedies by  gemstone,  perfoming  chandi patha, mangala dosha khandana, kala sarpa santi and dasa maha bidya puja since the past 15 years and continuing.  And he is a life member of Indian astrological  research  institute  (Jharkhand).

Health experts reassure that the new Covid-19 variants, nicknamed FLiRT, do not warrant panic despite being more transmissible and immune-evasive compared to previous strains. The symptoms are similar to earlier versions, with low hospitalization rates expected.

Concerns arise as Covishield, the Oxford-AstraZeneca vaccine, is linked to rare side effects like Thrombosis. Actor Shreyas Talpade speculates his cardiac arrest may be related to the vaccine. A couple claims their daughter died due to Covishield, planning to sue the makers.

AstraZeneca acknowledged that its Covid-19 vaccine, Covishield, might cause rare side effects like blood clots and low platelet counts. This admission came during a UK court case where victims are seeking damages. Developed with Oxford University and sold globally, the vaccine's safety has led to its suspension in the UK.
In most countries, respiratory illnesses were perceived to be a more serious problem than Covid.
This comes even as the country is under the grip of the new highly transmissible JN.1 variant with immune escaping features.
Two deaths -- one each from Tamil Nadu and Gujarat -- were reported in a span of 24 hours, according to the ministry's data updated at 8 am.
MIT's AI predicts Covid-19 variant waves using 9 million SARS-CoV-2 genetic sequences, offering a 72.8% accuracy after one week and 80.1% after two weeks of observation.

Two new fatalities -- one each from Kerala and Karnataka -- were reported in the span of 24 hours, according to the ministry's data. On Wednesday, five deaths were reported, one each from Tamil Nadu, Karnataka and Punjab, two from Kerala.
The country had recorded 865 new cases on May 19.
JN.1, from the lineage of Omicron, was first detected in August and is currently present in over 40 countries.
India has logged 636 new cases of COVID-19, while the number of active cases of the infection have increased to 4,394, the health ministry said on Monday.
Three new fatalities -- one each from Kerala, Karnataka and Bihar -- have been reported in the span of 24 hours, according to the ministry's data.

The rising cases of daily Covid-19 infections across the country is said to be majorly driven by the JN.1 sub variant. As of now, the country has reportedly detected about 145 cases of JN.1 variant from eight states.
In the past 24 hours, India has recorded 743 new COVID-19 cases, 54 cases less from Friday, while current number of active cases stands at 3,997.
India on Friday reported 4,091 active Covid cases and five deaths, revealed data from the Union Health Ministry.

Ratna Bhandar, the treasure trove of Lord Jagannath, will be opened soon, said Odisha Chief Minister Mohan Majhi on Sunday. He said this while addressing a special function organised in Bhubaneswar to felicitate newly elected BJP MPs and MLAs.

March 31, 1865, marked the birth of a trailblazer who went to make history in the field of medicine.We are talking about Anandi Gopal Joshi, the first Indian woman to become a physician in the field of western medicine.
The National Testing Agency announced the revised rank list for the medical entrance exam NEET-UG on Monday, July 1, 2024.
Several migrant workers from Odisha's Jagatsinghpur, Cuttack and over eight from Kendrapara district are now stranded in Dubai.

With the onset of monsoon, there has been a two-fold increase in dengue cases in Odisha compared to last year. By Thursday, the total dengue positive cases in Odisha stood at 288 with 16 new cases being reported on the same day.
The National Testing Agency (NTA) on Friday announced new dates for the recently cancelled NCET, Joint CSIR-UGC NET, and UGC-NET June 2024 cycle examinations.

The Biju Patnaik International Airport (BPIA) in Bhubaneswar may soon be privatised.As per reports published in some sections of national media, as many as 11 airports across the country may be privately managed soon.

With the idols of 'Parsva' Deities (side deities/Ratha Sakhis) of the three chariots in Puri being damaged by termites due to lack of proper maintenance, servitors demanded the establishment of a museum for their conservation.

With the Centre giving its nod to allow senior IAS officer Manoj Ahuja’s return to Odisha from central deputation, speculations intensified in the power corridor surrounding the next Chief Secretary as current Pradeep Jena’s tenure, which was extended by six months, is set to end on June 30.

Though the outgoing BJD government initiated the Location Accessible Multi-modal Initiative (LAccMI) scheme aimed at establishing a seamless public transport network from panchayats to the state capital, it has completely failed to serve its purpose.
Rath Yatra in Baripada that is celebrated a day after the main Gundicha Yatra in Puri, features a unique tradition where the chariot of Goddess Subhadra is pulled exclusively by women.
Electric car sales in India are likely to reach 1.3-1.5 lakh in the current fiscal year (FY25), according to a CareEdge Rating report.

In order to improve the connectivity between Bhubaneswar and Cuttack, the work on the Bhubaneswar-Cuttack Metro Rail Project will continue, said Housing and Urban Development Minister Krushnachandra Mohapatra on Tuesday.
Demolition activities were carried out at former BJD MLA and the party’s organisational secretary Pranab Prakash Das’ government quarters in Bhubaneswar on Tuesday.
CBI Launches Probe Into NEET-UG Paper leak Case, Officials Suspect Paper Leak From A J'khand School
A CBI team is expected to visit Patna on Monday and may take those arrested in the NEET-UG paper leak case to Delhi for questioning, officials said.

March 31, 1865, marked the birth of a trailblazer who went to make history in the field of medicine.We are talking about Anandi Gopal Joshi, the first Indian woman to become a physician in the field of western medicine.

With the Rath Yatra of Lord Jagannath in Puri nearing, preparations are nearly complete. Odisha Law Minister Prithviraj Harichandan announced that CM Mohan Majhi will review final arrangements. The event focuses on discipline, amenities for women, and resolving VIP movement issues. President Droupadi Murmu is set to attend and participate in the celebrations.

Prime Minister Narendra Modi reaffirmed the NDA government's commitment to improving India's health infrastructure on National Doctors Day. Union Health Minister J.P. Nadda praised doctors for their expertise and humanitarian spirit, especially during the COVID-19 pandemic.
This year's Rath Yatra on July 7, as many as 315 special trains will run to Puri, as Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw announced after discussions with Odisha CM.
The servitors of Puri Rath Yatra have called for a museum to conserve the wooden idols of 'Sakhi' and side deities.

On Anasara Panchami, Lord Jagannath and his siblings receive Phuluri oil treatment, a traditional herbal remedy during their stay at Srimandir, Puri. This ritual aids their recovery from illness induced by the Snana Yatra's ceremonial baths.
As Rath Yatra, ‘Nabajouban Darshan’ and ‘Netra Utsav’ are falling on the same day, the SJTA has taken the decision to not allow devotees to have ‘Nabajouban Darshan’.

The Uttar Pradesh government plans to implement AI technology for efficient crowd management during the Maha Kumbh 2025 in Prayagraj. Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath emphasized the importance of safety, cleanliness, and convenience for this major event, which will also focus on enhancing state and national branding.

As per the timetable fixed in the Chhatisha Nijog meeting, on July 7, after Gajapatai Maharaja Dibyasingha Deba’s ‘chhera panhara’ ritual at 4 PM, the ‘charamala phita’ will be held at 4.30 PM and then the chariot pulling will begin at 5 PM.
After the lavish bath on Snana Purnima, the deities are believed to develop a fever. Then they are taken in Anasara Pahandi to a sick room called ‘Anasara Ghara’.
According to a belief, the deities are dressed as Lord Ganesha to satisfy the followers of the Ganapatya sect.
Like us, Lord Jagannath also brushes teeth, consumes food, retires for the day after dinner, and also suffers from a fever.
Out of the 12 important festivals observed in Srimandir, Deva Snana Purnima or Snana Yatra is one of them.
Yoga is the greatest gift of India to the world. It is an ancient practice that has survived ages and keeps on thriving even in the modern world.
The police administration in Puri is ramping up security for the Deva Snana Purnima on June 22, deploying 70 platoon forces and numerous officers to manage the expected increase in devotees.

If you like prawns and want to make some quick and easy starter for your next party or get-together, here is a recipe that you will love relishing. It takes about 20 minutes from start to finish to make this dish using minimal ingredients.

Be it veg or non-veg, Besara adds a unique flavour to Odia dishes. Today, we will be preparing chicken besara in which chicken is cooked in mustard sauce and some grounded spices. This flavourful chicken curry is known for its distinctive taste, primarily derived from a mustard-based paste. The dish uses minimal ingredients and is very quick and easy to prepare with items available in every household.

Try some new dishes at home or during get-togethers. Embark on a culinary journey with Chicken Latpat, a dish that elevates the richness of succulent chicken legs with minimum ingredients. This recipe combines the tenderness of perfectly marinated chicken legs with simple ingredients available in every household.

Kakara Pitha is a traditional Odia dish that is mostly prepared during festivals and special occasions. With the rising craze of finger millet in dishes, here is a healthier version of the Kakara Pitha which is made from mandia flour.
Millets are rich in anti-oxidants, fiber, protein, and many vitamins and minerals. On world food day, dietician Niharika Dash gives the message – “Embrace the essence of millets for a healthy life”.

we are presenting a quick, flavourful recipe using eggs and pumpkin flowers. Egg-stuffed pumpkin flower fritters combine the delicate flavors of pumpkin blossoms with the richness of eggs. The tender pumpkin flowers are filled with egg mixture before being coated in a light, crispy batter and fried to golden perfection. The result is a delightful fusion of textures and tastes, with the softness of the flowers contrasting beautifully with the savory egg filling and the satisfying crunch of the outer coating. These fritters are not only a treat for the taste buds but also serve as a visual delight.

Raw Mango Fish tawa is a flavourful and easy fish starter recipe that you can enjoy with friends or at a get-together with family.
This fish fry can be paired with some steamed rice or roti to make a scrumptious meal.
While there are many different styles of chicken gravies cooked in different parts of the country, this Odisha-specific chicken recipe is unique in its taste and flavour.
In some parts of the country, gujiya is also known as karanji.
Try this simple brownie recipe is which you can make with easily available ingredients at your home or nearby store and relish it with your loved ones.
Malai Chicken tikka is a lip-smacking appetizer. These tikkas are not too spicy and utterly creamy. You can to kids due to their mild flavors.
Kadhai Chicken goes well with naan, roti or laccha paratha according to your preference.
This Odisha-specific recipe has a rustic touch to it as this uses the oldest method of cooking which is roasting.

Gajar Chicken or Carrot Chicken is a unique healthy chicken dish which can be made with very less oil and ingredients. This semi gravy chicken curry is a great accompaniment with rotis, parathas and fried rice.
This Indo-Chinese chicken curry is a great combination with rotis, parathas, fried rice, and noodles.

As the wedding season kicks in, parents and families of prospective grooms and brides start preparations for the grand lifetime event. While the videos of Ambani's wedding invitation card has taken the internet by storm, another old video has resurfaced on social media that shows 'quite an expensive' wedding invitation card that may blow off your mind.
Not Anant Ambani-Radhika Merchant's wedding invitation cards, HERE is the 'best invitation card of universe'; watch

Indian billionaire Mukesh Ambani and Nita Ambani's younger son Anant Ambani's wedding with Radhika Merchant is the talk of the town. After the lavish pre-wedding bashes, now the intricately designed wedding invitation cards have become the talk of the town. Well, the expenses for designing such wedding invitation cards can just be speculated and only billionaires like the Ambanis can afford such a huge budget. However, how much can a normal person spend on just wedding invitations?

As the wedding season kicks in, parents and families of prospective grooms and brides start preparations for the grand lifetime event. Everyone wishes to make their lifetime event memorable with special arrangements so that they can cherish it lifelong. With war footing preparations, it is essential to consider every aspect related to the wedding so that they avert any untoward incident on the big day, apart from arrangements for the wedding including preparing the guest list, bride and groom clothes, jewellery, cuisine, invitation card, etc. All these certainly cost a heck and almost everyone remains prepared for the expenses.

While the videos of Ambani's wedding invitation card have taken the internet by storm, another old video has resurfaced on social media that shows 'quite an expensive' wedding invitation card that may blow off your mind.

The video shows the cover of the wedding invitation card that looks like a carry bag. While it looks normal from the exterior, the person pulls out a box from the cover.  The top of the box is intricately designed, as the person unboxes it, he finds the invitation card along with the details of the events. After flashing three different cards, the person reveals the main surprise.
The box has some dry fruits in it with a bottle of liquor. The dry fruits are separately stored in two sections which include almonds, cashews, raisins and more.

It is an old video and has resurfaced on social media amid Anant-Radhika wedding invitation card buzz. While the origin source of the video couldn't be verified, it was shared on Instagram by nitesh466kumar...
A post shared by Nitesh Kumar (@nitesh466kumar)

Well, the wedding invitation card has certainly won the hearts of several users. The clip has amassed massive likes and views with netizens flooding the comments section with notes expressing their thoughts.
A few comments on a post made by netizens:
One user wrote, "Best wedding card of the universe." (sic)
Another wrote, "National wedding card bana do ise." (sic)
"Waah bhaiya dil khush kar dia jarur aaunga shadi me," wrote a third user. (sic)

At least nine children were killed and 11 injured in an RSF air raid on a mosque in El Fasher, North Darfur. The incident occurred amidst ongoing fierce clashes between the RSF and the Sudanese Armed Forces since April 2023.

Wikileaks founder Julian Assange was ordered by a US federal court in Saipan to be released immediately after accepting his 62-month UK imprisonment as complete sentence under the Espionage Act. Assange, who pleaded guilty, will return to Australia.

India has issued a safety advisory for its citizens in Kenya amid violent protests over proposed tax hikes. The Indian consulate urged caution and limited movement as clashes in Nairobi led to deaths and injuries.

Saudi Arabia reported 1,301 pilgrim deaths during the Hajj season, with 83% being unregistered individuals. Heat stress was a significant issue, particularly for those without proper shelter. The health system managed over 465,000 treatments and declared the season a success with no disease outbreaks.
Multiple attacks in Dagestan, Russia targeted Orthodox churches, a synagogue, and a police station, killing a priest and about 10 security personnel.

During the 2023 Haj pilgrimage, 98 Indian pilgrims died from natural causes and accidents, according to the Ministry of External Affairs. Over 175,000 Indian pilgrims participated, with comprehensive support including medical care provided. Unconfirmed reports suggest hundreds of global deaths due to intense heat.

The 10th International Day of Yoga, themed 'Yoga for Women Empowerment', will be celebrated at the UN headquarters with global participants including diplomats and officials. The event features a message from Deputy Secretary-General Amina Mohammed and anticipates one from General Assembly President Dennis Francis. This globally recognized day was initiated by India in 2014 and emphasizes yoga's universality across cultures.

India has highlighted the growing sophistication of small arms and their delivery via drones to terrorists, urging global condemnation of states sponsoring such acts. At a UN conference, Indian envoy R. Ravindra condemned state-backed terrorism and proposed a regional initiative to curb arms trafficking.

A magnitude-5.0 earthquake struck Kashmar County in northeastern Iran, killing four and injuring over 120 people. The quake caused significant damage to buildings and vehicles, with rescue operations underway.

Two recent shipwrecks off the Italian coast resulted in at least 11 migrant deaths with another 66 missing. Italy's coast guard launched a search and rescue operation. The victims included migrants from Iraq, Syria, Iran, and Afghanistan who departed from Turkey.

A recent SIPRI report highlights a concerning trend in the global nuclear arsenal, noting an increase in operational nuclear warheads despite the overall number of nuclear weapons decreasing. The report emphasizes the rise in military stockpiles and weapons mounted on missiles and aircraft.

Cambodian Deputy Prime Minister Neth Savoeun and Indian Ambassador Devyani Khobragade launched the first-ever direct flight from Phnom Penh to New Delhi, operated by Cambodia Angkor Air. This service aligns with India's 'Act East' Policy and enhances cultural and medical exchanges between the two nations.

Prime Minister Narendra Modi, at the G7 Outreach Session, emphasized India's commitment to a developed nation by 2047, advancements in AI, and achieving Net Zero by 2070. He highlighted Global South concerns, engaged in key talks with global leaders, and invited Pope Francis to India.

Prime Minister Narendra Modi engaged in several key bilateral meetings with global leaders from Italy, Japan, and others at the G7 Summit in Italy. Discussions focused on enhancing strategic partnerships across various sectors including defense, technology, and clean energy.

Following a tragic fire in Kuwait, Minister Kirtivardhan Singh, guided by PM Modi, swiftly provided support to affected Indians. This incident underscores Modi's ongoing commitment to protect Indians globally, reflecting his proactive international crisis management.

The National Testing Agency (NTA) has announced new examination dates for the NCET, Joint CSIR-UGC NET, and UGC-NET June 2024 cycle exams. The revised schedule includes NCET on July 10, Joint CSIR-UGC NET on July 25-27, and UGC-NET between August 21 and September 4.
NTA announces fresh dates for UGC-NET, Joint CSIR and other exams

The National Testing Agency (NTA) on Friday announced new dates for the recently canceled NCET, Joint CSIR-UGC NET, and UGC-NET June 2024 cycle examinations.  It is pertinent to mention here that the June cycle UGC-NET exam was earlier held on June 18. However, it was canceled the very next day.

In its latest notice, the NTA said, "Due to certain unavoidable circumstances, some of the National Testing Agency (NTA) examinations were postponed/canceled. Now, the fresh dates for these examinations have been finalized."

As per the latest notification issued on Friday, the NTA announced that the NCET 2024 will be held on July 10, Joint CSIR-UGC NET on July 25-27 while the UGC-NET June 2024 cycle exam will be held between August 21 and September 4.
The NTA has advised candidates to visit its official website www.nta.ac.in for further information.
The  All India Ayush Post Graduate Entrance Test 2024 will be held as per its actual schedule on July 6, the notice read.

For more clarification regarding the examinations, the candidates can contact at 011-40759000 or e-mail at the respective e-mail ncet@nta.ac.in, csirnet@nta.ac.in, ugcnet@nta.ac.in, and               aiapget@nta.ac.in.

Approximately 50% of Indian organizations reported fraud during and post-pandemic, largely due to remote work transitions. Cyber incidents predominated these cases. Grant Thornton Bharat's survey indicates a significant shift towards enhancing cybersecurity and governance to combat this rise.

CERT-In has issued a warning about significant vulnerabilities in Google Chrome and SAP products that could allow attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause denial of service. Users are advised to install security updates to mitigate these risks.

RBI officials warn that financial frauds are evolving, with data leakage becoming rampant. At a PHDCCI event, they emphasized the importance of citizen awareness to combat these threats. Cybercrimes are expected to cost globally $17.65 trillion annually by 2025. Various fraud types like ATM and card skimming were discussed.
Nowadays, in the ever-growing digital era, users are more prone to cyber fraud.

The Bhubaneswar-Cuttack Police warned against scam calls from a Pakistani WhatsApp number, advising the public to be cautious and report such incidents. Scammers pose as officials to blackmail victims.

A report by McAfee reveals that 75% of Indians have encountered deepfake content, with concerns about its use in impersonating public figures and influencing elections. The survey included 7,000 consumers globally, highlighting issues like cyberbullying and fake news driven by AI.
The gang allegedly fleeced people on the Telegram messaging platform by promising a 20 per cent return on investments. They tricked their victims into transferring money into mule accounts.

The report by the Fintech Association for Consumer Empowerment (FACE) shares insights from a customer survey conducted between December, 2023 and January, 2024 to systematically understand gaps in users' approaches and knowledge about Digital Lending Applications (DLAs) in India

Despite the chances of such content in affecting election results remaining low, China’s increasing experimentation in augmenting memes, videos, and audio will likely continue - and may prove more effective down the line.
A staggering 92 per cent of organisations are committed to increasing their data protection spend this year.

Calls are being received by the citizens wherein callers, in the name of DoT, are threatening that all of their mobile numbers would be disconnected or their mobile numbers are being misused in some illegal activities.

Readiness is critical as 82 per cent of respondents said a cybersecurity incident is likely to disrupt their business in the next 12 to 24 months, according to Cisco’s ‘2024 Cybersecurity Readiness Index,’
Beware of new cyber scams impersonating DoT officials, asking for personal info to avoid phone deactivation. Stay cautious, report suspicious calls to cybercrime helpline.
A ‘digital arrest’ is a deceptive tactic used by cybercriminals to exploit people under the guise of law enforcement or investigative agencies.

The UN General Assembly's resolution passed unanimously on Thursday stressed "the urgency of achieving global consensus on safe, secure and trustworthy artificial intelligence systems" in the face of "potential risk for accidents and compound threats from malicious actors".

The examination aims to assess a student's eligibility to enrol into either of the 46 Central universities for undergraduate courses.

The Indian government has enacted the Public Examinations Prevention of Unfair Means Act, 2024, targeting paper leaks and exam cheating. The law, effective immediately, imposes stringent penalties including jail terms up to 10 years and fines reaching Rs 1 crore for violators.
The Ministry of Education has cancelled the UGC-NET June 2024 Examination due to potential integrity issues flagged by the Indian Cyber Crime Coordination Centre (I4C).

The University Grants Commission (UGC) has aligned the new postgraduate program frameworks with the National Education Policy (NEP) 2020, introducing flexible pathways and multidisciplinary options across one-year and two-year PG courses.
The UGC has introduced a new fee refund policy for the academic year 2024-25, allowing full refunds for cancellations or migrations until September 30, 2024.

UGC Chairman announced a new policy allowing higher education institutions in India to admit students twice a year, aiming to increase accessibility and match global educational standards. This decision is expected to enhance student motivation, employment opportunities, and international collaborations.

The UGC has mandated Higher Educational Institutions (HEIs) to adhere to public self-disclosure guidelines, aligning with the National Education Policy (NEP) 2020's focus on transparency and accountability.

The UGC has urged higher education institutions to enforce the prohibition of electronic cigarettes, as mandated by the PECA, 2019. This includes conducting special checks to prevent their use on campuses, following concerns about easy access near educational facilities.

The UGC has directed states to establish district-level anti-ragging committees as part of measures to comply with Supreme Court orders. These committees, chaired by the District Collector, will include members from local police, media, NGOs, and student organizations to prevent ragging in educational institutions.

The UGC has mandated that only residents of India can enroll in Open and Distance Learning (ODL) programs, following territorial jurisdiction rules. This aligns with the Ministry of Home Affairs' directive that student visas will not be issued for foreign nationals seeking enrollment through franchise educational institutions offering distance learning.

The ‘NEP SAARTHI- Student Ambassador for Academic Reforms in Transforming Higher Education in India’ is an initiative to involve students in the implementation of the National Education Policy (NEP) 2020.
UGC stated that some individuals/ organisations are offering online programmes with acronyms/ abbreviated forms which are similar to the higher education system’s recognised degree programmes.

The UGC has mandated all central and state-funded educational institutions in India to strictly adhere to the government's Reservation Policy for SCs, STs, OBCs, EWs, and PWDs in both employment and admissions. Institutions must also clear backlog vacancies and submit annual reports via the UAMP.
At the beginning of each academic year, the University shall announce its academic calendar, giving the schedules for all its activities during the year.

Common University Entrance Test (CUET-PG) concluded successfully on March 28, as planned. On Friday, UGC Chairman Professor M. Jagadesh Kumar told IANS that this year, 462,603 examinees appeared for the test, and around 950 experts and 200 translators prepared question papers for it.

The UPSC has announced the results of the Civil Services Preliminary exam 2024, held on June 16. Qualified candidates must submit a Detailed Application Form for the Mains, tentatively scheduled for September. The exam aims to fill 1056 vacancies.

Frequent ownership changes have hindered development at Gopalpur Port in Odisha's Ganjam district. Residents, particularly the fishermen community, face an uncertain future due to jetty construction. The Odisha Commerce and Transport Minister suspects deliberate actions behind these changes, with hopes for improvement under potential new ownership by Adani Group.

Sujata Khatua from Bhadrak, Odisha, has entered the India Book of Records for writing road safety songs in memory of her deceased son Soumitra Mohanty, who died in a road accident.
The BJD took a swipe at the BJP over its poll-time promise to waive off 300 units of electricity. The BJP countered by highlighting their solar panel subsidy plan.
Employees of Birla Tyres in Balasore have launched an indefinite strike outside Dalmia Bharat Refractories, demanding reinstatement and unpaid salaries.

Five friends were stranded for 11 hours in the Saptasajya forest in Dhenkanal, Odisha, due to misleading directions from Google Maps. They were eventually rescued by police and forest department teams after a challenging operation.

A Divyang girl child, aged two to three years, was found abandoned in the Chitrakonda forest of Malkangiri. Rescued by locals Sukaldei Hantal and Manguli Majhi, she has been handed over to the district administration.
Due to their role in preventing lightning-related deaths, the Odisha Forest Department now imposes strict restrictions on cutting Palm trees, even on private properties.

Bars and pubs in Bhubaneswar are operating beyond permissible hours, prompting the Excise Commissioner to direct officials for inspections and legal actions. Social media posts exposed these violations, leading to increased surveillance and potential hefty fines or license cancellations.

The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has forecast heavy rainfall and thunderstorms in several parts of Odisha over the next 48 hours. A yellow warning has been issued, with surface winds expected to reach 40-50 kmph along the North Odisha coast.

Laxmisagar Police Station in Bhubaneswar registered the first case under new criminal laws, replacing British-era statutes. The incident involved an attempted murder on Gauranga Charan Das. Union Home Minister Amit Shah highlighted key changes, emphasizing crimes against women and children.

At least eight workers are in critical condition following a carbon monoxide gas leak at Rourkela Steel Plant. The incident occurred during repair work at blast furnace number-5. Injured workers are receiving treatment in ICU at Ispat General Hospital.

With the Rath Yatra of Lord Jagannath in Puri nearing, preparations are nearly complete. Odisha Law Minister Prithviraj Harichandan announced that CM Mohan Majhi will review final arrangements. The event focuses on discipline, amenities for women, and resolving VIP movement issues. President Droupadi Murmu is set to attend and participate in the celebrations.

A Bengaluru Ola cab driver's daily earnings of Rs 3000-4000 have sparked a lively debate on social media. The driver's disclosure has ignited discussions about the financial viability of various jobs, including street food vendors and educated professionals.
Driving pic for representational purpose

A Bengaluru cab driver has caught the attention of social media after he disclosed his daily earnings to a curious passenger. He revealed that he earns around Rs 3000 to Rs 4000 per day and also earns extras by driving Ola cabs.

The Bengaluru cab driver’s salary has left the internet stunned which has sparked a debate on the money earned by educated people and other daily works like driving, selling gup chups, momos and many other such street foods.

Taking to his Reddit handle, the passenger shared, “So, I was coming back from a function today, and I booked a cab. While chatting with the cab driver, I asked him about his earnings. He mentioned that he makes around 3000 to 4000 per day.”

He further added, “I was shocked! If he makes 3000 per day and works for 25 days a month, that totals to 75,000 per month. He added that even after deducting petrol costs, he still has enough money. Plus, he has another cab attached to Ola, which brings in additional income. He proudly mentioned that his kids go to a good school. When I asked him how long he's been driving, he said since 2019, after he lost his previous job.”
As expected his post went viral with different reactions from netizens.

“One cab driver (attached to two companies) makes 79k + 59k for 4 shifts (pickups or drops) a day and 6 days a week. The best thing was his timing and proximity. Drop and pick up are scheduled to nearby places with less time gap. Between the shifts, he goes home, has home food (all 3 meals at home). Good guy as well!!” shared a user.

Another user shared, “This is pretty reasonable and believable. I have a close friend’s brother who works as OLA driver. He usually just focuses on airport or railway station pickups. Works a bit odd hours. But comfortably brings home around 80k after expenses (fuel, EMI, maintenance and insurance). He leads a pretty comfortable life and has a 30/40 home at Yelahanka and a couple of acres of land in native which he bought with his cab earnings.”

“During Ola Uber's initial days cab drivers used to make 1 lakh plus a month. Many of them who did it in the initial days made a good amount of money, bought agricultural lands in their hometowns and now they are leading a good life there,” shared another user.

The UPSC has announced the results of the Civil Services Preliminary exam 2024, held on June 16. Qualified candidates must submit a Detailed Application Form for the Mains, tentatively scheduled for September. The exam aims to fill 1056 vacancies.
UPSC announces results of Civil Services Preliminary exam 2024

The Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) on Monday announced the much-awaited results of the Civil Services Preliminary exam 2024. The Civil Services (Preliminary) Examination, 2024 was held on June 16 and the UPSC has uploaded the roll numbers of the candidates who have qualified for admission to the Civil Services (Main) Examination, 2024 on its official website.

In its latest notification, UPSC has categorically stated that the candidature of the candidates is provisional and all these candidates have to apply again in the Detailed Application Form-I (DAF-I) for the Civil Services (Main) Examination, 2024.
The dates and important instructions for filling up of the DAF-I and its submission will be announced in due course on the website of the Commission, UPSC said in its notice.

As per official sources, the UPSC Civil Services 2024 exam aims to fill 1056 vacancies in central government services, including prestigious posts like the Indian Administrative Service (IAS), Indian Police Service (IPS), and Indian Foreign Service (IFS). 40 positions are reserved for candidates under the Persons with Benchmark Disability category.
The UPSC CSE Mains 2024 is tentatively scheduled to be held in September.

A Bengaluru-based software engineer's revelation about paying Rs 80,000 for a flat near his workplace sparked a debate on social media about the high rental costs in major Indian cities. The discussion highlighted concerns over affordability and questioned the value of living in central, well-connected locales versus other spending choices.

‘Nvidia’ is currently hitting the headlines as the company has been skyrocketing like a rocket. For those who have no knowledge about ‘Nvidia’, here’s the scoop: Nvidia’s stock price has more than doubled this year after tripling in 2023, making it the third most valuable company in the S&P 500.

Udita Pal, a Bengaluru techie and Forbes 30 under 30 alumna, shared pictures of her apartment highlighting the perks of solo living which sparked varied reactions online. Her post showcases a personalized and lived-in space, capturing both admiration and critique from netizens.

A Bengaluru man and his girlfriend went viral after a video surfaced of them recreating a 'Bang Bang' movie scene on a motorbike. The couple was detained by police for multiple traffic violations, including rash driving and not wearing helmets.

Bengaluru, once famed for its pleasant climate, now faces a severe shift with increased heat and water scarcity. The city's residents, formerly needing no fans, now seek air conditioners. A woman's social media post lamenting this loss has resonated widely among locals.

A Bengaluru man used AI to charm a woman through texts, leading her to fall for his witty and entertaining persona. However, upon meeting him in person, she found him dull and uninteresting, realizing he couldn't communicate effectively without AI.
The incident took place under the limits of the Vidyaranyapura police station in the state capital.
Sharing on X, the user wrote, “Babe, wake up! There’s a new scam in the market.” As expected, the tweet has gone viral sparking a debate online.

The National Investigation Agency (NIA) on Friday got a three-day transit remand of the two individuals arrested earlier in the day on the outskirts of Kolkata in connection with the March 1 blast at a cafe in Bengaluru.
After gathering inputs about their movements in Assam and West Bengal, the NIA arrested the accused, carrying Rs 10 lakh cash award.
“We have fined 407 persons till April 9 and collected Rs 20.3 lakh from the violators so far,” said a BWSSB officer.

The BMRCL staff at the Doddakallasandra Metro Station had apparently asked the youth to button up his shirt and come to the Metro station with clean clothes, otherwise he would not be allowed to enter the Metro station.
Later, the goons flee after Suresh fell unconscious, presuming him to be dead. Based on the viral video, police arrested five people while Suresh has been undergoing treatment.

Manasvi pointed out that a flight ticket could be a bargain as compared to taking a cab with the fares soaring to such heights in Bengaluru. Social media users set the internet blaze with their comments in the post.

Here is the fortnightly astrological prediction for Pisces, the twelfth astrological sign in the zodiac. Full support likely from senior officials and allies in politics. Unexpected income growth likely.

You are likely to achieve success in every area of endeavour. Following spiritual guidance from your mentor is likely to lead you on the path of righteousness. Friends and relatives are likely to help resolve any existing issues. Social status and respect are likely to increase.
In the political arena, senior officials and allies are likely to offer full support. Any previous conflicts with individuals are likely to be resolved amicably.

Unexpected income growth is likely to surprise you. There are likely opportunities for purchasing land and property. At home, colleagues in the organizational field are likely to find peace and support.

Pisceans are usually dark complexion and only few are born fair. They have big nose, sharp eyes, beautiful eyes and voice. These zodiacs have gastric issues, stomach diseases, sexually transmitted disease, obesity, weakness, genital diseases, heart diseases and menstrual disorders are also seen in women of this zodiac sign. This zodiac is generally insomniac and a drug abuser.

They can adapt to any situation. They are least bothered about who is talking behind their back, they forgive others for small mistakes. They help the poor, the hapless and neglected people in various ways. They are animal lovers. They are prominent figures in society because of their polite behaviour. It is not unusual for them to have relationships with other women or men. This zodiac is self administered and selfish in nature.

You befriend others easily but the friendship does not last long as you trust others easily without judging them. Sometimes friends leave these zodiacs as they are unable to understand them properly.
They do not make enemies. They love to stay in peace and always try to lead their life in respectful manner.

These zodiacs choose writer, publisher, actor, artist, lawyer, musician, teacher, lecturer, and bank service to earn their livelihood.
People of this zodiac earn a lot of money in business like fish farming, petroleum products, educational institutions, religious institutions and agriculture.
They are expert in love and romance, but they have to compromise with their partner after marriage. Because of their suspicious nature, they always doubt their partner.
Their conjugal life is not smooth as they have to suffer with sexual and menstrual diseases. Due to these diseases, they are always under stress.

This zodiac has good relation with their partner and child. They love and give respect to all family members. They have keen interest in purchasing and maintaining home appliances. Their family always praise them for their works.

They earn huge amounts of wealth in their lifetime. They solve their financial condition through business. They live a luxurious lifestyle. They spend their money in religious institution. They get property from their in-laws also.
They thrive despite multiple obstacles. To get a higher position in society they have to work hard.

Did you know practicing Sirsasana yoga pose offers numerous benefits?
Author: Soumya Prakash Pradhan | Credit: Canva
It improves blood circulation in the lower body, increases muscle endurance, strengthens the upper body, and promotes hair growth.
Author: Soumya Prakash Pradhan | Credit: Canva
Let's delve into these yoga benefits and explore its transformative effects:
Author: Soumya Prakash Pradhan | Credit: Canva
Sirsasana requires you to engage your core muscles intensely to maintain balance, thereby strengthening your abdominal muscles.
Author: Soumya Prakash Pradhan | Credit: Canva
Regular practice of Sirsasana helps align the spine, improving overall posture and reducing strain on the lower back.
Author: Soumya Prakash Pradhan | Credit: Canva
Holding Sirsasana challenges your balance and enhances coordination between different muscle groups, including those in the core.
Author: Soumya Prakash Pradhan | Credit: Canva
As you hold the pose, you build strength not only in the core but also in the shoulders, arms, and upper back, supporting overall body strength.
Author: Soumya Prakash Pradhan | Credit: Canva
The inversion aspect of Sirsasana stimulates blood flow to the brain, improving mental clarity, focus, and concentration.
Author: Soumya Prakash Pradhan | Credit: Canva
Inversions like Sirsasana activate the parasympathetic nervous system, promoting relaxation and reducing stress levels.

The Indian government announced the 'Global IndiaAI Summit' to be held on July 3-4 in New Delhi. The event, chaired by India under the Global Partnership on Artificial Intelligence (GPAI), aims to foster collaboration and knowledge exchange among global AI stakeholders. It highlights India's commitment to ethical and inclusive AI growth.
Android users can reduce the number of spam calls by using the Google Phone app. This app identifies and blocks junk calls before they reach your phone.
In the race for AI superiority, Anthropic's Claude 3.5 Sonnet stands out with remarkable speed and performance, surpassing competitors like GPT-4 and Gemini 1.5 Pro.

Meta-owned Instagram experienced a major global outage on Saturday, affecting thousands of users in India. Downdetector reported over 6,500 incidents at the peak, with problems in accessing feeds, the app, and server connections. Cities including Delhi and Mumbai were impacted.

In the rapidly evolving field of AI, chatbots like ChatGPT, Bing AI, and Google Bard are making significant strides on social media. Meta's LLaMA 3-powered AI is now integrated into WhatsApp, Facebook, Messenger, and Instagram, enabling seamless and personalised user interactions.

The Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI) has announced new regulations to prevent fraudulent SIM swaps and replacements by cybercriminals. The updated rules, effective from July 1, include additional criteria for rejecting Unique Porting Code (UPC) requests made within seven days of a SIM swap.

A viral rumor on social media claimed that using an IRCTC ID to book tickets for others could lead to legal trouble. This raised concerns among users, but IRCTC clarified that the rumor is false and users can book tickets for individuals with different surnames.
WhatsApp will soon stop working on over 35 older phone models from brands like Apple, Samsung, and Huawei.

Google has introduced five new features to enhance the search experience in its Chrome browser for Android and iOS. These include local search shortcuts, a refreshed address bar, and 'Chrome Actions' which offers quick access to information about local businesses. Trending suggestions and live sports updates are also part of the new update.

The PwC 2024 Global Workforce Hopes & Fears Survey reveals that as workloads soar, employees globally are increasingly relying on AI and focusing on skills development to manage the rapid pace of change. The survey also noted a significant intent among workers to switch jobs, driven by the demand for new skill opportunities and better technological support from employers.
Meta has unveiled its advanced AI assistant, Llama-3, now available across its platforms and a dedicated site.

Approximately 50% of Indian organizations reported fraud during and post-pandemic, largely due to remote work transitions. Cyber incidents predominated these cases. Grant Thornton Bharat's survey indicates a significant shift towards enhancing cybersecurity and governance to combat this rise.

Meta has launched its AI assistant in India, integrated across WhatsApp, Facebook, Messenger, Instagram, and meta.ai using the 'Llama 3' language model. This rollout enables users to perform various tasks directly within these platforms without exiting the apps.

ISRO successfully conducted the third test of its Reusable Launch Vehicle, the LEX-03, demonstrating advanced autonomous landing capabilities under challenging conditions at Karnataka's Aeronautical Test Range. The vehicle 'Pushpak' executed a precise landing, using cutting-edge technology to simulate high-speed orbital reentry conditions.

The National Testing Agency (NTA) has announced new examination dates for the NCET, Joint CSIR-UGC NET, and UGC-NET June 2024 cycle exams. The revised schedule includes NCET on July 10, Joint CSIR-UGC NET on July 25-27, and UGC-NET between August 21 and September 4.

The Medical Counselling Committee will start the NEET MDS counselling process on July 1, 2024. Candidates can register online until July 7, 2024, with choice filling and locking commencing from July 2. Seat allotment results will be announced on July 10, followed by reporting from July 11 to July 17.
The National Testing Agency (NTA) has postponed the June 2024 CSIR-UGC-NET Examination originally scheduled for June 25-27 due to unavoidable circumstances and logistic issues.

The NEET 2024 paper leak involved the arrest of four individuals, including a NEET aspirant and a junior engineer, who confessed to arranging leaked papers for select candidates. Each candidate reportedly paid Rs 30-32 lakh.

The National Testing Agency (NTA) has released the provisional answer key for the NEET UG 2024 exam, held on May 5. Over 24 lakh candidates can review their answers and raise objections until May 31. The results will be based on a final revised answer key.

Students are requested not to pay heed to such rumours and exercise their voting right, clarified NTA
NTA has invited online application forms for Study Webs of Active Learning for Young Aspiring Minds (SWAYAM) (January 2024 Semester) Exam from March 19 for 456 courses.
As per the latest NTA notice, the CUET PG will be conducted from 11 March 2024 to 28 March 2024 in CBT (Computer Based Mode) throughout India and in 24 cities outside India.
The CUET UG 2024 will be conducted for admissions in Central Universities under the Ministry of Education, and other participating Universities/Institutions/Organizations/Autonomous Colleges.

With the arrival of monsoon in India, several parts of the country are experiencing heavy rainfall leading to overflowing rivers and flooded streets, disrupting daily life. Recently, a shocking video has stormed the internet in which a crocodile can be seen crawling on the road.

As the wedding season kicks in, parents and families of prospective grooms and brides start preparations for the grand lifetime event. While the videos of Ambani's wedding invitation card has taken the internet by storm, another old video has resurfaced on social media that shows 'quite an expensive' wedding invitation card that may blow off your mind.

A corporate employee's candid reflection on the toll of modern work culture has gone viral, highlighting the struggle to balance work and personal life. The tweet resonated with many, amassing over 313K views, as people discussed the importance of self-care and hobbies.

A Bengaluru Ola cab driver's daily earnings of Rs 3000-4000 have sparked a lively debate on social media. The driver's disclosure has ignited discussions about the financial viability of various jobs, including street food vendors and educated professionals.

An IAS aspirant in New Delhi was scammed of Rs 1.2 lakh after being lured to a cafe by a woman he met on Tinder. The woman, named Versha, left under the pretext of a family emergency, leaving the victim with an exorbitant bill. Investigations revealed a gang running similar schemes across major cities.

Reliance Jio has announced a significant price hike across all its prepaid and postpaid plans, effective from July 3. While the benefits remain unchanged, most plans have increased by over 20%. The move has sparked humorous reactions on social media, particularly referencing a recent tweet by Prafull Billore.

Amid the pre-wedding bash, all eyes are on Anant Ambani, son of Indian billionaire Mukesh Ambani, and Radhika Merchant's exquisite wedding. While everyone is eagerly waiting for the grand wedding on July 12, the video of Anant and Radhika's wedding invitation card has recently stormed the internet leaving everyone shocked and mesmerised.

The debate over India's reservation system heats up as Rashi Pandey, a general category student, voices her struggles with admission despite high scores. Her viral tweet contrasts her situation with a less-qualified, wealthier classmate who benefited from reservation.

There are many such instances recorded on camera where the old or ill dogs are abandoned or put to rest forever. Amid such disturbing instances, recently a video surfaced on the internet that shows a heart-melting instance of an elderly pet parent and his old-grown dog.

In Mumbai, Kaushal Shah, founder of Evor Beauty, implemented a Rs 200 fine for employees arriving late. Ironically, Shah ended up paying Rs 1,000 for his own tardiness. His social media post about this led to mixed reactions, highlighting the importance of leaders following their own rules.

In Pune, Bharti Vidyapeeth Police arrested Mihir Gandhi and Minakshi Salunkhe for performing a dangerous stunt atop an abandoned temple for a social media reel. Despite the viral outcry for harsh penalties, their minor offense may result in a short jail term or fine.
Instagram users are engaging with viral video trends like the 'Blue makeup trend', inspired by Billie Eilish's song. Influencers showcase dramatic transformations using vibrant blue makeup.

A blind date is a type of social engagement where two individuals who have never met are set up to meet and potentially form a romantic connection. Often arranged by mutual friends, family members, or through matchmaking services, blind dates come with unique dynamics and expectations. Of course, dating can sometimes be expensive as you may not have control over the expenses you make. However, what if you have to pay for dating a girl/boy?

Instagram influencer Adithya S Nair from Kerala died following a suicide attempt due to severe cyberbullying after her breakup. Adithya was on life support at Thiruvananthapuram Medical College and Hospital. Her ex-boyfriend has been arrested under the POCSO Act.

With the arrival of monsoon in India, several parts of the country are experiencing heavy rainfall leading to overflowing rivers and flooded streets, disrupting daily life. Recently, a shocking video has stormed the internet in which a crocodile can be seen crawling on the road.
Crocodile spotted crawling on road after heavy rainfall lashes Ratnagiri in Maharashtra, video storms internet; watch

With the arrival of monsoon in India, several parts of the country are experiencing heavy rainfall leading to overflowing rivers and flooded streets, disrupting daily life. Recently, a shocking video has stormed the internet in which a crocodile can be seen crawling on the road.

As per reports, the incident was captured on the streets of Chiplun in Maharashtra’s Ratnagiri. It is believed that the crocodile was washed away from the nearby Shiva river after heavy rainfall lashed the district.

In the viral video, a commuter can be seen recording the crocodile on a mobile camera as it crawls to the side of the road. While one auto-rickshaw passes by the crocodile, another auto-rickshaw driver turns his vehicle and follows the reptile. He is seen recording the video of the crocodile with his mobile camera.

The entire incident was captured by a person sitting inside a four-wheeler and as the crocodile approached close, he moved back. Well, the crocodile widens its mouth while crossing the road and it seems, it gets annoyed after the auto-rickshaw follows from behind.
A commuter can be heard saying, “Khidki band hai guys! (Windows are shut, guys!).”
Why the crocodile crossed the road !!A video from from Ratnagiri, Maharashtra, where a crocodile on a city tour. Hope everything went safely. @ndtv pic.twitter.com/c65jWsJBBl

While the origin of the video couldn't be verified, it is shared on X by Parveen Kaswan. Sharing the video, the user wrote, “Why the crocodile crossed the road !! A video from Ratnagiri, Maharashtra, where a crocodile on a city tour. Hope everything went safely.” (sic)
Commenting on the video, one user wrote, "So now it’s their turn to take over our area." (sic)
Another wrote, "May be loss of habitat due to flood." (sic)
"All their habitats - water bodies and Marshlands- are encroached which were abutting Towns and Cities. So for their survival, they search for foods inside human habitats," wrote a third user. (sic)
Well, several users penned down their funny thoughts while a few others expressed their concern.

The government aims to develop an indigenous high-performance computing (HPC) processor, AUM, to become a global leader in supercomputing. At an event, C-DAC announced its partnership with MosChip Technologies and Socionext Inc. The chip will be based on Arm architecture using TSMC's 5nm technology.

Will harness 'Made in India' supercomputing for national development,
 global leadership: Centre

The government aims to develop indigenous high-performance computing (HPC) processor,  known as AUM, as part of complete indigenisation and become a global leader in supercomputing, said S. Krishnan, Secretary, Ministry of Electronics & Information Technology (MeitY).

He was speaking at an event in the national capital where the Centre for Development of Advanced Computing (C-DAC) partnered with MosChip Technologies, and Socionext Inc. for the design and development of the indigenous HPC chip.
The HPC processor is based on the Arm architecture and built on TSMC’s (Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Company) 5nm technology node.

“The announcement is a significant achievement in chip design. It demonstrates India's capability in indigenous development in the field of high-performance computing. These ventures in consortia mode in partnership with industry are the need of the hour,” said Dr Praveen Kumar S., Head of Scientific Divisions (HOD) at the Department of Science and Technology.
C-DAC is designing an indigenous HPC processor called AUM where Keenheads Technologies, an Indian startup, has been engaged as a programme management consultant (PMC) for the project.

“Our indigenisation efforts have reached more than 50 per cent with server nodes, interconnects, and system software stack. Now for complete indigenisation, we are aiming to develop indigenous HPC Processor AUM,” Krishnan noted.

Parts of Rahul Gandhi's speech in the Lok Sabha during a discussion on the President's Address were expunged. His remarks on Hindus sparked protests from BJP MPs and an intervention by PM Modi. Home Minister Amit Shah demanded an apology for linking BJP with violence.
Rahul Gandhi
Parts of Rahul Gandhi's speech in the Lok Sabha during a discussion on the President's Address on July 1 have been expunged.
The portions expunged include his comments on Hindus and others.
Rahul Gandhi’s maiden speech as the Leader of Opposition (LoP) in Lok Sabha was marked by huge pandemonium and uproar on Monday.

Starting his speech, the Congress MP waved a copy of the Constitution and also the photo of Lord Shiva while launching a broadside at the ruling Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) and Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS).
Rahul Gandhi’s reference to Hindus drew strong protest from the BJP MPs and also a rare intervention from Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
PM Modi stood up to interject the Congress MP and said, “Calling the entire Hindu community violent is a very serious matter.”
Home Minister Amit Shah demanded an apology from the Congress MP for ‘linking’ the BJP with violence.
The Home Minister also took strong exception to Rahul Gandhi’s analogy of ‘violent Hindus’ with the BJP and demanded that the Congress leader tender an apology.

The National Testing Agency announced the revised rank list for the medical entrance exam NEET-UG on Monday, July 1, 2024. The revised result was announced after a retest was conducted for candidates who were earlier awarded grace marks to compensate for loss of time as the exam on May 5 started late at six centres. It was later scrapped by the honourable Supreme Court, giving candidates the choice to opt for a re-test or to retain the original scores excluding the grace marks. For the retest conducted at seven centres on June 23 following a Supreme Court order, 48 per cent of the 1,563 candidates did not appear.”It is now informed that revised Score Cards of all Candidates of NEET (UG) 2024 (including of 1563 Candidates who appeared in the RE-Test on 23 June 2024), are being hosted on the website ( exams.nta.ac.in/NEET ). Candidates can login to the website and view/download/print their respective revised Score Cards,” says NTA
Published: Odishatv Bureau
Last updated: 01 July 2024, 03:10 PM IST

Prime Minister Narendra Modi stated that Digital India symbolizes an empowered nation by enhancing 'Ease of Living' and transparency. Celebrating nine years of the initiative, Modi highlighted the country's advancements in digital payments and public infrastructure, making it a global fintech leader.
Digital India symbolises an empowered nation: PM Modi
Digital India symbolises an empowered country which boosts 'Ease of Living' and transparency, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said on Monday.
The Prime Minister lauded the successful completion of nine years of the ‘Digital India initiative’, which was launched on July 1, 2015.

Sharing a thread on X by MyGovIndia, the Prime Minister wrote: “A Digital India is an empowered India, boosting 'Ease of Living' and transparency. This thread gives a glimpse of the strides made in a decade thanks to the effective usage of technology.”
MyGovIndia said in a post that from revolutionising digital payments to becoming the fastest-growing digital economy, India's journey in the past nine years has been nothing short of extraordinary.
“The ‘Digital India’ initiative, spearheaded by the PM Modi government, has transformed the nation's digital landscape.
“India's trajectory exemplifies that Digital Public Infrastructure (DPI) is a fundamental driver of social transformation and progress,” MyGovIndia posted.
The country has become a leading global fintech ecosystem thanks to robust digital public infrastructure (DPI) models like unified payments interface (UPI).
Several countries are ready to embrace the 'India Stack' solutions to empower the masses, PM Modi told IANS in May.
The Prime Minister said that when he kicked off the 'Digital India' movement, opposition parties made allegations that this was being done to serve the needs of the service providers.
"They could not understand how big this area is and the 21st century is a technology-driven century. Moreover, technology today is driven by artificial intelligence (AI)," PM Modi had told IANS.
The digital revolution, driven by UPI and QR-code-based payments, has shown to the world that DPIs like UPI, Aadhaar, and DigiLocker can transform millions of lives.

The author reflects on his career, emphasizing the value of maintaining professional distance for unbiased reporting.

Despite his past influence, his future in politics appears dim as he navigates challenges from an incoming BJP government.

The article reflects on Naveen Patnaik's political tenure as he steps down, critiquing his governance and its impact on Odia culture and politics. It highlights his manipulative political strategies, possible corruption, and the perceived betrayal by his trusted aide, alongside the disillusionment with his secular claims.

Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik clarified that VK Pandian is not his successor, aiming to quell rumors and manage the damage this speculation caused to BJD's election prospects. Despite the announcement, skepticism remains among voters as BJD faces significant challenges in the ongoing elections.

Despite Naveen Patnaik's long tenure marked by various governance issues, many prefer the known challenges over the risks of BJP rule. This resistance spans from those benefiting from Patnaik’s patronage to those fearing unknown political shifts.
