Anupamaa takes dramatic turn: Anuj Kapadia's new look leaves fans worried about his role

Anupamaa, starring Rupali Ganguly, continues to generate excitement among viewers. The current storyline features Dimpy and Titu’s wedding, with Vanraj trying to disrupt the event while Anupama aims to save it.
Meanwhile, Shruti has returned to the US, urging Anuj and Anupama to remarry. Amid these developments, Gaurav Khanna, who plays Anuj Kapadia, has shared a shocking photo of himself on social media.
Anuj's recent declaration of love for Anu had fans anticipating a heartfelt reunion. However, the latest twist suggests otherwise.

A viral image of Gaurav Khanna, showcasing a dramatic transformation, has left fans puzzled and concerned. The actor appears unrecognizable with grown hair and a beard, sparking speculation about the show's direction. The intense new look hints at a significant leap in the storyline, potentially altering Anu and Anuj's lives once again.

This unexpected transformation has shocked netizens, leading to speculation that Anuj's character might become a beggar in upcoming episodes. However, there has been no official confirmation from the makers.

Fans are anxious about this new development, with one user commenting, "My brain is not brain-ing after this. If this is related to #Anupamaa show, then I feel something very scary is coming up for both Anuj & Anu. Ek din sukoon ko saans nahi le sakte while being this show's fan."

Another wrote, “They know to create a buzz and who can create buzz, but there must be something na. I don't think they will go for another leap this soon, or the best speculation I can get is may he is enacting an act to make aadhya understand so that she will accept anupama.”

Parts of Rahul Gandhi's speech in the Lok Sabha during a discussion on the President's Address were expunged. His remarks on Hindus sparked protests from BJP MPs and an intervention by PM Modi. Home Minister Amit Shah demanded an apology for linking BJP with violence.

Rahul Gandhi's first speech as Leader of the Opposition in Lok Sabha sparked chaos when he linked Hindus with violence, drawing strong protests from BJP MPs and interventions from PM Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah, who demanded an apology.

Om Birla, BJP MP from Kota-Bundi, was re-elected as the Lok Sabha Speaker by a voice vote, marking his second consecutive term and making him the first BJP leader to achieve this. Supported by NDA leaders including PM Modi, he received 297 votes against 232 for the opposition's nominee.

Following the Lok Sabha Elections 2024, BJP-led NDA won 292 seats forming a coalition government with Janata Dal United and Telugu Desam Party. Nitish Kumar, known for switching alliances, rejoined the NDA, sparking numerous humorous memes on social media.

Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal rebutted Rahul Gandhi's allegation of a 'biggest stock market scam', attributing it to election disappointment. He emphasized India's economic growth under Modi, projecting further rise in global ranking during Modi's potential third term.

Ahead of the second phase polls in Odisha, key political leaders intensified their campaigns. Rahul Gandhi criticized BJP but did not comment on BJD. Naveen Patnaik campaigned for free electricity and targeted opposition claims. Om Birla also campaigned actively.

Congress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Mallikarjun Kharge are set to visit Odisha for election campaigning, with scheduled events in Bolangir and Kandhamal. Jairam Ramesh will also hold a press meet in Bhubaneswar.

Congress leader Rahul Gandhi will visit Odisha on May 15 to address a rally in Bolangir and lead a bike rally, to campaign for party candidates. This marks his second visit to the state during the elections.

Rahul Gandhi, unable to attend a rally in Rayagada due to his nomination filing, spoke via virtual mode and promised farm loan waiver, job prioritization for graduates and diploma holders, and hiked wages under MGNREGA.
The Congress party on Friday announced its nominees for the Rae Bareli and Amethi constituencies in Uttar Pradesh.
The senior Congress leader also guaranteed employment opportunities for the unemployed youths of India under ‘Pehli Naukri Pakki’ scheme.

Today’s voting will see some of the most closely watched contests as some high profile names including Rahul Gandhi, Hema Malini, Tejasvi Surya, Rajeev Chandrashekhar and Shashi Tharoor are seeking seats.

The top leaders are most likely skipping the expected high-voltage contest from Congress’ bastion Amethi and Raebareli. It is pertinent to mention here that Raebareli is a seat that was previously held by Sonia Gandhi.
The list also includes two from Meghalaya, including sitting Shillong MP Vincent Pala, as well as the sole seats in Nagaland and Sikkim, four from Telangana, and one from Tripura.
The Jharkhand High Court has rejected Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's petition seeking to quash proceedings against him in a trial court in connection with a criminal complaint.

Do you want to grow your hair during the monsoon?
Author: Soumya Prakash Pradhan | Credit: Canva
Here are some tips that you can follow for good hair care. Let's find out these hair care tips.
Author: Soumya Prakash Pradhan | Credit: Canva
Hydration is Key: Drink plenty of water to keep your hair hydrated from the inside out. Dehydration can lead to dry, brittle hair prone to breakage.
Author: Soumya Prakash Pradhan | Credit: Canva
Protect from Sun: Shield your hair from the sun's UV rays by wearing hats or scarves. Sun exposure can weaken hair proteins and make your hair more susceptible to damage.
Author: Soumya Prakash Pradhan | Credit: Canva
Use a Gentle Shampoo: Opt for a mild, sulfate-free shampoo to cleanse your scalp and hair without stripping away natural oils. This helps maintain a healthy scalp environment for hair growth.
Author: Soumya Prakash Pradhan | Credit: Canva
Condition Regularly: Apply a conditioner suitable for your hair type after shampooing to moisturize and nourish your hair. Focus on the ends to prevent split ends and keep hair strong.
Author: Soumya Prakash Pradhan | Credit: Canva
Avoid Overheating: Limit the use of heated styling tools like blow dryers and straighteners, as excessive heat can damage hair cuticles and cause breakage. Air dry your hair whenever possible.
Author: Soumya Prakash Pradhan | Credit: Canva
Following these tips can help protect your hair during the monsoon months and promote healthy growth.

Bhubaneswar is the capital of Odisha .It is the biggest city and the main power corridor of Odisha. The city is famous for its ancient rich heritage especially its historic monumental temples. It is popularly known as the temple city. Because many temples built from sandstone are dotted around Bindu Sagar Lake in the old city, including the 11th-century Hindu Lingaraja Temple.

It is popularly known as the temple city. Because many temples built from sandstone are dotted around Bindu Sagar Lake in the old city, including the 11th-century Hindu Lingaraja Temple.

The UPSC has announced the results of the Civil Services Preliminary exam 2024, held on June 16. Qualified candidates must submit a Detailed Application Form for the Mains, tentatively scheduled for September. The exam aims to fill 1056 vacancies.
The BJD took a swipe at the BJP over its poll-time promise to waive off 300 units of electricity. The BJP countered by highlighting their solar panel subsidy plan.
Due to their role in preventing lightning-related deaths, the Odisha Forest Department now imposes strict restrictions on cutting Palm trees, even on private properties.

Bars and pubs in Bhubaneswar are operating beyond permissible hours, prompting the Excise Commissioner to direct officials for inspections and legal actions. Social media posts exposed these violations, leading to increased surveillance and potential hefty fines or license cancellations.

The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has forecast heavy rainfall and thunderstorms in several parts of Odisha over the next 48 hours. A yellow warning has been issued, with surface winds expected to reach 40-50 kmph along the North Odisha coast.

Laxmisagar Police Station in Bhubaneswar registered the first case under new criminal laws, replacing British-era statutes. The incident involved an attempted murder on Gauranga Charan Das. Union Home Minister Amit Shah highlighted key changes, emphasizing crimes against women and children.

The newly-elected BJP government in Odisha, under CM Mohan Majhi, has revived the public grievance cell after several years. Citizens from across the state are now able to present their issues directly to the CM. This marks a shift from the previous administration under Naveen Patnaik.

Three people were killed and nine injured in separate road accidents in Bhubaneswar, Rayagada, and Angul. Accidents involved an SUV hitting a divider, a car collision with bikers, and another fatal incident on NH-55.

After a two-year suspension, apartment registrations in Odisha have resumed. However, old apartment owners face challenges due to new rules. Despite the new Apartment Ownership and Management Rules 2024, about 10,000 apartments remain unregistered, causing significant revenue loss.

Former Odisha DGP Sanjeev Marik announced plans to file a defamation suit against retired IPS officer M. Nageswara Rao for implicating him in a government land scam in Bhubaneswar. Marik claims Rao is retaliating due to a past conflict involving CRPF deployment issues.
Odisha Chief Minister Mohan Majhi will begin hearing public grievances from July 1 at the CM's Grievance Cell in Unit-V. Registration for grievances will be open from 9 AM to 12 Noon.

Police visited BJD leader Raghunandan Das' residence for the second time regarding allegations of setting his dogs on a lady journalist. The incident occurred while she was covering a demolition near his house.
IAS officer Manoj Ahuja was appointed as the new chief secretary of Odisha, replacing Pradeep Kumar Jena.
After an inquiry by the Odisha Home Department into IPS officer Ashish Singh's whereabouts, DGP Arun Sarangi confirmed that Singh resumed duty on June 3.

Odisha Industries Minister Sampad Chandra Swain stated that the truth behind the alleged land grab by KISS will be revealed after a probe. RTI activists have demanded a thorough investigation into the matter involving former BJD MP Achyuta Samanta and previous government officials.

With the arrival of monsoon in India, several parts of the country are experiencing heavy rainfall leading to overflowing rivers and flooded streets, disrupting daily life. Recently, a shocking video has stormed the internet in which a crocodile can be seen crawling on the road.

Two college girls, Shravanii and Swathii, captivated audiences at their farewell with an energetic dance to 'Kurchi Madathapetti'. Their viral video garnered 1.3 million views. Another video of them dancing to 'Veyira Cheyyi Veyira' gained 3.8 million views.

It was a historic moment as India lifted the Men's T20 World Cup yesterday in Barbados. A riot of emotions overflowed as the captain Rohit Sharma and legend Virat Kohli could not hold back their tears. New York too joined the celebrations chanting, 'Ganapati Bappa Moraya.'

Influencer Aarya Vora's elaborate airport welcome for her fiancé went viral on Instagram. The video, featuring her surprise and family celebrations, amassed 19 million views but also drew mixed reactions from viewers.

Though human-bear encounters are rare, they usually enter human settlements in search of food. What would be the consequences if you encounter a bear or bears while camping or during a picnic in or close to bears' habitat? Well, here we bring some videos that show the uninvited beasts joining humans while picnicking. The consequences are different in the videos

As the wedding season kicks in, parents and families of prospective grooms and brides start preparations for the grand lifetime event. While the videos of Ambani's wedding invitation card has taken the internet by storm, another old video has resurfaced on social media that shows 'quite an expensive' wedding invitation card that may blow off your mind.

A heartwarming video showing students looking for their favorite teacher has gone viral, capturing the hearts of social media users. The playful interaction between the children and their beloved teacher has garnered millions of views and numerous positive comments.

A video of an Indian woman drying clothes on the balcony of Dubai's luxurious Atlantis, The Palm hotel has gone viral. While some netizens applauded her innocence, others criticized her for 'desi' behavior. Pallavi Venkatesh shared the clip on Instagram, which garnered millions of views and thousands of comments. The hotel's response was supportive and lighthearted.

A viral social media video features South Indian superstar Nagarjuna Akkineni dancing to Travis Scott's song 'FE!N.' Originally from the movie 'Mass,' the clip was edited to sync with the 2023 track, garnering over 14.2 million views.

An Indian truck driver has stunned the internet by purchasing a 5-bedroom house worth Rs 2 crore in the USA. A popular vlogger shared a video of his house and Jeep Compass, sparking varied reactions online about the differences between life in India and America.

A viral video shows a boy dancing during a job interview to demonstrate his skill mentioned in his CV. The video, posted on Instagram, has garnered 5.6 million views and numerous comments from amused viewers, especially those in corporate jobs.

Online users might have come across hippos attacking crocodiles, tigers, lions and other creatures. However, it would be utterly surprising to see a hippo attacking three adult male lions and leaving them terrified. Recently, a video surfaced on the internet that shows the hippo attacking three male lions while the big cats are crossing the river.

Amid the pre-wedding bash, all eyes are on Anant Ambani, son of Indian billionaire Mukesh Ambani, and Radhika Merchant's exquisite wedding. While everyone is eagerly waiting for the grand wedding on July 12, the video of Anant and Radhika's wedding invitation card has recently stormed the internet leaving everyone shocked and mesmerised.

Only lucky people can escape from thunderbolts. Recently, a video of a young girl surfaced on social media that shows her narrowly escaping from extreme thunderbolts, while she was filming reels on the rooftop.

A pet dog in Atlanta, nicknamed the 'John Wick of dogs', fought off 13 coyotes to protect its owner's sheep, killing them all. The heroic dog, named Casper, has gained widespread social media praise and is now nominated for the People's Choice Pup in the Farm Dog of the Year.

Taimur Ali Khan, son of Kareena Kapoor and Saif Ali Khan, is seen honing his cricket skills at the ICM Cricket Academy in London. Saif shares his family's rich cricketing heritage with Taimur, explaining their connections to Sussex and Worcestershire. Videos of Taimur playing and listening to his father's stories have captivated viewers.

The popular TV show Anupamaa continues to engage viewers with dramatic twists. The current plot focuses on Dimpy and Titur's wedding, with Vanraj attempting to sabotage the event while Anupama tries to save it. Meanwhile, Gaurav Khanna's shocking transformation photo has sparked speculation and concern among fans about the show's future direction.
Samantha has been roped in for her third project with Raj & DK opposite Aditya Roy Kapur which has raised many eyebrows.

Kannada Film Industry's Rocking Star Yash got worldwide recognition with the monstrous box office success of the KGF series. Both the instalments of the KGF, written and helmed by Prashanth Neel scripted numerous records. While moviegoers are eagerly waiting for updates on KGF: Chapter 3, all eyes are on Yash's upcoming Toxic: A Fairytale for Grown-ups. As per the last reports, Yash is teaming up with Nayanthara, Shruti Haasan, Kiara Advani and Huma Qureshi for the first time. Well, while fans are eagerly waiting for updates on Toxic, it has recently been learned that Toxic is going 'KGF way.'

A couple of days ago, Tamil actor Sunaina shared a picture of two hands (a man and hers) holding each other with a locked emoticon, indicating that she was engaged and locked for life. Though she didn't disclose anything about her fiance, her post on June 5, sparked various speculations. However, the next day, Dubai-based popular YouTuber Khalid AI Ameri liked the post on June 6 and posted a similar post of a couple holding each other's hand, with a diamond ring on the girl's finger. Now, reports are abuzz that Sunaina is engaged to Khalid AI Ameri and is set to get married soon.

The recently released sci-fi epic 'Kalki 2898 AD', directed by Nag Ashwin and starring top Indian actors like Prabhas, Amitabh Bachchan, Kamal Haasan, and Deepika Padukone, is set to cross Rs 500 crore worldwide. It has already grossed Rs 488 crore in four days.

Nargis Fakhri, a passionate traveler, shares her favorite destinations. She highlights the enchanting Swiss Alps, historical Oxfordshire in the UK, and vibrant Los Angeles. Each location offers unique experiences from picturesque landscapes to cultural riches.

Thalapathy Vijay is set to reunite with Samantha Ruth Prabhu for the film Thalapathy 69, directed by H Vinoth. This marks their fourth collaboration and Vijay's last movie before focusing on his political career. The film is expected to be an intense political thriller with music by Anirudh Ravichander.

Abhishek Bachchan recently completed 24 years of his debut in Bollywood. Big B congratulated him on social media admiring his versatility and dedication. Instead of saying thank you, Junior Bachchan schooled him for tweeting so late.
Arjun Kapoor recently celebrated his 39th birthday surrounded by friends and family. However, the absence of Malaika Arora from his special day sparked speculation about their breakup rumours.

Neeraj Pandey-directed Auron Mein Kahan Dum Tha starring Tabu and Ajay Devgn in the lead is gearing up for release on July 5. As a part of the promotions the famous director recently answered a few questions from the fans on Reddit.
Hardik Pandya got emotional after India lifted the T20 World Cup 2024 a few days ago. He was seen video calling someone very close from the ground after the match.

Samantha Ruth Prabhu welcomed July with a stunning selfie, exuding positivity and minimal makeup. The Citadel actress, who is battling Myositis, advocates self-love and body positivity through her platforms. She follows Sadhguru's teachings and is gearing up for new projects like 'Citadel Honey Bunny' with Varun Dhawan and a series with Aditya Roy Kapur.
The third season of the acclaimed web series 'Kota Factory' captivates with its portrayal of students' struggles and successes, highlighting emotional scenes that resonate deeply with viewers.

Vijay Deverakonda's cameo as Arjuna in Prabhas' sci-fi hit 'Kalki 2898 AD' has garnered immense praise. Despite the film's stellar box office performance, Vijay did not charge for his role due to his good relationship with director Nag Ashwin.

The UPSC has announced the results of the Civil Services Preliminary exam 2024, held on June 16. Qualified candidates must submit a Detailed Application Form for the Mains, tentatively scheduled for September. The exam aims to fill 1056 vacancies.

IAS officer Pari Bishnoi and her sister, criminal lawyer Payal Bishnoi, have gone viral on social media after a photographer discovered their impressive accomplishments. Pari, who secured AIR-30 in the UPSC exam, serves as Additional District Magistrate in Sikkim.

The Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) has released the admit cards for the EPFO Personal Assistant Examinations 2024. Candidates can download their e-admit cards from the official UPSC website ahead of the examination scheduled for July 7, 2024.

It includes two shifts covering General Ability, Intelligence, and Comprehension topics. A total of 506 posts across various forces like BSF and CRPF will be filled. Eligibility requires a bachelor's degree.

Akash Chavda from Jamnagar, Gujarat, overcame personal tragedies including the loss of his parents to clear the prestigious UPSC exam without formal coaching. Growing up in a hostel as an orphan, Akash's determination and support from his cousin helped him achieve remarkable success.

IPS officer Mohita Sharma, known for her role in arresting terrorist mastermind Hakam Deen in Jammu & Kashmir, also won Rs 1 crore on Kaun Banega Crorepati. A native of Himachal Pradesh, Mohita's journey to becoming an IPS involved multiple UPSC attempts before achieving success.

The UPSC Civil Services Prelims 2024 will be held on June 16, with two shifts starting at 9:30 am and 2:30 pm. Candidates must bring admit cards, a valid ID, and follow specific guidelines regarding items to bring and avoid. The exam features negative marking.

Annapurna Singh from Bihar secured AIR-99 in the UPSC Civil Services Exam after transitioning from a tech job at Intel to preparing for civil services entirely through self-study during Covid-19. Despite initial setbacks in her first two attempts, she succeeded with strong support from her family.

Pooja Yadav's journey from tutoring and working as a receptionist to becoming an IPS officer with AIR-174 in UPSC 2018 exemplifies dedication. Despite financial challenges and initial family resistance, her persistence led her to serve in the Gujarat cadre.
Ankita is an IPS officer from the Chhattisgarh cadre. At present, she serves as the SP of Khairagarh district. She is known for taking risky anti-Naxalite operations in Bastar.

An aspirant's poignant reflection on failing the UPSC exam highlights the commonality of failure and critiques the societal focus solely on success. After quitting a job in 2021 to pursue meaningful work through UPSC, despite strenuous efforts, the individual faced repeated failures, sparking a broader discussion on handling failure and redefining personal success.

IAS Mamta Yadav from Haryana cleared the UPSC Civil Services Exam twice, improving her rank from AIR-556 to AIR-05. Coming from a modest background, she dedicated long hours to her studies to achieve her dream of bettering her family's financial situation.

Pragati Rani from Kurukshetra, despite initial setbacks in her UPSC attempts, secured the 355th rank at age 31 while balancing motherhood and a radiology career. Supported by her husband and family, she overcame multiple challenges to potentially become an IAS officer.

The Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) has announced the recruitment for various posts including Specialist Grade III, Assistant Director, and Assistant Professor. Interested candidates must apply by June 13, 2024, via the official UPSC website.

Saad Miya Khan, Vishal Mishra, and Gaurav Vijayram Kumar exemplify true friendship by overcoming numerous challenges to succeed in the UPSC exams together in 2017. Coming from diverse backgrounds, they united in their educational pursuits and administrative ambitions.

The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has forecast heavy rainfall and thunderstorms in several parts of Odisha over the next 48 hours. A yellow warning has been issued, with surface winds expected to reach 40-50 kmph along the North Odisha coast.
Thunderstorm Alert For Odisha Districts

The cyclonic circulation over east Jharkhand and neighbourhood now lies over Sub-Himalayan West Bengal and neighbourhood. The trough from west Assam to north Odisha has become less marked, informed the India Meteorological Department (IMD) on Monday.
IMD has predicted heavy rainfall and thunderstorm activities in several parts of Odisha in the next 48 hours. A yellow warning in this regard has also been issued.
As per IMD, surface wind with speed reaching up to 40 to 50 kmph is likely along and off North Odisha coast during next 24 hours due to steep pressure gradient.
Day 1 (Valid upto 0830 hrs IST of 02.07.2024)

Yellow Warning: Heavy rainfall is very likely to occur at one or two places over the districts of Jharsuguda, Sundargarh, Keonjhar. Thunderstorm with lightning is very likely to occur at one or two places over the districts of Sundargarh, Jharsuguda, Keonjhar, Deogarh, Mayurbhanj, Balasore, Bhadrak, Jajpur, Kendrapara, Cuttack, Jagatsinghpur.
Day 2 (Valid from 0830 hrs IST of 02.07.2024to 0830 hrs IST of 03.07.2024)

Yellow Warning: Thunderstorm with lightning is very likely to occur at one or two places over the districts of Sundargarh, Jharsuguda, Keonjhar, Deogarh, Mayurbhanj, Balasore, Bhadrak, Jajpur, Kendrapara, Cuttack, Jagatsinghpur.

Jaidep Ahlawat and Junaid Khan’s Maharaj released on OTT a few weeks ago. Shalini Pandey who portrays a girl Kishori shared details about her anxious moments after doing a rape scene in this digital release.

Chandrika Dixit, popularly known as 'Vada Pav Girl' is once again in the headlines after she entered the Bigg Boss house (OTT Season 3) as a contestant. While Chandrika is quite popular on social media, her 'controversies' and getting detained by the police made her more popular. However, now she has drawn everyone's attention after revealing her daily earnings by selling vada pav.
Ranveer Shorey made a last-minute entry in Bigg Boss OTT 3 and surprised everyone. Now he has left the audience excited after his argument with the Vada Pav girl aka Chandrika Dixit.

The trailer for 'Mirzapur' season 3 was released, showcasing a fierce battle for control in Purvanchal with Guddu challenging Kaleen Bhaiyya. The series features star-studded cast and is set to premiere on Prime Video on July 5.

The last week of June features several new releases on OTT platforms, including 'Kota Factory' Season 3, 'Bad Cop', and a documentary about Roger Federer's final days in tennis. Other highlights include a series on the Dallas Cowboys Cheerleaders and the action thriller 'Trigger Warning' starring Jessica Alba.
Kartik Aaryan and his mother Mala Tiwari are going to be the guests on the upcoming episode of The Great Indian Kapil Show.
Mirzapur Season 3 is all set to start streaming on Amazon Prime Video on July 5.  As the teaser suggests the fight for the throne will become fiercer. Check more details!
Fans are eagerly awaiting for Mirzapur Season 3 to start streaming on the OTT platform. Now finally, Amazon Prime Video has announced the release date albeit in an innovative way.
Sania Mirza appeared on The Great Indian Kapil Show along with other big names in Indian sports like boxer Mary Kom, badminton player Saina Nehwal, and sharpshooter Sift Kaur recently.
Pankaj Jha who is currently in the news for his remarkable performance as Vidhayak in the recently released Panchayat Season 3 made some shocking claims during a podcast.

Following the massive response to 'Heeramandi: The Diamond Bazaar', Sanjay Leela Bhansali, reportedly, has plans for season 2. During a recent interview, SLB talked about his visions for Heeramandi. He also talked about the series getting mixed reactions and revealed the possibilities of season 2.
Kunal Kemmu’s first directorial venture Madgaon Express has been well received by the audience. Recently he revealed inspiration behind a particular scene that has caught attention of everyone.
Disha Patani, Rashmika Mandanna, and then Triptii Dimri have been ruling the hearts of the young Indians. Now it seems a lot of newer actors have seized the baton from these stars.
A few scenes from Heeramandi are quite magical and one such scene that has been discussed constantly on digital platforms is the Gajagamini walk of Aditi Rao Hydari.
The Heeramandi actress met Salman Khan on the sets of Hum Dil De Chuke Sanam. Then, Salman proposed to her and asked her, 'Will You Marry Me?' The actress recently recalled the interesting anecdote.

A heartwarming video showing students looking for their favorite teacher has gone viral, capturing the hearts of social media users. The playful interaction between the children and their beloved teacher has garnered millions of views and numerous positive comments.
Students' sneaking glances at their favourite teacher warms hearts online
Kids during school days learn new things and become enthusiastic about different experiences.
They spend most of their time in school, forming bonds with their classmates and favourite teachers.
Recently, a video has gone viral on social media showing a group of students hiding behind the door of the staff room and looking for their favourite teacher.
They are surprised to find their favourite teacher sitting alone quietly there, which has warmed the hearts of many online viewers.

When the teacher notices the students peeking at her from behind the door, she asks, "What are you looking at?" The children then enter the teacher's common room and the teacher humorously asks them, "First tell me, why do you hide behind the door and peek?"
To this, one boy chuckles and replies, "You!" leaving everyone laughing. Then again the teacher jokingly asks, "Why... why were you looking for me?"

Another boy confidently replies, "Just like that." Hearing this, the teacher laughs hard and another boy says loudly, "We like you." The teacher then asks, "Who do you like?" The boy replies, "You!" This leaves the teacher smiling who then says, "Oh, I see."

The interaction in the video captured the hearts of social media users. The caption shared with the video read, "We need this much confidence in life." The video has garnered 5.3 million views, 292K likes, and numerous comments.

One user humorously commented, "Men will be men... in all generations 😂😂", while another jokingly said, "Maybe she was an English teacher 🌚". Another user fondly recalled, "Our first crush is always our teacher ❤️😍", and someone else teased, "These three are best friends 😂😂😂😂".
One user reminisced, "Every kid had a crush on their teacher during childhood."
Another person admitted, "Why am I blushing 😀", and one user shared, "Even us girls used to sneak glances at our English teacher 😁😁".

Online food delivery platform Zomato has received a new GST demand notice for Rs 9.45 crore, including interest and penalties, from the Assistant Commissioner of Commercial Taxes Audit in Karnataka for FY 2019-20. The company plans to appeal the order, asserting it has a strong case.
Zomato
Online food delivery platform Zomato has received a fresh Goods and Service Tax (GST) demand notice for about Rs 9.45 crore with interest and penalty.
The company said in a stock regulatory filing that the demand has been raised by the Assistant Commissioner of Commercial Taxes (Audit), Karnataka.

"This is to inform that the company has received an order for FY 2019-20 pursuant to the audit of GST returns and accounts by the Assistant Commissioner of Commercial Taxes (Audit), Karnataka raising demand of GST of Rs 5,01,95,462, along with interest of Rs 3,93,58,743 and penalty of Rs 50,19,546," Zomato said in its BSE filing.
“We believe that we have a strong case on merits and the company will be filing an appeal against the order before the appropriate authority,” said the company in response to the tax notice.
Zomato shares closed 0.10 per cent higher at Rs 200.35 on Friday.
This is not the first time the food delivery company has received a tax notice.
Last month, the online food delivery platform received a GST demand and penalty order of more than Rs 2 crore from Delhi's sales tax officer.

The order consists of Rs 2,22,91,376 in GST demand with interest of Rs 2,08,98,164 and a penalty of Rs 22,29,136 for the April 2018 to March 2019 period. In April, the company also received a GST demand and penalty order for Rs 11.81 crore.
Earlier this month, Zomato had said it received notices from the tax authorities in Delhi and Karnataka over alleged short payment of GST in 2018 amounting to Rs 4.2 crore.
(Except for the headline, this story, from a syndicated feed, has not been edited by Odishatv.in staff)

Hardik Pandya got emotional after India lifted the T20 World Cup 2024 a few days ago. He was seen video calling someone very close from the ground after the match.
Natasa Stankovic, Hardik Pandya

It was a moment of joy for both the players and their families as India lifted the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2024. From Rohit Sharma cradling his daughter and hugging his wife to an emotional Virat Kohli video calling his family from the ground, everyone had special moments with their near ones after the win.

Hardik Pandya who has been under the scanner for the last few months also got emotional and had tears in his eyes. He too was found video-calling someone after the match. While Anushka Sharma shared an emotional post for Virat Kohli after the win, there has been no post from Natasa Stankovic, wife of the Indian vice Captain of the T20 World Cup team.

For the last few months, there have been rumours that all is not well between the couple. The rumours triggered after Hardik who was roped in as the captain of Mumbai Indians in place of Rohit Sharma underperformed in IPL 2024. Natasa was trolled and criticized for this underperformance after netizens noticed that the Siberian model had removed the surname Pandya from her social media account.
A post shared by Voompla (@voompla)

Amid the hype around the T20 World Cup, all the rumours about Hardik Pandya and Natasa Stankovic breakup were forgotten. Now suddenly after India's win fans have started pointing out how despite giving such a stunning performance in the finals there has been no post from Natasa appreciating Hardik Pandya. She used to post gracious comments on even IPL wins and performances of Hardik Pandya earlier. Importantly, the actress is very active even now on Instagram and keeps on posting regularly.
HARDIK PANDYA - YOU CHAMPION!                An emotional speech by Hardik about his tough times, he redeemed himself like a true hero. 🫡🇮🇳pic.twitter.com/l8mwdyqqIs
But she has not mentioned a single word about India's win or her husband which has led many netizens to speculate that the rumours about Hardik and Natasa split seem very much true.

At least eight workers are in critical condition following a carbon monoxide gas leak at Rourkela Steel Plant. The incident occurred during repair work at blast furnace number-5. Injured workers are receiving treatment in ICU at Ispat General Hospital.
Gas Leak At Rourkela Steel Plant

At least eight workers were injured following a gas leak incident reported at Rourkela Steel Plant (RSP) on Monday. As per initial reports, three workers and five contract labourers fell sick following leakage of carbon monoxide gas.

The incident occurred when they had gone to conduct some repair work at blast furnace number- 5 today. Following the incident, the eight injured were rushed to Ispat General Hospital (IGH). They are now in ICU and undergoing treatment.

As per the hospital authorities, all of them have been kept under observation for 24 hours. Earlier also similar mishaps was reported at Rourkela Steel Plant. Five labourers had also died in the mishap. The RSP authorities had then given prominence to safety. However, it seems that a complete check on such mishaps has not been possible so far, rued locals.
Several unions have also blamed the authorities for allegedly not taking appropriate steps and neglecting the safety aspect of the workers. No comment could be obtained from the RSP authorities.

A video of an Indian woman drying clothes on the balcony of Dubai's luxurious Atlantis, The Palm hotel has gone viral. While some netizens applauded her innocence, others criticized her for 'desi' behavior. Pallavi Venkatesh shared the clip on Instagram, which garnered millions of views and thousands of comments. The hotel's response was supportive and lighthearted.
Indian woman dries clothes in Dubai’s elite ‘Atlantis’ hotel balcony

A video of an Indian woman drying clothes on the balcony of Dubai’s ultra-luxurious Dubai ‘Atlantis, The Palm in Dubai Hotel has gone viral on social media, leaving the internet divided. While a section of people applauded her innocence, others brutally trolled her for ‘desi’ behaviour.

Taking to Instagram, user Pallavi Venkatesh shared a video of her mother drying clothes on the balcony of Atlantis hotel.  Sharing the video, Pallavi hilariously wrote, “Moms just momming at Palm Atlantis.”
Unexpectedly, the video went crazy viral with millions of views and thousands of comments.
“Congratulations!! ....aunty's one desi Funda of daily routine is famous in European county. Hats of 2 mother india ❤️,” commented a user.
Another user shared, “Mom is mom it doesn't matter where you live in palace or hut she just taking care of her family.”
“The problem is ppl make a big deal even out of such cute lil moments.. more than the luxury it is such moments one remembers from holidays ❤️,” shared another user.
A post shared by Pallavi Venkatesh (@iam.pallavivenkatesh)
However, many Indians weren’t too pleased and said that it was bad manners in foreign countries and should follow the rules and regulations of their country.
“Making every country a ghetto,” shared another user.
Another user shared, “The problem with desi parents is the toxicity that whatever they do is right. That’s how our generation has been embarrassed by our parents all our lives.”
However, Atlantis Palm Hotel left an adorable comment and wrote,
“Mom duties 👏 We hope you enjoyed your stay! (We include a retractable drying cord in every bathroom so that you can dry your clothing over the bath).”

The UPSC has announced the results of the Civil Services Preliminary exam 2024, held on June 16. Qualified candidates must submit a Detailed Application Form for the Mains, tentatively scheduled for September. The exam aims to fill 1056 vacancies.

Frequent ownership changes have hindered development at Gopalpur Port in Odisha's Ganjam district. Residents, particularly the fishermen community, face an uncertain future due to jetty construction. The Odisha Commerce and Transport Minister suspects deliberate actions behind these changes, with hopes for improvement under potential new ownership by Adani Group.

Parts of Rahul Gandhi's speech in the Lok Sabha during a discussion on the President's Address were expunged. His remarks on Hindus sparked protests from BJP MPs and an intervention by PM Modi. Home Minister Amit Shah demanded an apology for linking BJP with violence.

The government aims to develop an indigenous high-performance computing (HPC) processor, AUM, to become a global leader in supercomputing. At an event, C-DAC announced its partnership with MosChip Technologies and Socionext Inc. The chip will be based on Arm architecture using TSMC's 5nm technology.

The Securities and Exchange Board of India has issued a 46-page show-cause notice to Hindenburg Research, Nathan Anderson, and Mark Kingdon for trading violations related to Adani Enterprises. The notice alleges breaches of SEBI regulations and fraudulent practices.
The examination aims to assess a student's eligibility to enrol into either of the 46 Central universities for undergraduate courses.

The popular TV show Anupamaa continues to engage viewers with dramatic twists. The current plot focuses on Dimpy and Titur's wedding, with Vanraj attempting to sabotage the event while Anupama tries to save it. Meanwhile, Gaurav Khanna's shocking transformation photo has sparked speculation and concern among fans about the show's future direction.

Tensions flared in Belanta village, Cuttack, after a violent clash led to bombs being hurled. Several people were injured, and police have been deployed to maintain order. The incident follows earlier conflicts during Holi.

India won the 2024 Men's T20 World Cup after a gripping final against South Africa at Kensington Oval. The victory ended an 11-year wait for a major trophy, sparking joyous celebrations across the nation. Key players like Rohit Sharma, Hardik Pandya, and Virat Kohli were visibly emotional as they celebrated this historic win.
The bodies of farmer Rakesh Dodwa, his wife, and three children were discovered in their Alirajpur district home. Police suspect suicide but continue to investigate as no note was found.

At least nine children were killed and 11 injured in an RSF air raid on a mosque in El Fasher, North Darfur. The incident occurred amidst ongoing fierce clashes between the RSF and the Sudanese Armed Forces since April 2023.

The daily horoscope for July 2, 2024, highlights positive health changes for Aries and job success for Gemini. Predictions for Taurus warn of potential disappointments from close friends. Cancer natives may see improvements in health and educational progress.

Daily astrological predictions for July 2, 2024. Sagittarius enjoys marital bliss, Capricorn receives praise at work, and Aquarius sees enhanced health and business prospects. Pisces anticipates professional success and financial gains.

The daily horoscope for July 2, 2024, highlights financial benefits for Scorpio and potential challenges for Leo in married life. Virgo students may face family issues, while Libra will experience success in court matters.
Sujata Khatua from Bhadrak, Odisha, has entered the India Book of Records for writing road safety songs in memory of her deceased son Soumitra Mohanty, who died in a road accident.

Parts of Rahul Gandhi's speech in the Lok Sabha during a discussion on the President's Address were expunged. His remarks on Hindus sparked protests from BJP MPs and an intervention by PM Modi. Home Minister Amit Shah demanded an apology for linking BJP with violence.
The BJD took a swipe at the BJP over its poll-time promise to waive off 300 units of electricity. The BJP countered by highlighting their solar panel subsidy plan.

Rahul Gandhi's first speech as Leader of the Opposition in Lok Sabha sparked chaos when he linked Hindus with violence, drawing strong protests from BJP MPs and interventions from PM Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah, who demanded an apology.

The newly-elected BJP government in Odisha, under CM Mohan Majhi, has revived the public grievance cell after several years. Citizens from across the state are now able to present their issues directly to the CM. This marks a shift from the previous administration under Naveen Patnaik.

Dr Jitendra Singh is set to launch a special campaign for addressing family pension grievances in New Delhi. Initiated by the DOPPW as part of its 100 Days Action Plan, this month-long campaign will involve 46 ministries and departments. The effort aims to significantly reduce pending cases, focusing primarily on women pensioners.

Balle Balle Dhaba was allegedly given to a woman BJD leader on lease but without any documents. Dharmasala's former BJD MLA Pranab Balabantaray was said to be managing the show from behind the scenes.
IAS officer Manoj Ahuja was appointed as the new chief secretary of Odisha, replacing Pradeep Kumar Jena.
Thalapathy Vijay today directly blamed M.K. Stalin, the Chief Minister of Tamil Nadu and his government for its inefficiency in curbing the drug menace in the state.
BJD leader Pratap Deb called Pujari's statements unfortunate, emphasizing the need for a permanent resolution as there is BJP governments in Odisha, Chhattisgarh, and the center.
The demand for Odisha Pradesh Congress Committee president Sarat Pattanayak's resignation after the party's poll debacle is growing with some senior party leaders giving voice to it.

President Droupadi Murmu addressed Parliament, emphasizing the integrity of Electronic Voting Machines (EVMs) and their validation by the Supreme Court. She highlighted India's democratic reputation and urged collective efforts to protect electoral trust.

President Droupadi Murmu called the 1975 Emergency a major attack on India's Constitution during her Parliament address. She emphasized that despite numerous challenges, the Constitution has endured and continues to be central to governance. Her remarks come amid ongoing political tensions between BJP and the Opposition.

Sam Pitroda has been reappointed as the Indian Overseas Congress chief after resigning due to a political controversy over his remarks on inheritance tax. The BJP criticized his return, highlighting ongoing tensions in Indian politics.

The INDIA bloc, led by Congress, faces internal discord as allies like DMK and Trinamool Congress diverge on key issues such as the Emergency resolution and Speaker election. Despite attempts at unity, the BJP criticizes their lack of coherence, further highlighted during Lok Sabha's debates and voting processes.

Om Birla, BJP MP from Kota-Bundi, was re-elected as the Lok Sabha Speaker by a voice vote, marking his second consecutive term and making him the first BJP leader to achieve this. Supported by NDA leaders including PM Modi, he received 297 votes against 232 for the opposition's nominee.

IAS officer Pari Bishnoi and her sister, criminal lawyer Payal Bishnoi, have gone viral on social media after a photographer discovered their impressive accomplishments. Pari, who secured AIR-30 in the UPSC exam, serves as Additional District Magistrate in Sikkim.
IAS Pari Bishnoi spotted with Criminal Lawyer sister Payal

IAS officer Pari Bishnoi has left the internet beaming with pride after she was spotted with her sister who is a criminal lawyer in Delhi High Court and Supreme Court. Social media users cannot get enough of the two sisters who screamed ‘true feminism’ with their inspiring achievements in life.

The story began after a random photographer on Instagram @framesbyankit, spotted the two sisters and struck a conversation with them without knowing their identity. He was shocked to know that he was talking to an IAS officer, who secured an AIR-30 in 2020.

The man came to know who he was talking to only after IAS Pari Bishnoi most humbly introduced herself and revealed how she was currently serving as the Additional District Magistrate in Sikkim. Pari also highlighted her unique achievement as one of the first from her community in Rajasthan to clear the UPSC exam.
A post shared by Ankit Kumar (framesbyankit) (@framesbyankit)
Her sister Payal Bishnoi then chimed in, revealing she is a criminal lawyer practicing in the Delhi High Court and Supreme Court.

Sharing his unusual meeting, @framesbyankit wrote, “I met an IAS officer while looking for strangers to shoot. Had a really insightful conversation with her and her sister who is a criminal lawyer. What really inspired her to clear UPSC and become an IAS officer? Watch the Reel to find out and don’t miss the portraits and our selfie in the end.”
As expected, the post went viral with social media users hailing the two sisters are true definition of feminism.
“This is feminism😍!!! Not the ones with GRWM!!” commented a user.

Another user wrote, “Ek to IAS officer uper se beautiful smart cute sanskari ni mtlb kya kese konsi pooja kari gharwalo ne 🙄🙄”               “She was so calm and happy to share her journey and this shows her interactive personality and gratitude even after big achievement.❤️🔥” shared another user.

Author: Supalee Dalai | Credit: IMDb
Let's get into this list of the top 8 Malayalam romantic movies featuring the tales of heart-full love stories that are available on various OTT platforms.
Author: Supalee Dalai | Credit: IMDb
Premam (Hotstar): A rom-com movie, directed by Alphonse Puthren and starring Nivin Pauly and Sai Pallavi, tells the story of a young man and his chance to find true love.
Author: Supalee Dalai | Credit: IMDb
Love Action Drama (Hotstar): Starring Nivin Pauly and Nayanthara in the lead, the movie revolves around a man who does all kinds of actions to impress the girl he wants to marry.
Author: Supalee Dalai | Credit: IMDb
100 Days of Love (Aha, SunNXT): Starring Dulquer Salmaan and Nithya Menen, this rom-com movie centres around a man who falls in love with his childhood friends whom he used to bully.
Author: Supalee Dalai | Credit: IMDb
Thattathin Marayathu (SunNXT): Directed by Vineeth Sreenivasan, the movie depicts the love story between a Hindu boy and a Muslim girl and the disapproval around it.
Author: Supalee Dalai | Credit: IMDb
Maniyarayile Ashokan (Netflix): Starring Jacob Gregory and Anupama Parameswaran, this rom-com movie follows an earnest bachelor who goes to surprising lengths to get his bride.
Author: Supalee Dalai | Credit: IMDb
Ennu Ninte Moideen (Hotstar): Starring Prithviraj Sukumaran and Parvathy Thiruvothu, the movie is set in the 1960s era and is based on the real-love story of Moideen and Kanchanamala.
Author: Supalee Dalai | Credit: IMDb
Pranaya Vilasam (Zee5): A rom-com movie directed by Nikhil Muraly, features love stories of different characters at different stages of their life.
Author: Supalee Dalai | Credit: IMDb
Kappela (Netflix): The movie tells the story of an ordinary girl who falls in love with a rickshaw driver when she overhears his phone call.

A CBI team is expected to visit Patna on Monday and may take those arrested in the NEET-UG paper leak case to Delhi for questioning, officials said. The Officials reported, The Economic Offences Unit (EOU) of the Bihar Police has arrested 18 people in connection with the case so far. CBI officers are likely to collect evidence related to the case from the EOU, which had been investigating the matter until the Centre ordered a probe by the federal agency, they added. The CBI filed an FIR on Sunday in connection with alleged irregularities in medical entrance exam NEET-UG, which was held on May 5, on a reference from the Education Ministry, amid countrywide protests and litigations by students for a probe into the allegations of paper leak. An EOU officer said, The CBI team is expected to visit the EOU office around 11.30 am and collect all evidence, including the pieces of the burnt question paper that was recovered from a house in Patna, mobile phones of those arrested, SIM cards, laptops, post-dated cheques and reference questions papers provided by the National Testing Agency (NTA). All those arrested are in judicial custody in Patna, and the CBI team may take them to Delhi for detailed interrogation by obtaining transit remand from a court here. The CBI may file multiple FIRs in connection with the matter to probe the destruction of evidence, and also register disproportionate assets (DA) cases against some of those accused who are public servants. With a DA case registered against arrested accused Sikander Prasad Yadvendu, a junior engineer in Danapur Town Council, as he reportedly acquired huge assets that are disproportionate to his known source of income. Yadvendu, originally from Samastipur, has been identified as the prime suspect in the case,He has a history of involvement in criminal activities. Before becoming a junior engineer in 2012, he worked as a contractor in Ranchi. He was previously implicated in an LED scam worth Rs 3 crore. He has served a jail sentence for his role in that case.

The Medical Counselling Committee will start the NEET MDS counselling process on July 1, 2024. Candidates can register online until July 7, 2024, with choice filling and locking commencing from July 2. Seat allotment results will be announced on July 10, followed by reporting from July 11 to July 17.
Doctor

The Medical Counselling Committee is to commence the counselling process for the National Eligibility cum Entrance Test for Masters of Dental Surgery (NEET MDS) from July 1, 2024. Interested candidates can apply for the same by visiting the official website.Here are some major key points to keep in mind for the counselling processRegistration DatesThe registration for the first round of counselling will begin on July 1, 2024 and continue until July 7, 2024, up to 12 NOON (server time) but the payment window will remain open till 3 PM (server time). Qualified candidates can register online through the official website, link mcc.nic.in. The process includes registration, payment of the counselling fee, choice filling, and locking of preferences of colleges.Choice filling and lockingThis process helps candidates get a chance to get admitted into their choice of institutes and courses. The choice filling and locking process for NEET MDS will start from July 2, 2024, until July 7, 2024. The option for choice filling will be available till 11:55 PM and the choice locking option will be available from 04:00 PM to 11:55 PM up to July 7, 2024.Process of seat allotmentThe process of seat allotment is to happen on July 8 and July 9, 2024. The seats will be allocated based on the preferences and merit of the candidates.Result announcementThe results of seat allotment will be announced on July 10, 2024. Candidates are advised to prepare for reporting to their respective institutions here onwards.Reporting and joiningCandidates must report to their respective colleges between July 11 to July 17, 2024 along with the documents that need to be verified by the colleges.Verification of data of the new joinersThe institute will start the verification of the data of the newly joined candidates and share the verified data with the MCC from July 18 to July 19, 2024, to update about the admissions.The admission process consists of a total of four rounds including the online stray vacancy round.  The second round of registration will begin on July 22, 2024 and end on July 28, 2024. The choice filling and locking date starts from July 23, 2024, till July 28, 2024. The process of seat allotment will be done on July 29 and 30, 2024, respectively. The result declaration is scheduled for July 31, 2024. Students are to start reporting at their respective colleges between 1st Aug 2024 to 7th Aug 2024. For further information please refer to the official website.

This Privacy Policy is applicable to persons who access, browse or use the Services ("User"). For the purpose of this Policy, wherever the context so requires "you" or "your" shall mean User and the term "we", "us", "our" shall mean Company. 
As we update, improve and expand the Services, this Policy may change, so please refer back to it periodically. By accessing and using the Sites or otherwise using the Services, you consent to collection, storage, and use of the personal information you provide (including any changes thereto as provided by you) for any of the Services that we provide.
The Company respects the privacy of the Users of the Services and is committed to protect it in all respects. The information about the User as collected by the Company is: (a) information supplied by Users and (b) information automatically tracked while navigation (c) information collected from any other source (collectively referred to as "Information").

1. INFORMATION RECEIVED, COLLECTED AND STORED BY THE COMPANY
A. INFORMATION SUPPLIED BY USERS
Registration data:
When you register on the Sites for the Service, we ask that you to provide basic contact information such as your name, sex, age, address, pin code, contact number, occupation, interests and email address etc. When you register using your other accounts like on Facebook, Twitter, Gmail etc. we shall retrieve Information from such accounts to continue to interact with you and to continue providing the Services.
Subscription or paid service data:
When you choose any subscription or paid service provided as part of our Services, we or our payment gateway provider may collect your purchase, address or billing information, including your credit card number and expiration date etc. However, when you order using an in-app purchase option on any of the applications of the Company, same are handled by such mobile operating system platform providers. The subscriptions or paid Services may be on auto renewal mode unless cancelled. If at any point you do not wish to auto-renew your subscription, you may cancel your subscription before the end of the subscription term.
Voluntary information:
We may collect additional information at other times, including but not limited to, when you provide feedback, comments, change your content or email preferences, respond to a survey, or any communications with us.

B. INFORMATION AUTOMATICALLY COLLECTED/ TRACKED WHILE NAVIGATION
Cookies
To improve the responsiveness of the Sites for our Users, we may use "cookies", or similar electronic tools to collect Information to assign each visitor a unique, random number as a User Identification (User ID) to understand the User's individual interests using the identified computer or device. Unless you voluntarily identify yourself (through registration, for example), we will have no way of knowing who you are, even if we assign a cookie to your computer or device. The only personal information a cookie can contain is information you supply. A cookie cannot read data off your hard drive or device. Our advertisers may also assign their own cookies to your browser (if you click on their ads etc.), a process that we do not control. We receive and store certain types of Information whenever you interact with us via Site or Service though your computer/laptop/net book or mobile/tablet/pad/handheld device etc.
Opting out
If a User opts out using the Ads Settings, the unique Double-click cookie ID on the User's browser is overwritten with the phrase "OPT_OUT". Because there is no longer a unique cookie ID, the opt-out cookie can't be associated with a particular browser. 
Log File Information
We automatically collect limited information about your computer's connection to the Internet, mobile number, including your IP address, when you visit our site, application or service. Your IP address is a number that lets computers attached to the Internet know where to send you data -- such as the pages you view. We automatically receive and log information from your browser, including your IP address, your computer's name, your operating system, browser type and version, CPU speed, and connection speed. We may also collect log information from your device, including your location, IP address, your device's name, device's serial number or unique identification number (e.g.. UDiD on your iOS device), your device operating system, browser type and version, CPU speed, and connection speed etc.
Clear GIFs
We may use "clear GIFs" (Web Beacons) to track the online usage patterns of our Users in an anonymous manner, without personally identifying the User. We may also use clear GIFs in HTML-based emails sent to our Users to track which emails are opened by recipients. We use this information to inter-alia deliver our web pages to you upon request, to tailor our Sites or Service to the interests of our users, to measure traffic within our Sites to improve the quality, functionality and interactivity of our Sites and let advertisers know the geographic locations from where our Users come without personally identifying the Users.

2. Information from other Sources:
We may receive information about you from other sources, add it to our account information and treat it in accordance with this Policy. If you provide information to the platform provider or other partner, whom we provide services, your account information and order information may be passed on to us. 
Demographic and other information:
We may reference other sources of demographic and other information in order to provide you with more targeted communications and promotions. We use Google Analytics, among others, to track the user behaviour on our Sites. Google Analytics specifically has been enabled to support display advertising towards helping us gain understanding of our users' demographics and interests. The reports are anonymous and cannot be associated with any individual personally identifiable information that you may have shared with us. You can opt-out of Google Analytics for display advertising and customize Google Display Network ads using the Ads Settings options provided by Google.
LINKS TO THIRD PARTY SITES / AD-SERVERS
The Sites may include links to other websites or applications. Such websites or applications are governed by their respective privacy policies, which are beyond our control. Once you leave our servers (you can tell where you are by checking the URL in the location bar on your browser), use of any information you provide is governed by the privacy policy of the operator of the application, you are visiting. That privacy policy may differ from ours. If you can't find the privacy policy of any of these sites via a link from the application's homepage, you should contact the application owners directly for more information.
When we present Information to our advertisers -- to help them understand our audience and confirm the value of advertising on our Sites -- it is usually in the form of aggregated statistics on traffic to various pages / content within our Sites. We use third-party advertising companies to serve ads when you visit our Sites. These companies may use Information (excluding your name, address, email address or telephone number or other personally identifiable information) about your visits to this and other websites or application, in order to provide advertisements about goods and services of interest to you.
We do not provide any personally identifiable information to third party websites / advertisers / ad-servers without your consent.

INFORMATION USE BY THE COMPANY
The information as supplied by the users enables us to improve the Services and provide you the most user-friendly experience. In some cases/provision of certain service(s) or utility(ies), we may require your contact address as well. All required Information is service dependent and the Company may use the above said user Information to, maintain, protect, and improve the Services (including advertising and personalisation on the Sites) and for developing new services. We may also use your email address or other personally identifiable information to send commercial or marketing messages about our Services and/or such additional updates and features about third parties products and services with an option to subscribe / unsubscribe (where feasible). We may, however, use your email address for non-marketing or administrative purposes (such as notifying you of major changes, for customer service purposes, billing, etc.). 
Any personally identifiable information provided by you will not be considered as sensitive if it is freely available and / or accessible in the public domain like any comments, messages, blogs, scribbles available on social platforms like Facebook, twitter etc.
Any posted/uploaded/conveyed/communicated by users on the public sections of the Sites becomes published content and is not considered personally identifiable information subject to this Policy.
In case you choose to decline to submit personally identifiable information on the Sites, we may not be able to provide certain services on the Sites to you. We will make reasonable efforts to notify you of the same at the time of opening your account. In any case, we will not be liable and or responsible for the denial of certain services to you for lack of you providing the necessary personal information.
When you register with the Sites or Services, we contact you from time to time about updating of your personal information to provide the Users such features that we believe may benefit / interest you.

3. INFORMATION SHARING
The Company shares your Information with any third party without obtaining the prior consent of the User in the following limited circumstances:
a) When it is requested or required by law or by any court or governmental agency or authority to disclose, for the purpose of verification of identity, or for the prevention, detection, investigation including but not limited to cyber incidents, or for prosecution and punishment of offences. These disclosures are made in good faith and belief that such disclosure is reasonably necessary for enforcing these Terms or for complying with the applicable laws and regulations.
b) The Company proposes to share such Information to conduct its business and to share such Information within its group companies and officers and employees of such group companies for the purpose of processing personal information on its behalf. We also ensure that these recipients of such Information agree to process such information based on our instructions and in compliance with this Policy and any other appropriate confidentiality and security measures.
c) The Company may present Information to our advertisers and third parties - to help them understand our audience and confirm the value of advertising on our Sites – however it is usually in the form of aggregated statistics on traffic to various pages within our site.
d) The Company may share your Information regarding your activities on Sites with third party social websites to populate your social wall that is visible to other people however you will have an option to set your privacy settings, where you can decide what you would like to share or not to share with others.
e) We may share your Information to enforce or protect our rights or any or all of its affiliates, associates, employees, directors or officers or when we have reason to believe that disclosing Information of User(s) is necessary to identify, contact or bring legal action against someone who may be causing interference with our rights or our Sites, whether intentionally or otherwise, or when anyone else could be harmed by such activities.

4. ACCESSING AND UPDATING PERSONAL INFORMATION
When you use the Services or Sites (or any of its sub sites), we make good faith efforts to provide you, as and when requested by you, with access to your personal information and shall further ensure that any personal information or sensitive personal data or information found to be inaccurate or deficient shall be corrected or amended as feasible, subject to any requirement for such personal information or sensitive personal data or information to be retained by law or for legitimate business purposes. We ask individual users to identify themselves and the information requested to be accessed, corrected or removed before processing such requests, and we may decline to process requests that are unreasonably repetitive or systematic, require disproportionate technical effort, jeopardize the privacy of others, or would be extremely impractical (for instance, requests concerning information residing on backup tapes), or for which access is not otherwise required. In any case, where we provide information access and correction, we perform this service free of charge, except if doing so would require a disproportionate effort. Because of the way we maintain certain services, after you delete your information, residual copies may take a period of time before they are deleted from our active servers and may remain in our backup systems.

5. INFORMATION SECURITY
We take appropriate security measures to protect against unauthorized access to or unauthorized alteration, disclosure or destruction of data. These include internal reviews of our data collection, storage and processing practices and security measures, including appropriate encryption and physical security measures to guard against unauthorized access to systems where we store personal data. All information gathered from the website is securely stored within the Company controlled database. The database is stored on servers secured behind a firewall; access to the servers is password-protected and is strictly limited. However, as effective as our security measures are, no security system is impenetrable. We cannot guarantee the security of our database, nor can we guarantee that information you supply will not be intercepted while being transmitted to us over the Internet. And, of course, any information you include in a posting to the discussion areas is available to anyone with Internet access.
We use third-party advertising companies to serve ads when you visit or use our Sites or Services. These companies may use information (excluding your name, address, email address or telephone number or any personally identifiable information) about your visits or use to particular website, mobile application or services, in order to provide advertisements about goods and services of interest to you.

6. UPDATES / CHANGES
The internet is an ever evolving medium. We may alter our Policy from time to time to incorporate necessary changes in technology, applicable law or any other variant. In any case, we reserve the right to change (at any point of time) the terms of this Policy or the Terms of Use. Any changes we make will be effective immediately on notice, which we may give by posting the new policy on the Sites. Your use of the Sites or Services after such notice will be deemed acceptance of such changes.
We may also make reasonable efforts to inform you via electronic mail. In any case, you are advised to review this Policy periodically on the Sites to ensure that you are aware of the latest version.

7. QUESTIONS / GRIEVANCE REDRESSAL
Redressal Mechanism: Any complaints, abuse or concerns with regards to the use, processing and disclosure of Information provided by you or breach of these terms should immediately be informed to the designated Grievance Officers, the list of respective grievance officers is being provided in Terms of Use via in writing or through email signed with the electronic signature to ______________ or ("Grievance Officer")
Grievance Officer: _______________
ODISHA TELEVISION LIMITED
N 28/30-1, Chandaka Industrial Estate, Patia, Bhubaneswar, Khurda. Odisha
Pin 751024
 Ph. +91 99382 23312
We can be reached by e-mail at info@odishatv.com
We request you to please provide the following information in your complaint:-
a) Identification of the information provided by you;
b) Clear statement as to whether the information is personal information or sensitive personal information;
c) Your address, telephone number or e-mail address;
d) A statement that you have a good-faith belief that the information has been processed incorrectly or disclosed without authorization, as the case may be;
e) A statement, under penalty of perjury, that the information in the notice is accurate, and that the information being complained about belongs to you;
f) You may also contact us in case you have any questions / suggestions about the Policy using the contact information mentioned above.
The Company may reach out to you to confirm or discuss certain details about your complaint and issues raised. 
The Company shall not be responsible for any communication, if addressed, to any non-designated person in this regard.

The examination aims to assess a student's eligibility to enrol into either of the 46 Central universities for undergraduate courses.
The National Testing Agency announced the revised rank list for the medical entrance exam NEET-UG on Monday, July 1, 2024.

IAS officer Pari Bishnoi and her sister, criminal lawyer Payal Bishnoi, have gone viral on social media after a photographer discovered their impressive accomplishments. Pari, who secured AIR-30 in the UPSC exam, serves as Additional District Magistrate in Sikkim.

The National Testing Agency (NTA) has declared the revised results and ranks for all candidates of NEET UG 2024, including those who took the re-test. Candidates can check their updated scores on the official website.
The National Testing Agency (NTA) on Friday announced new dates for the recently cancelled NCET, Joint CSIR-UGC NET, and UGC-NET June 2024 cycle examinations.

The National Testing Agency (NTA) has announced new examination dates for the NCET, Joint CSIR-UGC NET, and UGC-NET June 2024 cycle exams. The revised schedule includes NCET on July 10, Joint CSIR-UGC NET on July 25-27, and UGC-NET between August 21 and September 4.

The Medical Counselling Committee will start the NEET MDS counselling process on July 1, 2024. Candidates can register online until July 7, 2024, with choice filling and locking commencing from July 2. Seat allotment results will be announced on July 10, followed by reporting from July 11 to July 17.

The NEET UG re-examination for 1563 students was held on June 23, 2024, due to initial discrepancies. The results are set to be released on June 30, 2024. Despite grace marks being awarded, only 813 students appeared for the re-test.

The Central Board of Secondary Education will soon release the CTET July 2024 admit card. The exam is scheduled for July 7, 2024, and candidates can download their admit cards from ctet.nic.in. The exam determines eligibility for teaching positions in government schools and has specific reporting times and requirements.

The NEET PG 2024 exam has been postponed, with new dates expected soon following discrepancies in previous exams. A high-level committee led by Dr. K Radhakrishnan aims to reform exam processes and address malpractices.
Ravenshaw University in Cuttack has released the highest cut-offs in the Arts, Science (Physical & Biological) and Commerce streams.
Odisha's Education Minister Nityananda Gond vows strict action against anyone found involved in the corruption in the 5T School initiative.

Akash Chavda from Jamnagar, Gujarat, overcame personal tragedies including the loss of his parents to clear the prestigious UPSC exam without formal coaching. Growing up in a hostel as an orphan, Akash's determination and support from his cousin helped him achieve remarkable success.

All schools in Odisha will return to their normal schedules starting tomorrow, as announced by Education Minister Nityananda Gond. This change follows improved weather conditions, allowing a shift from the heatwave-induced morning classes. Additionally, the government plans significant educational reforms, particularly in mathematics.

The Odisha Joint Entrance Exam (OJEE) for 2024 has released admit cards for its second phase. Scheduled from June 24-27, the exams span various courses including engineering and MBA. The exams are split into three daily shifts, with specific timings outlined. A unique marking scheme is applied, and steps for admit card download are provided.

Tensions flared in Belanta village, Cuttack, after a violent clash led to bombs being hurled. Several people were injured, and police have been deployed to maintain order. The incident follows earlier conflicts during Holi.

A police constable, Lokanath, stabbed his wife Mamatha to death at the SP's office in Hassan district, Karnataka. The incident was triggered by a family dispute. Despite being rushed to the hospital, Mamatha succumbed to her injuries. Lokanath fled the scene and police are actively searching for him.

Food safety officials in Karnataka have discovered cancer-causing chemicals in Pani Puris. Out of 260 samples, 41 tested positive for carcinogenic agents like brilliant blue, sunset yellow, and tartrazine. Additionally, 18 samples were deemed unfit for consumption. The government warns of strict action against vendors violating food safety regulations.

The National Investigation Agency (NIA) arrested two individuals linked to Hizb-ut-Tahrir after extensive searches across Tamil Nadu. The accused, identified as Abdul Rehman and Mujibur Rehman Altham Sahib, were involved in radicalizing youth with extremist ideologies and promoting anti-Indian sentiments. Digital devices and incriminating documents were seized during the raid.

Lucknow's cyber unit has made its first 'digital arrest' by apprehending three criminals posing as CBI officers. This group defrauded a woman of Rs 2.71 crore and a man of Rs 43 lakh through threats and fake financial crime allegations.

Police visited BJD leader Raghunandan Das' residence for the second time regarding allegations of setting his dogs on a lady journalist. The incident occurred while she was covering a demolition near his house.

An IAS aspirant in New Delhi was scammed of Rs 1.2 lakh after being lured to a cafe by a woman he met on Tinder. The woman, named Versha, left under the pretext of a family emergency, leaving the victim with an exorbitant bill. Investigations revealed a gang running similar schemes across major cities.
New revelations expose how Japa Bandhu Kampa defrauded job seekers in Odisha, linking him to a BJD MP.

As per reports, there was a heated exchange between both students over a trivial issue in the school. Subsequently, one among them lost his cool and stabbed the other with a sharp-edged weapon causing grievous injury.

Odisha Industries Minister Sampad Chandra Swain stated that the truth behind the alleged land grab by KISS will be revealed after a probe. RTI activists have demanded a thorough investigation into the matter involving former BJD MP Achyuta Samanta and previous government officials.

Punjab Police have arrested three associates of gangsters Lawrence Bishnoi and Goldy Brar, preventing potential target killings. The suspects, Karandeep Singh, Raghuveer Singh, and Kulwinder Singh, were caught with weapons in Bathinda following an intelligence tip-off.
Ex-CBI Director M Nageswara Rao has alleged a Rs 250 crore government land scam in Odisha, involving high-ranking IPS and IAS officers.
OSAA seeks the Chief Minister's intervention in illegal land acquisition in Bhubaneswar.
In Garasang village, Balasore, Ramesh Behera allegedly killed his father Pravakar over a land dispute and buried the body. The case deepened with the disappearance of Pravakar's wife, Champa.

In Bhubaneswar, Smruti Rekha Pani and her boyfriend staged her kidnapping to extort Rs 1 crore from her brother. The plot was uncovered after police intervention led to their arrest and the recovery of incriminating items like a car and electronic devices.

Ratna Bhandar, the treasure trove of Lord Jagannath, will be opened soon, said Odisha Chief Minister Mohan Majhi on Sunday. He said this while addressing a special function organised in Bhubaneswar to felicitate newly elected BJP MPs and MLAs. The chief minister made it clear that stern action would be taken against those found guilty in Ratna Bhandar lapses.During his address, Majhi cited that earlier no funds were allocated neither was any work done to streamline rituals and other Puri Jagannath temple management. In the first cabinet of the new govt, the BJP announced Rs 500 corpus fund. Speaking on the occasion, Odisha BJP president Manmohan Samal thanked the 4.5 crore Odia people for bringing change in the government. Samal said that with the blessings of the people, the BJP will work hard and strengthen the organisation so much that nobody would dare to shake the government in the next 25-30 years.

Cuttack is known as the Millennium City as well as the Silver City due to its history of 1000 years and famous silver filigree works. It is considered as the judicial capital of Odisha as the Odisha High Court is located here. It is also the old capital city of Odisha.The remains of the famous Barabati fort are still speaks the history of the millennium city. Cuttack has a rich maritime history which says that the traders’ sons (Sadhab pua) use to go to Java Sumatra Island to do business and brings lot of wealth here. To recollect this history every year Baliyatra, a weeklong festival is being organized here. Cuttack is the birth place of Subash Chandra Bose. Cuttack has so many special thing to know like here the feeling of sahi -bhai (Neighborhood) is very strong .Cuttack Khati (where group of friends, or people chatting on variety of subjects) is also very popular .Cuttack‘s delicious Dahibara- Allodium attracts many.
